loans.name: Angelina

texts.en: Angelina is a struggling widow with 6 children. Angelina is 70 years old. She sells ice fish in retail to her customers in Lagos state, Nigeria. She hopes for a loan of N50,000 to purchase more ice fish to sell. She is indeed grateful to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more ice fish to sell.

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en:
Lolita A. is one of the best performing members of ASHI (Ahon Sa Hirap, Inc.), an MFI and KIVA partner in the Philippines since 1995, from the time she joined the institution. She is 58 years old and mother to six children. She is strong in facing trials of life even though she is widowed already. She lives in the island village-Malacaban, Binangonan, Rizal province.
She uses her capital wisely and really invested it in a profitable business. Before, they were making chairs sets made of bamboos. Now they shifted their business into a fish cage (fishpond) where they cultivate fish fries (fingerlings) until they are ready to be harvested and sold in the market. For her loan, she proposes an amount of 25,000 pesos to pay for 20,000 pesos worth of fishnets and 5,000 pesos worth of fish fries (fingerlings) as her primary business.
They been doing the business for more than a year already and they want to invest more in it. She is positive that with the help of her children, they can make their business grow and it could give them back enough proceeds for their family needs. To help her grandchildren with their school fees is also one of her top dreams.

loans.use: To purchase fish nets and fingerlings

loans.name: Psalm 23 Group

texts.en:
Agnes is 50 years old. She is a married mother of three children. All her children are in school in the community where they live. She and her husband and children live together. She works hard to provide food and school fees for the children. She is a qualified teA. and this has given her the opportunity to understand the importance of education. She is providing all educational support to the children. In spite of the challenges she faces, she has been a baker for 12 years. Using flour for her production, she prepares bread and sells it to her customers. She supplies bread by herself in the market center to her customers. And people also come to her to buy. Her only problem now has to do with adequate funds to buy raw materials as prices are going up. She requests loan support to remain in business.           

She is the leader of a trust bank group called ‘Psalm 23’. She is the one in front in the group photograph. Most of the members of this group are petty traders, food vendors and/or farmers. In this group, members guarantee for one another as social collateral to access the loan and there is peer pressure to repay the loan.

loans.use: To buy baking materials like bags of flour, sugar, margarine, yeast and firewood, etc.

loans.name: Massesegbeh Group

texts.en:
Here are the members of the Massesegbeh loan group. They are small-scale business people in Magburaka town in northern Sierra Leone. They have come to SMT/Kiva for the first time to seek a loan of Le 2,500,000 to help them improve their businesses. 

Abdul K. is the leader of this group. Abdul is forty years of age. He is married and has six children. He was born in Magburaka town. Abdul is a vehicle driver and has been in the transportation business for over ten years. Abdul will invest this loan in his transportation business.

loans.use: Invest in his business

loans.name: María Felícita

texts.es:
La señora MARIA FELICITA R. A., tiene 51 años, vive en el distrito de Moche , provincia de Trujillo, departamento La Libertad – Perú.
Pertenece al Banco Comunal LOS JAZMINES
La empresaria presenta estudios hasta 5º de secundaria, tiene  4 hijos, pero solo 2 hijos dependen económicamente de ella, porque aun se encuentran en el colegio.
María Felícita se dedica a dar servicio de corte de cabello, hacer peinados, tratamientos faciales, manicure, pedicure, todo esto en su salón de belleza, el cual funciona en su casa.
Su primer crédito fue de 300 nuevos soles lo invertió en la compra de espejos, tijeras, liquido de ondulación, etc. 
Este crédito de 800 nuevos soles lo utilizará para comprar líquidos, cremas, esmaltes, accesorios, etc.
María Felicita, sueña con abrir otro centro de belleza en el centro de Trujillo.
texts.en:
Mrs. María Felícita Rodríguez A. is 51 years old and lives in the Moche district, Trujillo province, department of La Libertad, Peru. She is a member of the Los Jazmines Communal Bank. María Felícita is a businesswoman who completed her studies through the fifth year of high school and has four children, but only two of them depend on her financially because they are still in school. Her work includes giving haircuts, hairstyles, facial treatments, manicures, and pedicures, all at a beauty salon located in her home. She invested her first loan of 300 nuevos soles in the purchase of mirrors, scissors, perm solution, etc. She will use this loan of 800 nuevos soles to buy solutions, creams, nail polish, accessories, etc. María Felícita dreams of opening another beauty center in downtown Trujillo.

Translated from Spanish by Amanda McDermott, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy solutions, creams, nail polish, accessories, etc.

loans.name: Loveth

texts.en:
Loveth sells yams and she hails from Edo State, Nigeria. She is 48 years old and is married with four children.

Loveth hopes for the loan of N60,000 to purchase more yams to sell. She thanks you.

loans.use: To purchase more yams to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase shop items in bulk for her business

loans.name: Johnbosco

texts.en: Johnbosco is a 47-year-old mason who also sells livestock. He has been in this business for five years. He runs his business in Machakos, a busy market town near Nairobi. He is requesting a loan of Kes 20,000 to buy goats for sale. A father of six, Johnbosco hopes to grow his business from just selling goats to selling cows and bulls in large numbers and supplying livestock to Kenya Meat Commission for slaughter. This loan will go a long way in facilitating this dream. He describes himself as confident and determined. About Faulu Kenya: Faulu Kenya aims to empower Kenyans by providing relevant financial solutions. Faulu is a sustainable and profitable microfinance institution that offers savings and credit services to over 225,000 Kenyans. Faulu recently became the first MFI in Kenya to be licensed as a Deposit-Taking Micro-Finance Company, which will enable Faulu to better serve its clients.

loans.use: To buy goats to sell

loans.name: Janeth Erlinda

texts.es:
La señora JANETH ERLINDA C. C. , tiene  41 años, vive en el distrito de Las Delicias, provincia de Trujillo, departamento La Libertad – Perú. La socia pertenece al Banco Comunal SIEMPRE UNIDAS. Ella presenta estudios  superiores de enfermería técnica, pero no pudo ejercer porque al finalizar su ultimo ciclo su madre se enfermo gravemente y después falleció y no pudo obtener su titulo por motivos económicos ella empezó a trabajar como vendedora de ropa. Ella tiene 3 hijas pequeñas en edad escolar quienes dependen  económicamente de ella por ese motivo ella se dedica a la venta de pollo y gas en el mercado cercano a su casa en compañía de su esposo.
Con su primer crédito de 300.00 nuevos soles compro gas al por mayor para empezar a vender.
Con este crédito de 300.00 nuevos soles comprará pollos  para vender en el mercado y así obtener dinero para cubrir las necesidades de sus hijas.
Janeth sueña con aumentar sus vetas y poder llegar a tener su tienda de productos alimenticios para así poder obtener mayores ganancias.
texts.en:
JANETH ERLINDA C. C. , 41, lives in the Las Delicias district, Trujillo province, La Libertad department, Perú. She is a member of the SIEMPRE UNIDAS (ALWAYS UNITED) communal bank. She studied to be a technical nurse but was unable to work in her profession because during her last school term her mother became gravely ill and subsequently passed away precluding her finishing her studies and graduating. Economic necessity pushed her into clothing sales. She has three young school-age daughters who depend upon her economically. For this reason, she, together with her husband, sells gas and chickens in the local market near her home. With her first 300 sol loan she bought gas at wholesale to begin her sales. With this 300 new sol loan she will buy chickens to sell in the market thereby earning profits sufficient to cover her daughters' needs. Janeth dreams with increasing her sales enough to have her own grocery store to earn still better profits.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy wholesale chickens.

loans.name: Beatriz

texts.en:
Beatriz F. is 69 years old and lives with her husband Felix, 72, in Malibay, Pasay City. All eight of their children are now working.

Beatriz has been buying and selling ready-made curtains for walls, windows, and doors for eight years. She also has cuts and designs for bus and truck windows. She earns at least 12,000 PHP net income per month. She uses her profits to augment her husband’s income, and has also been able to renovate their old house.

Beatriz has been with Kiva partner, the Center for Community Transformation (CCT) Credit Cooperative, since 2001. She is now in need of a new loan of 15,000 PHP as additional capital for her curtain business.

About CCT
The Center for Community Transformation (CCT) is an organized Christian response against poverty and social injustice. This is carried out through the fusion of social development initiatives and evangelical mission in a uniquely Filipino context. It serves urban and rural poor communities throughout the Philippines, in pursuit of its desire to see changed lives, strong families, and transformed communities centered in the Lordship of Jesus Christ. CCT is a member of the Five Talents family.

loans.use: To buy more curtains of various designs

loans.name: Juntos Podemos Group

texts.en:
The members of our group, Juntos Podemos (Together We Can), are clients of Asociación Arariwa.  This communal bank consists of 13 members in Cusco.  There are 10 women and 3 men. All the group members live in Santiago and San Sebastian, which are neighborhoods in Cusco.  Some are married with kids while others are single.

The members of Juntos Podemos are involved in various commercial activities, including selling foodstuff such as potatoes and fruit as well as artesanía.  One of the members, Xiomara, was born in Cusco and lives in San Sebastian.  She is 35 years old.  She is married and has three children.  Together with her family she sells fruit in the Mercado Ferial (weekly market), in San Sebastian, and has been doing so for 13 years, since she was a little girl.  She sells approximately 3,200 soles per month, which is the equivalent of $1100.  She will invest in buying more fruit to sell.

All of the members of Juntos Podemos appreciate and thank you for the loan and promise to pay the monthly payments on time.

loans.use: Business capital such as buying more fruit to sell

loans.name: Remedios

texts.en:
Remedios R. is from the village of Cabuan, Guoinsiliban Camiguin Province. She is 46 years old. Remedios is widowed and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Remedios owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector operating a specialized retail business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling "suka", or coconut vinegar, in the local community. Remedios has been engaged in her business for over 9 years and earns approximately 8,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Remedios joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Remedios has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from HSPFI. Remedios is requesting a loan of 7,000 PHP which will be used to purchase more materials for her vinegar making business. This loan will be the 3rd loan taken out by Remedios from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase more materials for her vinegar making business

loans.name: Ohene Ba Group

texts.en: Mary is a thirty-six year old married mother of four children. All of her children are in school. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in a commercially-dominated community. Mary is a food vendor. She prepares and sells rice porridge. Mary is the leader of a trust bank group called ‘Ohene ba’, literally meaning "prince/princess". The members of the group are mainly merchants. They are hard working, trust themselves and want the loan to invest in their businesses. Mary, the group leader, is seated.

loans.use: To buy stock

loans.name: Navidad Group

texts.es: El banco comunal “Navidad” esta representada por la señora Teresa  y conformada por 17 miembros 13 mujeres y 4  varones que van cursando su primer ciclo pero en las reuniones demuestran ser personas muy activas y solidA.. Entre las actividades que realizan podemos mencionar  la venta de cosméticos venta de comida y la elaboración de chorizos caseros, la venta de carne, sandalias  y los señores trabajan como A.ñiles y en el transporte de pasajeros dentro de la localidad de portachuelo. La competencia esta realmente muy difícil, especialmente en la venta de comida y en la venta de cosméticos, ya que cada socia espera cada día mejorar sus ventas, existe una gran competencia ya que las socias ya que las socias no cuentan con puestos fijos de venta, al contrario, ellos salen a ofrecer sus productos de forma ambulante para así poder tener una mejor ganancia durante el día. El destino de crédito es para la compra de mercadería para incrementar sus ventas, así como la compra de insumos para la venta de comida y la reparación de sus vehículos, los dedicados a la A.ñilería desean comprar herramientas de trabajo para acelera su trabajo y generar mayores ganancias para el sustento de sus hijos. La mayoría de las socias son personas, nuevas que ya conocen el producto por lo que se encuentran entusiasmados por el apoyo económico ya que muchos de ellos tienen grandes proyectos que desean realizar a futuro y saben que si cumplen con sus pagos en forma responsable contaran con el apoyo de la fundación siempre que lo requieran.
texts.en:
The “Navidad” communal bank is represented by Teresa and is made up of 17 members, 13 women and 4 men, in their first cycle. In meetings, they demonstrate that they are active and unified people. Amongst the things they do, we can mention the sale of cosmetics, food sales, sausage production, meat sales, sandals, men that work as bricklayers, and passenger transportation within the neighborhood of Portachuelo. The competition is really quite difficult, especially in food and cosmetic sales, so that every member hopes every day to increase her sales. There is high competition, so the members don’t have permanent shops. Instead, they travel for their sales so that they can make higher earnings throughout the day. The loan is for the purchase of merchandise to increase their sales, as well as the purchase of consumables for food sales, the repair of vehicles, and those that are bricklayers want to purchase tools of their trade to speed up their work and generate better incomes for their children. A majority of the members are new and are already familiar with the product. They are enthusiastic about the economic help, as many of them have big projects that they want to realize in the future and know that if they complete their payment responsibly, they can count on the support of the foundation whenever they will need it.

Translated from Spanish by Rebecca Towle, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Euloly

texts.es:
La Sra. Euloly, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Las Brisas” vive en el Barrio Intiyacu del  Distrito de Bellavista, Provincia de Bellavista, Departamento de San Martín. Es Casada, tiene 43 años y 03 hijos, 01  que aun depende de ella, por lo que Euloly, trabaja muy duro día a día, presenta estudios hasta tercer año de secundaria.

Su carácter emprendedor y el amor a su familia le motivaron a iniciar su propio negocio de venta de abarrotes, siempre con el apoyo de su esposo, que poco a poco fue aumentando y ganando experiencia en este tipo de actividad, haciéndose muy conocida y querida entre sus clientes, nos cuenta que se inicio con la venta de panes.
Con su primer crédito de 200 Nuevos Soles, compró: chizitos en paquetes, lejía, leche, té  en cajas, dulces y algunas golosinas. En la actualidad tiene sus clientes fijos que a diario acuden a su negocio a comprar donde cuenta con todo lo que el ama de casa necesita. 

Con este crédito de S/ 1,500.00 Nuevos Soles ,comprará arroz y azúcar en sacos, fideos en paquetes, leche y conservas de pescado en cajas y en variedad de marcas, huevos en javas y artículos de higiene personal para continuar dando una mejor atención a sus clientes. 

Euloly, se siente muy agradecida con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos, y desea seguir cumpliendo sus metas y sueños.
texts.en:
Euloly, 43, is a member of the "Las Brisas" communal bank. She lives in the Intiyacu neighborhood, Bellavista district, Bellavista Province, San Martín department. She is married and has three children, one of whom is still dependent on her and in the 9th grade, thus the reason why Euloly works hard every day. Motivated by her enterprising spirit and love for her family, she started her own grocery store, always supported in this effort by her husband. Gradually, she increased her experience and she became better-known and liked by her customers; she tells us that she began selling just bread. She used her first, 200 new sol, loan to buy packages of puffed cheese snacks, chlorine bleach, milk, boxed tea and some sweets. Currently, she has regular customers who come daily to buy because she stocks everything a housewife might need. She will use this new, 1500 new sol, loan to buy sacks of rice and sugar, packages of pasta, boxed milk and preserved fish of various brands, crates of eggs and personal hygiene items to continue to provide better service to her customers. Euloly is very grateful to the Manuela Ramos Movement and hopes to continue reaching her goals and dreams.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy stock items for her store.

loans.name: Nenita

texts.en:
Mrs. Nenita P. is from the village of Bigaan, Baliangao, Misamis Occidental. She is married and blessed with two school-aged children. She owns and operates a business selling dried goods in the local community. She earns 3,500 PHP monthly net income from her business. Nenita P. is requesting a new loan of 14,900 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional inventory & working capital. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: Additional capital for her business

loans.name: Reyna

texts.es:
Reyna es socia del Banco Comunal Urubamba.
Reyna es casada, tiene 37 años y 6 hijos, Reyna junto a su esposo son artesanos, realizan trabajos en telar como pasadizos. Además Reyna se dedica a la compra y venta de ganado en la feria de la región.
Reyna necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de hilos.
Los sueños de Reyna son que sus hijos sean profesionales y construir una casa para cada hijo.
texts.en:
Reyna is a member of the community bank Urubamba. Reyna is married, 37-years old and has 6 children; Reyna and her husband are artisans and they make weavings, like hallway runners. Additionally, Reyna buys and sells cattle in the local fair. Reyna needs a loan of 1000 Soles; the money will be invested in the purchase of threads. Reyna’s dreams are that her children become professionals, and to build a house for each one of her children.

Translated from Spanish by Carlos Morales, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy threads.

loans.name: Celia

texts.es:
Celia, tiene 58 años y tiene ocho hijos. Celia es una madre responsable y trabajadora que se dedica a  la venta de artesanía de tipo muñequería, ella tiene un pequeño taller donde confecciona sus productos, ella nos cuenta que se levanta muy temprano para hacer sus actividades del hogar y después sale a vender sus productos. Ya son de 8 a 10 años que se dedica al negocio y le ha ido muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo, la socia esta sacando adelante a sus hijos y quiere darles una profesión para que ellos se puedan defenderse mejor en la vida. Celia nos cuenta que por esta oportunidad le hicieron una contrata de 50 a 100 artesanías para mandar a la ciudad de Lima y en otras ocasiones exportó sus productos al país de Estados Unidos, ella requiere el préstamo para comprar materiales de trabajo como por ejemplo tela, algodón, lana y mantas. 
 
La socia se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Celia, age 58, has 8 children. She is a responsible and hard-working mother who sells handmade dolls. She has a small workshop where she makes her products. She wakes up very early in order to do work around the house and later leaves to sell her wares. It has been 8 or 10 years since she has been in business, and it has served her well thanks to all of the effort she applies to her work. This community bank member has been able to move her children forward and hopes to see them in jobs where they can get by better in their lives. Celia says that this opportunity has given her a contract to send 50 to 100 pieces of work to the city of Lima and, on other occasions, export her products to the United States. She is requesting this loan in order to buy materials for her work, such as cloth, cotton, wool, and fabric. This member considers herself grateful for the opportunity made available in this way and likewise pledges to make her repayments in accordance with her timeline.

Translated from Spanish by Sarah Merchlewitz, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For the puchase of materials needed for her work -- for example, cloth cotton, wool, and fabric

loans.name: Sandagsuren

texts.en: Sandagsuren is 52 years old and lives with his wife and daughter in Hovd province, Mongolia.  He and his family live together in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent. Sandagsuren operates a plumbing service in his town. He has been operating his business since 1994, and has a loyal customer base because of his good service. Sandagsuren's business is seasonal, and he does not operate the plumbing service during the winter. Because of this, he started working with his wife in the local food market in 2007 in order to earn extra income for his family.  They rent the counter space for their food sales.  In addition, Sandagsuren usually runs a small grocery store in his yard, but has recently stopped temporarily because of low inventory turnover.  With spring coming,  he is concentrating back on his plumbing service and he is requesting a 500,000 MNT loan to purchase the equipment necessary to expand and improve his plumbing business. Besides running his businesses, Sandagsuren is a good husband and father and he says, "My children have all grown up and found their way in life except for my youngest daughter. I would like to be able to financially support her future life."

loans.use: To purchase plumbing equipment.

loans.name: Querer Es Poder Group

texts.es:
Este banco comunal es llamado “Querer es Poder” y está conformado por 16 socias, pertenecientes a la comuna de Lautaro, a 30 km al norte de la ciudad de Temuco. 
Ellos se dedican principalmente a peluquería, centro de llamados, venta de ropa usada, plásticos y a la producción y venta de mermeladas y postres.
La socia entrevistada fue Erika, quien es la tesorera de este grupo. En la foto se encuentra en la última fila, al centro y tiene su brazo levantado. Ella se dedica a la venta de ropa usada en la feria y en su casa.  
Su sueño es tener un negocio establecido en su propia casa, ya que ella es quien mantiene su hogar y a sus dos pequeños hijos de 11 y 7 años, de esta manera tendría más tiempo para cuidar de ellos. Erika invertirá este préstamo en ropa usada para continuar con su negocio. 
A Erika le gustan mucho los talleres de estrategias de venta que le proporciona Fondo Esperanza.
Temuco es la capital de la región de la Araucanía. La ciudad se ubica a 670 kilómetros al sur de Santiago (capital de Chile) y posee una serie de balnearios lacustres y una flora y fauna nativa muy llamativas. Cabe destacar que en esta región habita el 50% de los mapuches, pueblo indígena, existente en nuestro país.
texts.en:
This communal bank is called “Querer es Poder” (To Care is To Be Able) and is made up of 16 members, all belonging to the Lautaro community, 30km north of the city of Temuco. The members have a variety of occupations such as hairdressing, working in a telephone call center, selling used clothing and plastic items and the production and sales of jams and desserts. The member that was interviewed was Erika, the treasurer of the group. In the photo, she is in the back row, in the center and she has her arm raised. She sells used clothing in the market and out of her home. Her dream is to own an established business in her own home. She has two small children, ages 11 and 7, and by working from home she would have more time to raise them. Erika will use this loan to buy more used clothing in order to continue her business. Erika really enjoys the selling strategies workshops put on by Fondo Esperanza. Temuco is the capital of the Araucanía region and is located 670 kilometers south of Santiago (the capital of Chile). The area has several lake-side spa resorts and striking native flora and fauna. The region is also noteworthy for being home to 50% of the existing indigenous Mapuche community.

Translated from Spanish by Emma Felten, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy used clothing

loans.name: Grace Nayianoi

texts.en:
Grace Nayianoi L. is 32 years old, married to Tonou L., and the mother of four school-going children.
For the last 14 years, Grace has been farming her own piece of land. She learned about Kiva partner, KADET, from other women in a group already registered with KADET in her area of residence. This will be her first loan, which she is planning to spend on preparing her land for planting maize. Maize has been doing well in her area due to good climatic conditions. Grace hopes to use the profit from the proceeds of this loan to expand her farming activity from small-scale to commercial farming. Grace's dream is to be involved in large-scale farming and attain financial independence. She is a hardworking woman who is determined to achieve her goals.

loans.use: To prepare the land for planting maize

loans.name: Aida

texts.en:
Aida A. is from the village of Little Tadian. She is 50 years old, married, and has six school-aged children. To make a living, Aida owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising pigs for fattening and sale. Aida has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 3,500 PHP monthly whenever she sells a pig she has raised.
In 2010, Aida joined Kiva partner, ASKI, to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from ASKI. This loan was used to purchase baby livestock to raise and sell in future. Aida is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will also be used to purchase baby livestock to raise and sell in future. This loan will be her second from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About ASKI
ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase baby livestock to raise and sell in future

loans.name: Tomasa

texts.es:
La señora Tomasa  tiene  60 años y esta casada con el  Sr. Pablino Alonso con quien tienen   tres hijos todos mayores D. edad con sus respectivas familias una D. sus hijas esta trabajando en España y le ayuda enviando Giros mensualmente para colaborar  con los gastos D. la casa.                                                                                                            La Sra. Elena hace diez años que tiene un negocio D. tiendas generales y realiza la venta D. sus mercaderias recorrrinedo las compañía y los barrios D. su Ciudad  D. Itagua que queda a 20 km D. San Lorenzo.
 Tambien en su casa tiene una despensa  para consumo D. comestibles y también mercerías  y es  donD. se queda su esposo Sr. Paublino para la atención D. los cliente D. la zona.
El crédito invertirá en la compra D. Mercería D. la Temporada D. Otoño Invierno.
Mas adelante desea ampliar su negocio hasta  que llegue a un Autoservice.
texts.en:
Tomasa, age 60, is married to Paublino Alonso. They have three grown children who have their own families. One of their daughters is working in Spain, and she helps by sending monthly money orders to contribute to the household expenses. For ten years Elena has had a business, which is a general store. She sells her merchandise by going to the companies and the neighborhoods in her city, Itagua. This city is 20 kilometers from San Lorenzo. She also has a grocery store in her house. The store also carries sewing supplies. Her husband, Paublino, stays at home and waits on the customer’s from the area. She will use the loan to buy notions for the fall and winter seasons. Later, she wants to expand her business until it becomes a supermarket.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy clothes and footwear for women, men, and children for the winter season

loans.name: Radany

texts.en: Mrs. Radany D., 33 years old, lives in Kampeaeng Tboung village, Takeo province. She is a fruit seller in the local market and is able to earn a small income to support her family. In order to help her business, she decided to buy a motorcycle to transport her fruit. Mr. Seng Eng is a widow with two children, who are too young to study or work.

loans.use: To buy a motorcycle to transport her fruit

loans.name: Zoila Esperanza

texts.es: Zoila Esperanza Q. de 44 años de edad, vive junto a sus tres hijos de 7, 9, y 14 años de edad, de igual forma vive junto a su madre la cual es su mano derecha tanto con el cuidado del hogar como con su trabajo. Ella vive junto a su familia en Tonacatepeque, ubicado en la ciudad de San Salvador. Zoila  es una madre de familia muy responsable y trabajadora, que ha pesar que desempeña tanto el rol de madre como el de padre, ha logrado sacar adelante a su familia, ya que sus tres hijos cuentan con todo lo necesario y así mismo se dedican a estudiar gracias a los enormes esfuerzos de Loida. Ella posee una tienda de productos comestibles como pan y golosinas, y también   de primera necesidad como: jabón y shampoo, así mismo elabora tortillas cada mediodía y también comercializa verduras a las afueras de su casa, su madre le ayuda a atender los negocio y así mismo a hacer las tortillas, y es así como gracias al esfuerzo de ambas poseen sus negocios de manera muy estable. Loida solicita un préstamo por medio del cual pueda surtir aún más la tienda, así mismo para comprar mayor cantidad de maíz, y verduras, de manera que pueda atender mejor a sus clientes y de esta misma forma mejorar sus ventas lo cual es su prioridad para sacar adelante su hogar.
texts.en:
Zoila Esperanza Q. is 44 years old and lives with her three children (ages 7, 9, and 14). Her mother also lives with them and acts as her right hand when taking care of the home and managing her business. Zoila and her family reside in Tonacatepeque, which is located in the city of San Salvador. She is a responsible and hardworking mother. Even though she must assume the role of both father and mother, she has been able to move her family forward and provide everything her children need for their studies. All of this has been made possible thanks to Zoila’s tremendous efforts. She has a store where she sells food products such as bread and candy. Her inventory also includes basic necessities such as soap and shampoo. She also makes tortillas every day at noon and sells vegetables outside of house. Her mother helps with managing the business and making tortillas. Their efforts have helped her businesses remain stable.

Zoila is requesting a loan so that she can restock her store, as well as buy corn in bulk and vegetables so that she can provide better service to her customers. To help her family succeed, she seeks to improve her sales as a priority.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchandise for her store; acquire corn in bulk & vegetables

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buy bicycle spare parts and accessories.

loans.name: Mutai Development Association-Jinja Group

texts.en:
M. Sulaiman, age 50, is the head of this group loan. He has a milk and charcoal sales business in Jinja. He is a true entrepreneur and has tried his hand at several kinds of businesses over the years, including firewood sales and animal husbandry. He offers his wares to both lower- and middle-class people in the area, and this allows him to bring in 200,000 shillings a month from his business. He sells from his home and also offers delivery services. 

With this loan he wants to buy more bags of charcoal and milk preserving containers.

loans.use: To purchase more bags of charcoal and milk preserving containers

loans.name: Pastora Isolina

texts.es:
Pastora de 37 años,elabora peluches y almohadas, tiene una casa de caña y solo cuenta con luz como servicio básico. Vive en una zona periurbana en el Paraíso de Guayaquil zona caracterizada por sus caminos montañosos. 

Hace varios años ella inicio la producción de almohada y peluches para poder mantener a su familia. Comenzó con una maquina de coser vieja, poco a poco con esfuerzo a podido tener mas clientela. Su esposo se va a las provincias del Ecuador a vender las almohadas y peluches. 

Con el préstamo quiere comprar espuma y telas para la elaboración y una mayor producción de almohadas y peluches. En el futuro quiere tener un almacén para que sus ventas sean al por mayor.
texts.en:
Pastora is 37 years old and produces stuffed toys and pillows. She has a house made of reeds and receives electricity as her only basic service. Pastora lives in the periurban area of Paraíso de Guayaquil, an area known for its mountain roads.

Several years ago she began producing pillows and stuffed toys in order to support her family. She started with an old sewing machine and, with a little bit of effort, was able to acquire more customers. Her husband travels to the provinces throughout Ecuador to sell the pillows and stuffed toys.

Pastora wants to use this loan to buy foam and fabrics so that she can increase her production of pillows and stuffed toys. In the future, she wants to have a store where she can sell in larger quantities.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase foam & fabrics

loans.name: Gemma

texts.en:
Gemma L. is from the village of San Luis, Gingoog City. She is 45 years old. Gemma is married and has 3 children. To make a living, Gemma owns & operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling both food & daily use products in the local community. Gemma has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 6000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Gemma joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Gemma has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Gemma is requesting a new loan of 9000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. This will be the 3rd loan taken out by Gemma from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory and as working capital

location.town: San Luis, Gingoog City, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Lilia

texts.en:
Lilia  M. is a 53-year old married woman who supports her family by abaca weaving and running a sari-sari (general) store. She lives in Purok 2, Mantija 2, Danao City, Cebu. She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2009 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of PHP8,000. Lilia  is now borrowing PHP 10,000 so that she can purchase weaving materials and stock for her store. This will be her third loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of PHP7,000, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey towards economic freedom. Lilia  aspires to elevate her family's living conditions and ensure their future well-being by following the Dungganon way. 

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon — a title of esteem bestowed on a member of a community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.  Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: Purchase weaving meterials

loans.name: Francisco Alejandro

texts.es:
Francisco de 26 años, tiene una pequeña panadería en su casa, en las Orquídeas de Guayaquil (zona urbana, llamada las orquídeas porque en su descubrimiento habían muchas flores orquídeas).

Escogía tener una panadería ya que hace muchos años atrás aprendió a hacer panes y no quería desperdiciar ese talento. Compro un horno y  harina para comenzar con la panadería en la parte delantera de su casa. En la actualidad vende pan en su pequeño local que tiene en su casa trabaja desde las 05h00am haciendo pan hasta las 00h00pm que cierra el negocio. 

Con el préstamo quiere comprar harina y una refrigeradora para las bebidas que quiere vender en su panadería. En el futuro quiere tener mas grande su panadería.
texts.en:
Francisco is 26 years old and he runs a bakery in his house, located in Orquídeas de Guayaquil (an urban area named after the many orchids that existed when the place was discovered).

He chose to engage in bakery because he leaned how to bake bread many years ago, and he did not want to waste this experience. To start his baking activity he bought flour and an oven that he put in the front part of his house. He currently sells bread in a small room of his house, where he works backing bread form 5 am until 12 pm when he closes the shop.

The loan he is requesting will be used to buy flour and a fridge for the drinks he wants to sell in his bakery. In the future he wants to own a bigger bakery.

loans.use: To buy flour and a fridge.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: EL PRESTAMO SOLICITADO ES PARA INCERTIRLO EN COMPRA DE MATERIALES DE CONSTRUCCION COMO: ZINC, MADERA Y CLAVOS PARA CAMBIAR EL TECHO DE SU CASA DE HABITACION YA QUE EN INVIERNO SE PASA EL AGUA.
texts.en: This client is requesting a loan that will be invested in the purchase of construction materials such as zinc, wood, and nails in order to replace the roof of his house since it leaks during the winter.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials that are required to replace the roof of his house

loans.name: Bright

texts.en: Bright is a twenty-five-year-old man, very enterprising and determined to take his business to greater heights. He lives in Fort Portal, Uganda and his family dream is to build a permanent house for residence. He has been operating   a butcher shop for the last five years and the business is still profitable. Bright needs the loan to buy cattle to sell as beef in anticipation of increased sales during the festive Christmas season.

loans.use: Buying cattle to sell as beef

loans.name: Carmelita

texts.en:
Carmelita D. is from the village of Tupsan, Mambajao, Camiguin Province. She is 53 years old. Carmelita is widowed and has six school-aged children. To make a living, Carmelita owns and operates a business making and selling food. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling snacks and other delicacies like, banana cues and kutsinta (brown rice cakes) in the local community. Carmelita has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Carmelita joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Carmelita is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. This will be the first loan taken out by Carmelita from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue she generates to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale

loans.name: Reynaldo

texts.en:
Reynaldo M. is from the village of Rizal in West San Isidro. He is 43 years old. Reynaldo is married and has 1 school-aged child. To make a living, Reynaldo owns & operates a business venture in the services sector running a transport business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from providing motorcycle transport services. Reynaldo has been engaged in his business for over 13 years and earns approximately 2000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2006, Reynaldo joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Reynaldo has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase materials needed to expand services provided. Reynaldo is requesting a new loan of 6000 PHP, which will be used to repair the vehicle used in the business. This loan will be the 10th loan taken out by Reynaldo from ASKI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand his business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To repair vehicle used in the business

loans.name: Bibiana

texts.es: Bibiana tiene 65 años, vive con su esposo en su casa propia. Hace más D. 10 años se dedica a vender leche fresca. Es así que cada mañana orD.ña su vaca llegando a recolectar gran cantidad D. leche que será vendida a una empresa láctea. D. esa manera obtiene ingresos económicos para cubrir los gastos D. su casa, eso le motiva continuar trabajando, además que le gusta mucho lo que hace ya que lo considera una actividad que no requiere D. mucho esfuerzo físico es por esta razón que seguirá dedicándose a la ganadería por más tiempo. Es su primer crédito que tiene con MFP, esta muy contenta D.  saber que tiene un apoyo financiero, además  le agrada ser parte D. su banco comunal porque  todos sus integrantes son personas que conoce, responsables y muy solidarias, agradece  a aquellas personas que serán gestoras del préstamo que solicita y le será  muy útil en el progreso D. su actividad económica. Con el crédito que solicita, lo invertirá en la compra D. una ternera para criarlo.
texts.en: Bibiana is 65 and she lives with her husband in their own house.  She started selling fresh milk more than 10 years ago and every morning she milks her cows and collects a large amount that will be sold to a dairy business.  This is how she gets earnings to cover household expenses and that is why she wants to continue working.  Besides she enjoys what she does very much since it doesn’t require much physical effort and thus she will keep working with cows in the future.  This is her first loan with MFP and she is very happy to know that she has financial support.  She also likes to be part of the communal bank because all of the members are people that she knows, and they are responsible and united.  She thanks those people who will be offering the loan that she is requesting and it will be very useful for her earnings.  She will use the moeny to buy a calf to raise.

loans.use: To buy a calf.

loans.name: Ninita

texts.en: Ninita N. is from the village of San Jose, Mahinog, Camiguin Province. She is 58 years old, married and has 2 adult children. To make a living, Ninita owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop, selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap, snack foods, canned goods and toothpaste in the local community. Ninita has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month from these activities. In 2009, Ninita joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Ninita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 12,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional inventory and for working capital. Ninita is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell like biscuits and instant noodles. This loan will be the 5th loan taken out by Ninita from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell like biscuits and instant noodles

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To add stock to her restaurant

loans.name: Lemeria

texts.en:
Lemeria O. S. is 51 years old. He is married and the father of ten children. Lemeria is a farmer. He farms his own piece of land, and he has been doing this for the last twelve years.

He learned about KADET LTD from other members in a group already registered with KADET in his area of residence. This will be his second loan, and he is planning to buy farming supplies. He hopes to use the proceeds of this loan to expand his farming.

Lemeria's dream is to be a prominent farmer in the region and to ensure his family has a better standard of living. He is a hardworking man who is determined to achieve his goals.

loans.use: To buy farming supplies

loans.name: Elna

texts.en:
Elna is a married woman who lives in Manapla, Negros Occidental.  She earns her living by operating a transportation (tricycle) business.  Her husband Rodolfo, Sr., who is 58 years old, works as a fisherman to earn his living and helps in his wife's business activities. They have seven children who are 8 to 27 years old. Elna joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2003 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past 16 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Elna has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 19,000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 9,000, thus uplifting the family's standard of living. This time, for her 17th loan, she is borrowing PHP 20,000 to repair the sidecar of her tricycle so that she can continue to save up for the future education of her children.  Elna is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams.  

About NWTF:  In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed upon a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.  Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by joining the NWTF Kiva lending team at http://www.kiva.org.

loans.use: To repair her sidecar

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
Ruth is a married woman with one child who attends school. She owns a house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees.

For the past 15 years, Ruth has operated a business selling material from door-to-door to her neighbors and passerby. Ruth faces a major challenge of high transportation costs from dealers to her place of operation. She dreams of establishing a large business in the future. Ruth plans to use this KES 40,000 loan to purchase more material for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase more material

loans.name: María Yolanda

texts.es:
En la ciudadela Circunvalación de la ciudad de  Manta  cada 15 días se reúne el Banco Comunal Nuevo Proyecto. Esta ciudad es conocida por sus hermosas playas que son muy visitadas en toda época del año por turistas nacionales y extranjeros, es uno de los puertos más importantes del país y de América  y está situado a orillas Océano  Pacifico.

Aquí conocimos a la señora María, tiene 51 de edad, es madre soltera de dos hijos de 27 y 14 años, el menor vive con ella y estudia en colegio. Ella vive en casa de sus padres. Lleva en el Banco Comunal siete  ciclos y le gusta por la amistad que ha hecho en el grupo.

Tiene un salón de belleza en Tarqui de Manta, el local es propio el cual realiza diversidad de trabajos como  tinturados, cortes de cabello, manicura de uñas y otros. Trabaja desde las 7h00 hasta las 19h00 y a veces hasta más tarde si sus clientes requieren de sus servicios y los domingos  hasta las 13h00. También vende productos de belleza, nos cuenta que lleva en su negocio 8 años y que le ha servido para sacar a sus hijos adelante.
 
Este crédito lo va a emplear para comprar una silla para cortar cabello que le hace mucha falta.
 
Sus sueños son llegar a tener un SPA y su casa propia.
texts.en:
The “Nuevo Proyecto” (New Project) communal bank meets every two weeks in Manta’s Circunvalación neighborhood.  This city is known for its beautiful beaches that are visited year round by national and foreign tourists alike.  It is one of the country’s and America’s most important ports situated on the shore of the Pacific Ocean.

This is where we found María, 51.  She is a single mother of two children who are 27 and 14 years of age.  The youngest lives with her and goes to school.  She lives in her parents’ house and has been in the communal bank for seven cycles; she likes it because of the friendship she’s made with the group.

She has a beauty salon in Tarqui in Manta.  She owns the locale where she provides a variety of services like: hair coloring, hair cuts, manicures and others.  She works from 7am until 7pm and sometimes even later if her customers require her services; on Sundays she works until 1pm.  She also sells beauty products.  She tells us that she’s been in business 8 years and it has made it possible for her to raise her children.

She will use the loan to buy a barber’s chair that she needs very much.  Her dreams are to have a Spa and a house of her own some day.

loans.use: to buy a barber's chair.

loans.name: Oñondivepa Group

texts.es:
El comité “Oñondivepa” se formó gracias al deseo de mejoramiento y superación del nivel de vida de sus integrantes ya que son personas de muy escasos recursos.
El grupo pertenece a la ciudad de Asunción, capital de la República.
La señora Jorgelina N. se dedica a la venta de bebidas desde hace años, en especial las bebidas sin alcohol, ya que además de ser un negocio para su familia la tienda de bebidas, también desean promover la venta de bebidas no alcohólicas, y combatir de a poco el nivel de jóvenes adictos en la ciudad asuncena.
Ella solicita el crédito para adquirir más bebidas, pues al abastecer mejor su negocio habrá mayor cantidad de clientes y por ende mayor ganancia económica para su familia.
Todas las integrantes del comité son mujeres sacrificadas que desean superarse cada día por el bienestar general de sus hijos, maridos, parientes y por ellas mismas.
texts.en:
The Oñondivepa group was formed because the members wanted to improve their standard of living. They are poor people with low incomes and live in the city of Asunción, capital of Paraquay. 

Señora Jorgelina N. has earned her living selling drinks for many years. The drinks she sells are mostly non-alcoholic since this is a family business, and as well Jorgelina wishes to promote non-alcoholic drinks in an effort to combat the number of young addicts in the city.

She is seeking a loan to buy more drinks for her store, thus increasing the number of customers and earning more money for her family.

All the members of the group are hardworking women who wish to improve the wellbeing of their children, husbands, relatives as well as their own.

loans.use: to buy soft drinks and juices

loans.name: Emmanuel David

texts.es:
Emmanuel de 19 años, es un joven emprendedor que inicio su actividad abriendo una tienda de víveres hace poco tiempo. Poco a poco a incrementado su capital de trabajo. 

El labora diariamente con la ayuda de su madre que a la vez hacen las comprar de mercadería para su negocio. En algunas ocasiones no tiene tiempo de estar en su negocio ya que todavía estudia por eso su mama le ayuda a trabajar vendiendo arroz, bebidas, confites etc.

Con el préstamo quiere comprar arroz aceite azúcar y más productos para su negocio para aumentar sus ingresos. En un futuro desea ampliar su negocio.
texts.en:
Emmanuel is 19 years old. He is an enterprising young man who started his activity opening a grocery store a little while ago. Little by little, he increased his working capital.    

He works daily with the help of his mother who also helps him buy merchandise for his business. On some occasions, he doesn't have time to be at the business since he is still in school. That is why his mother helps him work, selling rice, beverages, candies, etc. 

With the loan, he wants to buy rice, oil, sugar and more products for his business to increase his income. In the future, he wants to grow his business.

loans.use: to buy rice, oil and sugar.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es:
El Banco comunal se denomina “VIRGEN DE GUADALUPE - CUSCO”; Este Banco se encuentra situado en el Distrito de Huanchac, perteneciente a la Provincia de Cusco, Departamento de Cusco.

El socio es el Sr: Jimmy, el socio tiene 25 años de edad;  el socio es soltero, el socio es analista de sistemas, el trabaja en la empresa de visanet, es una services. El socio es soporte técnico de dicha empresa, el socio desea graduarse y para ello requiere el crédito para pagar los derechos de su graduación. El socio solicita el préstamo para invertir en el pago de derechos para acceder a la graduación de sus estudios y obtener el título profesional.

El socio esta agradecida y desea expresar que cumplirá de manera  disciplinadamente con los pagos de sus cuotas.
texts.en:
The communal bank, "VIRGEN DE GUADALUPE - CUSCO" is located in the District of Huanchac, belonging to the Province of Cusco, Department of Cusco.

The member is Jimmy, 25 years old, and unmarried.  He is a systems analyst at the company VisaNet, an electronic payment processing network.  Jimmy provides technical support at VisaNet.  He wants to graduate and needs a loan to pay dues upon graduation.  Jimmy is requesting the loan to pay fees to access the graduation of his studies and obtain a professional title.

Jimmy is grateful and will pay back the loan in a disciplined manner.

loans.use: To invest in paying dues for graduation.

loans.name: Germaine

texts.fr: Née le 12 octobre 1980 au Bénin, Germaine est mariée à wilis un photographe. Le couple à deux enfants à charge tous scolarisés dont un est leur propre enfant. Germaine n’a jamais été à l’école. Germaine a appris le métier de coiffure, activité qu’elle exerce passionnément depuis dix ans. Parallèlement à cette activité, Germaine vend des produits divers (savons, boîte de conserve, etc.), des mèches et des produits cosmétiques. Grâce au revenu que lui génère son activité, Germaine contribue aux différentes dépenses de la famille. Germaine s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin et vend ses produits dans son atelier. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour améliorer son niveau de vie, Germaine sollicite pour une quatrième fois un crédit auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en:
Born on October 12, 1980 in Bénin, Germaine is married to Wilis, who is a photographer. The couple is raising two children, both enrolled in school, of whom one is their biological child. 

Germaine never attended school. She learned hairdressing, a trade she has been practicing enthusiastically for ten years. At the same time, she sells general merchandise (soap, canned goods, etc.), hair extensions, and cosmetics. Thanks to the income from her business, Germaine is able to contribute to supporting her family. She buys her merchandise in a market in Bénin and sells her goods out of her beauty shop. With a view to satisfying her clientele and improving her standard of living, Germaine is requesting her fourth loan from ALIDé.

loans.use: to buy five cases of cosmetics, five dozen hair extensions, and two cases of soap.

loans.name: Justin

texts.en:
Justin is a married man with children who attend school. He lives in a rental house that has electricity but no piped water. His greatest monthly expense is rent.

For the past three years, he has operated a business selling farm products, selling in a shop to his neighbors and passersby. He sells products like cassava, mangoes and coconuts. He faces a major challenge in the high cost of transportation from the farm to the market. Justin dreams of expanding his business in the future.

With the 20,000 Kshs loan, he wants to purchase bundles of oranges, cassava, coconuts and mangoes. He decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost his business.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of oranges, cassava, coconuts and mangoes.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy ceramic tiles and zinc sheeting.

loans.name: Walter

texts.en:
Walter is aged 27 and single. He has been practicing mixed farming for the last four years in Kitale town, western Kenya. His farm produces milk, eggs, vegetables and maize, which he sells to middlemen. He solely depends on the income from his farm to cater for his basic needs. 

Walter has made a loan request of 31,200 Kenyan shillings in order to purchase and insure a dairy cow. With the dairy cow he will acquire, his family will be guaranteed enough milk for domestic consumption and sale. The extra income from the sale of milk will enable him to expand his farming activities and improve his livelihood. 

His primary challenges have been the high cost of animal feeds and diseases, which are too costly to treat. In the future, he plans to acquire six quality dairy cows and a motorcycle for transporting his produce to the market.

loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Elida

texts.es:
La señora Elida es socia del banco comunal Lideres Triunfadoras del Distrito Calleria, Departamento D. Ucayali, tiene 53 años D. edad, es viuda y tiene cuatro hijos mayores e independientes.
Como fundadora del banco comunal es una D. las personas que hace cumplir todos los acuerdos que hacen en las reuniones D. cierre D. ciclo.  Con su primer préstamo logró comprar las bebidas necesarias para poder comenzar a trabajar con el negoico D. venta D. bebidas gaseosas, agua mineral y cervezas, negocio que está instalado en su casa.
Con su nuevo préstamo D. S/. 2,000.00 nuevos soles comprará: 4 jabas D. gaseosas, 10 cajas D. cerveza, 1 paquete D. agua.
Todos sus hijos son mayores D. edad y tienen familia.  Con éste negocio se distrae.  Es viuda pero tuvo la valentía D. sacar adelante a sus hijos sola sin la ayuda D. nadie.
texts.en:
Elida is a member of the communal bank named "Lideres Triunfadoras", meaning "Successful Leaders". It is located in the district of Calleria in the department of Ucayali. She is 53 years old, a widow, and she has four grown and independent children. 

As the founding member of the communal bank she is one of the individuals who is in charge of meeting all of the commitments maD. at the close of the loan cycle. With her first loan she was able to purchase drinks. This helped her to start working in a business selling soft drinks, mineral water, and beer. This business is located in her house. 

With her new loan, amounting to S/.2000 nuevos soles, she will purchase: 4 cases of soft drinks, 10 boxes of beer, and 1 package of water.

All of her children are grown and have families of their own. She occupies herself with this business. She is a widow but she had the courage to support her children without anyone's help.

loans.use: to purchase soft drinks, mineral water, and beer.

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en:
Nancy is 28 years old. She is married to a businessman and they have one child aged eleven months old.  She runs a mobile money transfer services business, normally known as M-pesa here in Kenya. Besides this business, she does photocopying and sells cereals. She has been in business for the last three years and hires two employees. She says that the business is profitable and her major challenge is financial constraints. 

Nancy is using her loan of KES 50,000 as float for her business. She hopes to grow her business. She also hopes to give her child a good education to the university level. She describes herself as honest and God-fearing.

loans.use: to have enough float for her mobile money transfer business.

loans.name: Asusa

texts.en: Asusa is 22 years old and married with five children. Four of the children are in school. She has a business selling bread and cake in Kator branch in South Sudan. She has been in this business for three years. Asusa requested this loan through BRAC South Sudan with the hopes of expanding her business. She says that the extra income from this loan will help her to pay the school fees for her children.

loans.use: to purchase more breads to sell

loans.name: Lorenzo

texts.en:
Lorenzo is 50 years old and lives in the Philippines. He is widowed and has 3 children. 

Lorenzo has a shop that sells green & yellow bananas & coconut. He has had this business for 6 years. He requested a loan for PHP 8,000 to buy bananas & coconut to sell.

Lorenzo has been a member of HSPFI since 2011.  In the future, he hopes to improve his business.

loans.use: buy bananas & coconuts

loans.name: Pey

texts.en: Pey is 42 years old and earns about $4 a day by selling duck eggs. Her husband is a farmer who earns about $2.50 a day. The couple has five children, one of whom is in school while the other four work and earn about $8 a day. Every month, Pey has to spend $30 on food, $3 on electricity, $5 on school fees and $10 on other expenses. She is applying for a loan for $1,000 to buy more ducks to raise and care for. She used to work as a farmer but her income was not high enough to support her family, so she changed her career to earn a larger income. She plans to continue buying more ducks as a way to increase her income and improve her family's life.

loans.use: to buy more ducks to raise.

loans.name: Ñasaindy Group

texts.es:
10 mujeres de la ciudad de Paraguarí se reunieron con el propósito de interiorizarse mas en el programa de mujeres emprendedoras de la Fundación Paraguaya, el cual les resultó muy interesante y de allí surge el comité denominado Ñasaindy. Ellas han asumido el compromiso de mantener unido al grupo y trabajar siempre bajo un marco de responsabilidad y mutua cooperación. Actualmente se encuentran muy a gusto en el tercer ciclo del programa.
Una de las integrantes es la señora Miryan, ella se dedica a la cría de cerdos, este ha sido el medio de subsistencia de su familia desde hace un tiempo. Gracias a este trabajo ella puede paliar los gastos que diariamente surgen en el hogar. Comenta que su trabajo es muy duro, pues implica mucho esfuerzo, pero pese a eso no se cansa de trabajar.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de balanceados para sus animales, para que de esa forma tenga asegurado el alimento para los mismos.
texts.en:
Ten women from the city of Paraguarí joined together in order to become familiar with the Program of Women Entrepreneurs offered by Fundación Paraguaya, which they found to be very interesting. As a result, they formed the committee called “Ñasaindy”. They have pledged their commitment to maintain a unified group and to always work under a spirit of responsibility and mutual cooperation. At the moment, they have become very comfortable as they start their third loan cycle with the program.

One of the members is Sra. Miryan, who has been raising pigs for some time in order to support her family. Thanks to her work, she has been able to manage the daily household expenses. She says that her work is very hard because it requires a lot of effort, but she never gets tired of laboring. The loan she is requesting will be used to buy balanced feed for her animals so that she can secure the means of maintaining their diet.

loans.use: to buy feed for her pigs.

loans.name: Lorenza

texts.es:
La señora Lorenza cuenta con 24 años de edad, es madre soltera, y tiene 3 hijos, Abelardo, Abraham y amairani, de los cuales los tres estudian, el mayor está cursando segundo primer año de secundaria, el menor 5 año de primaria y la más pequeña segundo año de preescolar, se dedica a la venta de carne, chorizo y quesos, desde hace mas de 6 años.
Ella dice que decidió iniciar con esta actividad, ya que quería buscar la manera de sacar a sus hijos adelante, y así ofrecerles una muy buena calidad de vida y tener una mejor solvencia económica, para apoyarlos con sus estudios, el crédito que recibió lo invirtió en la compra de mas carnes, chorizo, crema y quesos.
La meta que tiene doña lencha (como mejor la conocen sus amigas y personas del pueblo), es la de hacer crecer mucho mas su negocio, ya que lo que en verdad quiere es poner una carnicería, para tener más variedad y así mejorar sus ingresos, lo que le ayudara para apoyar a sus hijos con sus estudios profesionales.
“Le doy las gracias a FRAC y los donadores de kiva por confiar en mí y brindarme todo su apoyo”
texts.en:
Lorenza is 24 years old. She is a single mother of three children. They are named Abelardo, Abraham and Amairani. The three of them go to school and the oldest is in the seventh grade, and the middle child is in the fifth year of primary school, and the youngest is in her second year of pre-school. She has sold meats, sausages and cheeses for 6 years. 

She says she decided to begin this activity because she wanted to find a way to get her children ahead and offer them a good quality of life and better finances to support their studies. She loan she received was invested in buying more meats, sausages, cream and cheese.  

Doña Lencha's goal (as her friends and neighbors know her) is to grow her business more. What she really wants is to open a butcher shop to have more variety and improve her income. This will help her to support her children getting a profession.  

“I am thankful to FRAC and the Kiva donors for trusting me and offering me their support.”

loans.use: to invest in buying more meats, sausages, cream and cheeses.

loans.name: Betty

texts.en:
Betty is 36 years old and is a married woman with 3 children. The oldest child is 14 years old. Her husband works as a welder.

Betty has been running her retail business for 6 years. She sells items like shirts, jeans and blankets to the people in her community. She earns about 6,000 PHP per month with her business. She plans to use her loan to buy more items to sell, such as blankets, shirts and socks. Betty hopes to be a successful businesswoman someday. She also hopes for her children to finish college and have bright futures.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell such as blankets, shirts and socks.

loans.name: Luis Armando

texts.es: Luis Armando de 46 años de edad, habita en casa propia junto con su esposa de 46 años y su pequeña hija de 14 años. Luis se dedica a la elaboración y venta de estructuras metálicas como balcones para ventanas, puertas, etc. Hace muchos años que se dedica  a esta actividad por lo que  cuenta con muchos clientes fijos. Además ha sabido ganarse la confianza de muchas personas ya que él es un hombre muy responsable y dedicado a su trabajo. Su negocio está en una zona muy transitada y accesible para muchas personas. Sueña con dar a su familia una mejor calidad de vida y es por ella que trabaja duramente para algún día poder darles todo lo que necesitan. Ha tomado la decisión de solicitar este crédito a INTEGRAL para invertir en la comprar diferentes tipos de hierro y las herramientas necesarias ya que por el uso se deterioran y necesitan ser reemplazadas para poder seguir dando un buen servicio a los clientes.  Confía en Dios que de esta manera logrará su objetivo de mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Luis Armando, 46, lives in his own home along with his wife, 46, and their young daughter, 14.  Luis works making and selling metal structures such as balconies for windows, doors, etc.  He has been doing this work for many years, which is why he has lots of steady customers.  Besides, he has been able to gain the trust of many people, since he is a very responsible man and dedicated to his work.

His business is in a very busy area accessible to many people.  He dreams about giving his family a better quality of life.  Because of this he works hard to one day be able to give them everything they need.

He made the decision to request this loan from Integral to invest in buying different types of iron and the necessary tools, since they deteriorate with use and need to be replaced so he can continue giving his clients good service.  He trusts in God that in this way he will achieve his goal to improve his and his family's quality of life.

loans.use: to buy different types of iron and tools

loans.name: Jose De La Cruz

texts.es:
El señor Jose tiene 46 años y vive en la aldea de Candelaria Togopala en el municipio de Intibuca.  Junto con su esposa Felipa, tiene 6 hijos de 14 a 22 años de edad. Los tres menores están en nivel educativo y los demás ya pasaron de la edad escolar. 

Desde su adolescencia, don Jose se ha dedicado a la agricultura. En actualidad, cultiva su propio terreno junto con Felipa. La pareja especializa en la siembra y producción de papa, maíz, frijoles y hortalizas. 

Don Jose ha sido cliente de ODEF desde 2008 y ha manejado 4 ciclos de crédito con la institución demostrando un buen comportamiento de pago. Con el crédito actual de L5,000, Jose va a comprar fertilizante y fungicidas para el mantenimiento de los cultivos de zanahoria y papa. Tiene planeado continuar el mismo ritmo de producción de sus cosechas para darle estabilidad a su familia. Espera que no haya pérdidas de la producción agrícola y que aumente la producción.
texts.en:
Sr. Jose is 46 years old and lives in the neighborhood of Candelaria Togopala in the town of Intibuca. He and his wife Felipa have six children between the ages of 14 and 22. The three youngest children are in school while the others have exceeded school age.

Since he was a teenager, Don Jose has engaged in farming. He and Felipa currently own a piece of land. They specialize in planting and producing potatoes, corn, beans, and vegetables.

Don Jose has been a client of ODEF since 2008. He has participated in four loan cycles and has demonstrated a good payment history. With this current loan of 5000 HNL, Jose will buy fertilizers and fungicides so that he can maintain his carrot and potato crops. He plans to continue the same production cycle of crops so that his family can have stability. He hopes to avoid any crop losses and be able to increase production.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and fungicides.

loans.name: Xalis

texts.en: Xalis lives in Saatli. He is married and the loving father of three school-aged children. He has been involved in selling fruits for ten years. His first loan from Aqroinvest was in 2010, and he has very good credit history. Now Xalis has requested a loan of 1,100 AZN to obtain the wholesale purchase of fruits and earn a good income from the sales.

loans.use: to purchase fruits.

loans.name: Efua

texts.en: Efua sells cassava, gari, and plantains at Besease near Elmina. Efua is married to a farmer and has seven dependents. She has been in this business for 20 years. She uses her income to support her husband in paying utility bills. Efua will use her loan to purchase more cassava and gari for sale. With the new profit Efua will expand her business.

loans.use: purchase more cassava and gari for sale.

loans.name: Ana Julia

texts.es:
Ana, vive con su esposo y sus dos hijos, ella se dedica a la venta de tamales y su esposo se dedica a la agricultura y ganadería, juntos desarrollan estas actividades, ella aprendió por medio de su madre, en la actualidad no tiene un horario definido.
Actualmente está solicitando préstamo para la compra de una vaca y un ternero, esto le permitirá crecer su panadería y tiene mayores ingresos a futuro. Su aspiración es tener un negocio más grande vivir en condiciones dignas con su familia.
texts.en:
Ana lives with her husband and two children.  She sells tamales and her husband is a farmer who raises livestock.  They do these things together.  She learned from her mother and doesn’t have a set schedule for herself.

Now she is asking for this loan to buy a cow and a bull.  This will allow her to grow her farm and have a better income in the future.  She aspires to have a larger business and live a dignified life with her family.

loans.use: to buy a cow and a bull.

loans.name: Mujeres De Exito Group

texts.es:
La Sra. Sonia de 42 años, es conviviente y tienes 3 hijos los cuales aún son dependientes. Tiene 3 años siendo cliente de Edaprospo y se dedica a la venta de abarrotes en general, tales como gaseosa, cerveza, arroz, lejía, detergentes, etc.; lleva 10 años en este negocio al cual le puso el nombre de “Bodega Ivonne” y que comenzó con el sueño de poder abrir su negocio propio para así solventar sus necesidades. 
Con su esfuerzo y trabajo también ha podido abrir un local de alquiler de cabinas de Internet el cual tiene 3 años. 
Actualmente sus ingresos los destina a los gastos de alimentación y una parte a capital de trabajo, mientras que su pareja cubre los gastos de agua y luz. Su plan a futuro es terminar de construir su casa en donde pueda alquilar habitaciones. 
la Sra. Sonia pertenece a la alcancía comunal “Mujeres de Éxito” con el cual lleva 1 año y 4 meses como socia y 8 meses como presidenta del grupo el cual está conformado por 7 personas. 
Piensa usar el reciente préstamo en la compra de mercaderia ya que en estas fechas sus ventas se incrementan por campaña navideña y año nuevo.
texts.en: Sonia, 42, lives with her husband and 3 dependent children.
