She has been working with Edaprospo for 3 years and sells groceries like sodas, beer, rice, bleach, detergent, etc. She has owned her store, Bodega Ivonne, for 10 years, and started with the dream of opening her own business to pay for her daily necessities. With her effort and hard work, three years ago she was also able to open an internet cafe. Currently her income pays for food and business capital, while her husband covers water and electricity expenses. Her plan for the future is to finish building her house so that she can rent out rooms. Sonia has belonged to the lending group "Mujeres de Exito" for 1 year and 4 months, and has been the president of this seven-person group for 8 months. She would like to use the loan to purchase groceries such as sodas, beers,rice, bleach, detergent, etc. since her sales increase for the Christmas season.

loans.use: to purchase soda, beer, rice, bleach, detergents

loans.name: Juliet

texts.en:
Juliet is 28 years old and married with three children.

Juliet works hard to provide for her family. She runs a coconut wine retail business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 17,000 loan through NWTF to buy more gallons of coconut wine to sell.

Juliet has borrowed and paid back 13 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been in the coconut wine retail business for 11 years and earns additional income from buying & selling livestock and running a general store.

Juliet aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more gallons of coconut wine to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy summer clothes to sell.

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Beatrice is a 27-year-old bookstore owner in Bombolulu, Mombasa. She is single, and she has been operating this business for the last four years with great success. 

This marks her first loan from KADET Ltd. to finance her business. She plans to purchase more textbooks, exercise books, geometrical sets, and printing papers. Beatrice will use the anticipated profits to further expand her business. She hopes to have a bigger and more profitable business.

loans.use: to purchase more textbooks, exercise books, geometrical sets, and printing papers.

loans.name: Flor De Papa Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “FLOR DE PAPA” iniciará el ciclo número uno en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Panamericana.  Está compuesta por ocho integrantes, la asociación comunal está dirigida por una mesa directiva y a la cabeza de la misma se encuentra  la señora Florentina.   Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: artesana en cartapacios, venta de choclos, venta de verduras, costura de bermudas y chamarras, macramé de mantas, costura de mandiles.

La señora Florentina, indica que forma parte de la asociación por primera vez. Ya que ella cuenta con un negocio de trenzado de mantas la que quiere aumentar su mercadería.

El crédito de este ciclo es para aumentar su capital (compra de hilos y tela) que adquirirá de las ferias paceñas y posteriormente a la elaboración lo comercializará a pedido. Esta forma de trabajo le ayuda a apoyar a su familia pues ella es casada y tiene un hijo.

En la foto se encuentra una acompañante, ella es la hermana de la señora Martha que se encuentr de chompa celeste a rayas
texts.en:
The communal bank "FLOR DE PAPA" is beginning is first cycle in the Pro Mujer program, run by the Panamerican Social Center.  The group is comprised of eight members and is led by a board of directors chaired by Mrs. Florentina.  The members are involved in different businesses which include:  handcrafted satchels, sale of corn, sale of vegetables, sewing and macramé.

Florentina has joined the association for the first time and says she has a blanket weaving business and wants to increase her merchandise.

This loan is to increase work capital by buying thread and yarn at the trade fairs so she can produce goods to fill orders.  The work allows her to support her family.  She is married and has a son.

Shown in a blue striped sweater is a sister of one of the members (Martha).

loans.use: To buy yarn.

loans.name: Safiya

texts.ru:
Сафия очень хорошая женщина 54 лет. Она замужем и имеет пятерых детей. Сафия живёт со своей семьёй в сельской местности. У нее с мужем очень большая семья, включая детей и внуков. Сафия со своей большой семьей собираются раз в неделю, чтобы поужинать все вместе. Общаются, рассказывают о своих успехах. А если у кого в семье Сафии  проблема, то она с мужем и остальными детьми помогают решить эту проблему. 
Сафия сама торгует на рынке. У нее своя лавка. Она торгует сухофруктами и разными орехами.  Вот уже 12 лет Сафия занимается этим делом, от этого дела она получает хороший стабильный доход.
В данный момент Сафия хочет, расширит свой бизнес, для этого ей нужны денежные средства.
Она заранее благодарить «Арванд» за предоставленную помощь и надеется положительный результат.

loans.use: for business expansion

loans.name: Osarugue

texts.en: Mrs. Osarugue E. is 30 years old, a trader who deals on the sales of baby things, a business she has been doing for 6 years now. She is a dedicated LAPO client and also she needs the money to improve her business.

loans.use: To buy more baby things for sale

loans.name: Ronald

texts.en: I am a married man, a father of 4. I sell used books for a living. I am the main bread earner. I believe the loan will help me increase my business skills and educate my dependents.

loans.use: I will use the money to diversify and expand my business.

loans.name: Zarina

texts.en:
Zarina is a widow with three children. Her husband died when she had just given birth to their third child. She was left with the sole responsibility of providing for herself and her children. It was not an easy task for a woman in Uganda, but she was determined to obtain a job as a housekeeper in Kampala. It was through this job that she was introduced to Life in Africa. She has been an active member for the last six years.

Zarina was forced to leave school at a very early age due to the civil war. Her family lost everything during this conflict and she was never able to return to school. This left her with poor English skills, and she was barely able to read or write. However, she knew the values of education, and she has made it her life‘s goal to make sure that her children are all educated. This goal prompted her to look for a way to secure their future.

Zarina proved to be a smart business woman, and she saw the advantage of investing in income property. She managed to secure several loans through Life in Africa, and she built a solid housing unit in a poor section of Kampala. She has several tenants living in her property now, and she was able to pay back all her loans in a timely manner. Like any other Life in Africa member, she was among the first to take a loan of 800,000 from Kiva in May 2006. She used her loan money to plaster her house, which ensured the quality of housing for her tenants. In addition, it also insured the value and durability of her property. She has repaid her loans without ever having a single late payment. Before plastering her house, she was earning 200,000 per month and is now earning 280,000 per month.

Zarina feels that she should put a ceiling board in her four roomed house so that it may look attractive to her tenants and also may increase the house rent. Any additions to the house increase the rent, which would raise her income. To do this she is requesting a loan amount of 150 USD.

loans.use: Putting a celing board in the house

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Jane Kisai would like to purchase two steers.

loans.name: Ni Ketut Kasih

texts.id:
Ketut Kasih is a Pig Farmer who is dtermine and hardworking to help her husband who is a farmer to provide food on the table. Ketut Kasih also has a son who is still studying. Ketut Kasih buys her piglet for each at Rp. 350.000, and sells each with a profit of Rp 100.000. From the little profit that she gain, Ketut Kasih has to pay the household expenses as well her son's education expenses. Ketut Kasih hopes that the financing help from Kiva will enable her to expand her business.

Translated from bahasa by bernard, Kiva volunteer.

Ketut Kasih seorang peternak babi yang ulet dalam mengelola usahanya untuk membantu memenuhi kebutuhan keluarga setiap hari selain membantu suami yang seorang petani.Hal ini dilakukannya karena Ibu Ketut Kasih juga ikut serta memenuhi kebutuhan pendidikan puteranya yang masih SMP. 2 ekor babi penggemukan yang dibelinya dengan harga Rp. 350.000,- dipeliharanya dengan baik setiap hari selama 2 bulan dan dijualnya kepada pelanggan yang memiliki usaha babi guling sehingga Ketut Kasih mendapat Keuntungan bersih Rp 100.000,- tiap ekornya. Dari keuntungan yang diperoleh ini Ketut Kasih membiayai kehidupan keluarganya termasuk juga untuk perawatan rumah sederhana yang ditempatinya bersama suami dan puteranya. Katut Kasih bersyukur dan berharap dengan adanya pinjaman modal dari DINARI bisa membuat usahanya lebih maju lagi.

loans.use: membeli bibit babi untuk penggemukan dan pakan ternak - To buy pig feedings and a pig stile

loans.name: Marina

texts.en:
Marina Poluboyarinova is married with two children. She and her family live in Dneprorudnyi, Ukraine. In the past Marina had tried to start other ventures, but struggled with many challenges. She decided to work in the shoe business because it proved to be profitable and stable. Marina has been in business for over 10 years now. Her kiosk offers a large variety of footwear for every season.

Marina wants to purchase new seasonal inventory and increase her income. She believes a good variety of inventory will attract many customers and help meet their need for warmer and more comfortable footwear. Marina’s consistent and perseverant efforts will help her repay this loan and continue to grow professionally as an entrepreneur.

loans.use: Purchase seasonal inventory

loans.name: Justina

texts.en:
Flowing kaftans, tight-fitting fishtail skirts with matching tops, baby’s dresses, boys’ overalls, and evening dresses, all can be found at Justina’s clothing shop. She established the business in 2003 and requires a loan of $275 to expand it by purchasing additional stock. Justina is a single mother and the business helps her to support her three children, Mariam, 15, Amina, 11 and Julius, 3.

About SELFINA
SELFINA is engaged in economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through a leasing and leaseback arrangement as a practical way to achieve economic and social emancipation.

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro Leasing. Customs and traditions in Tanzania normally make it difficult for women to own land and assets, and they are therefore termed not-creditworthy by financial institutions as they lack tangible collateral assets. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes.

SELFINA buys and leases equipment to women. Where a client needs working capital, SELFINA buys equipment from the said client, extending a loan to her, and then leases back the same equipment – a process called "sale and leaseback".

loans.use: To purchase additional stock for her clothes shop

loans.name: Ni Komang

texts.id:
Ni Komang A., 43 year old, lives in Manistutu Village, West Bali with her husband and three children. Two of her children are in middle school, while her third child is still an infant. Her husband is a farmer who works his land daily. To fill her spare time, Ni Komang opened a kiosk in her home. With $550 loan, Ni Komang A. plans to complete her kiosk offering with various food and drink items like rice, oil and various spices. Because of her kioskś strategic location, Ni KOmangś kiosk grew quickly. Ni Komang can earn about $3.30 daily. Ni Komang is so grateful that her earnings can help support her familyś income. She hopes to be able to save in addition to paying the loan on time.

Translated from Indonesian by Kresna Hartandi, Kiva Volunteer.

Ni Komang A., 43 tahun, tinggal didesa Manistutu, Bali Barat bersama suami dan tiga orang anaknya. Dua orang anaknya sudah duduk dibangku SMP dan SD, sedangkan anak yang ketiga masih balita. Suaminya berprofesi sebagai seorang petani yang kesehariannya mengerjakan lahan persawahan miliknya. Untuk mengisi hari –harinya dirumah, Ni Komang A. membuka usaha warung dirumahnya. Dengan modal pinjaman sebesar Rp. 5.000.000.-, Ni Komang A. melengkapi warungnya dengan berbagai kebutuhan sehari – hari, seperti aneka makanan dan minuman ringan, beras, minyak dan berbagai jenis bumbu dapur. Karena letak usahanya yang strategis, warung Ni Komang A. cepat berkembang. Dalam sehari Ni Komang A. bisa mendapat keuntungan bersih sebesar Rp. 30.000.- Ni Komang A. sangat bersyukur akan hal itu, karena penghasilannya bisa membantu menopang perekonomian keluarganya, menabung dan mengembalikan pinjaman tepat waktu.

loans.use: Fixture Improvement

loans.name: Agustina's Group

texts.en:
Agustina and Mariela have been part of the community bank “Los Milagros” for close to one year.  In the community bank they have learned how to invest in their business, avoid sickness, and to manage their businesses more efficiently.
Agustina is 37 years old.  She is married and has five children.  Agustina sells food from a stand in the Nery Garcia market.  She has been doing this for one year.  In addition,  Agustina sells tuna, a local fruit, which comes from a cactus, and grains.  Agustina is planning on starting a new business selling candy in addition to her other businesses.  
Mariela is 21 years old.  She is a single mother and has a two-year-old daughter.  Mariela sells shoes in the city of Ayacucho.  The business is actually owned by Mariela’s mother.  In addition, Mariela works on a local television channel.
Agustina and Mariela each need loans of 1000, and 600 soles (3 soles = $1), which they will invest in buying candy, rice, meat, and potatoes.  Another part of their loan will be used to pay for their children’s education.  
They plan to use their savings to increase the capital available to their businesses and opening a store selling food staples such as rice, sugar and flour.

loans.use: Agustina and Mariela each need loans of 1000, and 600 soles (3 soles = $1), which they will invest in buying candy, rice, meat, and potatoes.  Another part of their loan will be used to pay for their children’s education.

loans.name: Jasminka

texts.en: Jasminka was born in 1977 and she lives in Golubinjak, a suburb of town Živinice. She is divorced and has one child. She receives monthly alimony for her son in the amount of  50 KM. This is her first loan in the amount of 1000 KM and Jasminka will use it for buying  foil for strawberries. Her wish is to expand her strawberry  patch.

loans.use: Buying  foil for strawberries.

loans.name: Cristina

texts.es:
Mrs. Cristina G. is a married woman whose husband’s name is Antonio Florentín. They have 3 lovely children together, 2 of whom are underage, while the eldest daughter helps out her mother with the business.

Since 1980, Cristina has owned a clothing boutique, which she managed to set up thanks to a pension that she received from a company for which she used to work.

Cristina sells: t-shirts, jeans, shirts, skirts, dresses, and some shoes. Her previous loans have been used to expand her business. However, she now needs a new loan so that she may purchase more merchandise, namely autumn apparel, because her customers have been requesting it.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Cristina es una mujer casada, su marido se llama Antonio Florentín y ellos son padres de 3 bellos hijos de los cuales 2 son menores y la hija mayor es la que le ayuda a en el negocio a su madre.

Desde 1980 Cristina es dueña de una boutique de ropas, la misma logro montarla gracias a una indemnización cobrada de la empresa donde trabajaba.

Entre las prendas que Cristina vende podemos citar: remeras, jeans, camisas, faldas, vestidos, y algunos calzados. Los créditos anteriores han sido utilizados para ampliar el negocio y hoy solicita uno nuevo para la compra de más mercaderías en especial ropas de la temporada otoño que sus clientes ya le han solicitado.

loans.use: Purchase of jeans, coats, and assorted tops

loans.name: Victorino

texts.es:
Victorino started making and selling ice cream 11 years ago, after leaving his job as a driver because he needed to earn more money to take care of his children. He purchased an ice cream machine on credit, and he and his wife worked together in the business. Now they need more capital to increase their income. They are requesting a loan, to be repaid in six months, to purchase needed supplies. With your support they can continue to grow the business and improve their situation.

Victorino inicio en el negocio de fabricación y venta de helados hace 11 años al dejar su trabajo de chofer de camión urbano por sus bajos ingresos, ya que sus hijos necesitaban mayores ingresos, compro una maquina para hacer helado a crédito, y con su esposa ha trabajado ahora requiere mayor capital de trabajo.

Solicta un préstamo por US $775 que pagara en 6 meses para comprar insumos, con tu poyo el saldrá adelante.

loans.use: TO PURCHASE SUPPLIES FOR THEIR ICE CREAM BUSINESS

loans.name: Robert

texts.id:
Robert’s (40) silversmith business has been going on for years. He employes three persons to help him doing the work and they are paid for more or less about USD 60, depending on the order they receive. This business is very promising, especially on holiday season when a lot of foreigner tourists are ordering silver craft from Robert. The income from the business is used for food and household necessity and some is saved for his children school needs. Robert needs the capital addition to be used to buy raw materials for his silversmith crafts.

Translated from Indonesian by Iman Persada, Kiva Volunteer.

Usaha kerajinan perak yang dijalani oleh Robert (40) sudah berlangsung selama bertahun-tahun. Sampai saat ini dia sudah memiliki 3 orang pekerja yang membantunya membuat kerajinan perak. Setiap bulannya mereka dibayar rata-rata sekitar Rp.600,000. tapi juga bisa lebih atau kurang, tergantung banyaknya order yang diterima. Usaha kerajianan perak yang dimiliki oleh Robert sangat menjanjikan, apalagi dimusim kunjungan wisatawan asing, dimana banyak wisatawan yang memesan perak kepadanya. Penghasilan yang didapat dari usahanya, selain untuk makan dan kebutuhan keluarga, ada juga yang ditabung untuk kebutuhan sekolah anaknya. Saat ini Robert sangat membutuhkan modal untuk usahanya. Rencananya pinjaman kali ini akan digunakan untuk membeli bahan bahu untuk kerajinan peraknya.

loans.use: To ad business capital

loans.name: Alofa

texts.en: Alofa T., 58, is married with nine children. She has many years of experience in the plantation and livestock business, with an averaged expected weekly net income of 500 Tala (~200 USD).  She sells her goods to the villagers and public twice each week. Alofa has had four previous loans through SPBD; these loans are Alofa’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks. She will use her loan to expand and improve her business.

loans.use: Purchase pesticides, barbed wire and other supplies for her plantation and livestock business.

loans.name: Thi De's Group

texts.vi:
Mrs. D. Thi De (ID Number 02040014), is 43 years old. She likes to join this Fund because she sees that it is very convenient to repay the loan on an installment basis. It also helps her to save more and expand her family's business. Together with her husband, she goes around to purchase rice, bean and peanut, etc. everyday to sell. Her family's average daily income is about 100,000VND (approximately 6.30USD) or higher. This time, she would like to borrow 3,186,000VND to expand her business. Her group also consists of:
  • Mrs. D. Thi Bay (ID Number 020015), borrows 3,186,000VND to invest in her business
  • Mrs. N. Thi Hoa (ID Number 020016), borrows 3,186,000VND to purchase general goods to sell
  • Mrs. N. Thi Sau (ID Number 020017), borrows 3,186,000VND to purchase general goods to sell
  • Mrs. C. Thi Loan (ID Number 020018), borrows 3,186,000VND to purchase general goods to sell
  • Mrs. D. Thi Bac (ID Number 020019), borrows 2,006,000VND to invest in her general store
  • Mrs. N. Thi Thu (ID Number 020020), borrows 3,186,000VND to purchase general goods to sell
  • The total amount requested is 1,275.00USD.

    • Translated from Vietnamese by Pham Yen Thanh, Kiva Volunteer.

    chị Đỗ thị Đệ năm nay 43 tuổi, MS 02040014. Chị rất thích tham gia chương trình vì chị thấy hình thức vay và trả rất thuận tiện. Đồng thời nó giúp chị tiết kiệm, và mở rộng mô hình kinh doanh của gia đình mình. Hằng ngày hai vợ chồng chị thường đi mua lạc,đỗ,thóc...mức thu nhập bình quân mỗi ngày của gia đình từ 100.000 VND trở lên. C. kỳ này chị đăng ký vay ở mức 3.186000 VND. Trong nhóm chị có các thành viên sau :

  • chị Đinh thị Bẩy MS 020015 chị vay mức 3.186000 VND về để kinh doanh
  • chị Nguyễn thị Hoa MS 020016 vay mức 3.186000 VND để đi chợ
  • chị Nghiêm thị Sáu MS 020017 vay mức 3.186000 VND để đi chợ
  • chị C. thị Loan MS 020018 chị vay mức 3.186000 VND để kinh doanh
  • chị Đào thị Bắc MS 020019 vay mức 2.006000 VND để bán hàng
  • chị Nghiêm thị Thư MS 020020 vay mức 3.186000 VND để đi chợ

loans.use: Invest in retail activities

loans.name: Diana

texts.en: Diana O. sells food items such as maize, beans, and ground nuts, as well as roofing sheets, at Asebu on the Cape Coast. She has been in this business since 1995. Diana has received a junior high school education, is married, and has 4 children. Her husband is a driver. She is responsible for helping to pay the utility bills and her children's school fees. Her loan will be used to buy more ground nuts, beans, maize, and roofing sheets. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to provide a quality education for her children.

loans.use: To buy more ground nuts, beans, maize, and roofing sheet.

loans.name: Antonia

texts.es:
Antonia es una mujer casad, su esposo trabaja como agricultor y tiene 3 hijos de 18, 15 y 12 años. Inició el negocio para tener ingresos y pagar los estudios de sus hijos. Comenzó hace dos años vendiendo ropa en su domicilio a sus conocidos y poco a poco se fue haciendo de clientes.

Ella necesita un préstamo por US $250 que pagara en 6 meses para comprar mercancía. Con tu apoyo ella saldrá adelante.
texts.en:
Antonia is a married woman. Her husband works as a farmer and together they have 3 children aged 8, 15 and 12 years old. She started her business to have an income to pay for her children's schooling. She started two years ago selling clothes from her home, selling to her acquaintances. Slowly but surely she started a good client base.

She require a loan in the amount of $250, which will be repaid in a term of 6 months. She will used the funds to purchase merchandise. With your support she will continue to move forward.


Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase merchandise.

loans.name: Say

texts.en: Mrs. Say Y. lives in Kradas Village in Kampong Cham Province, and she is a farmer. She owns 2 hectares to cultivate rice. On this plantation, she now cannot cultivate rice because she does not have enough money to buy rice seeds. Therefore, she is requesting a loan to buy rice seeds to plant rice. Mrs. Say Y. is a 47-year-old widow with two children, one of whom is employed in a garment factory, while the other is a farmer.

loans.use: To buy rice seeds to plant rice.

loans.name: Patience

texts.en: Patience G. is a mother of two children who are currently in school. She is a 30-year-old trader. She trades in lace materials. Lace material is very useful in room and office decorations.  For lack of adequate working capital, Patience can buy only small amounts of lace materials to sell.  She believes the loan will enable her to grow her business to the next level. With the loan, she wants to purchase lace materials and textiles in bulk. She hopes to use part of her profit to provide her children with quality educations. Patience belongs to the community group called Morning Star Trust group. The group members guarantee a loan through a repayment pledge and support one another to repay the loan.

loans.use: To purchase lace materials and textiles in bulk

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
Virginia lives in Barangay San Mateo Tumauini, Isabela which is known for its clean and green movement that encourages all its residents to have their own backyard garden planted with different kinds of vegetables. The progress of their village can be seen in its road conditions, street lights, health center, and Barangay Hall. Most villagers are engaged in farming, mainly corn and rice production. 

With the help of her husband Arnel, Virginia operates a beauty salon in their village. Their income from the salon supports their three children namely: Arvie- 12, Arjene- 11, and Jhenel- 9 who are all in the primary level of education. 

After almost eight years of managing a beauty parlor and five years in a small restaurant, Virginia is able to support their daily living and purchased their stall in the public market. She opens her stall at 6:00 in the morning and closes it at 7:00 in the evening unless there are still customers who need tending. At present, she wants a loan amounting to PHP 15,000 for the renovation of the beauty salon so that it will become more comfortable for her customers. Also, part of the loan proceeds will be used in her restaurant to buy raw foods like vegetables, meat, fish, chicken, other ingredients, etc.

Since all her children are still studying in elementary school, Virginia must exert more effort to work hard in order to improve her business and therefore save for the future education of her children.

loans.use: Renovation of beauty salon and purchase of raw foods and ingredients for the restaurant

loans.name: Nuevo Renacer Group

texts.es: Las socias de la banca comunal “Nuevo Renacer” pertenecen a la zona del barrio las pampitas y están representados por la señora Zulma,  la mayoría de las socias tienen sus pequeños negocios en su zona.  Como nexo consanguíneo esta la familia céspedes E. y de afinidad ninguno. Las socias realizan diferentes actividades económicas,  como venta de ropa, cosméticos  zapatos, joyas, y el socio participante atiende su pensión de comida. Como en todo rubro comercial siempre existe la competencia de la oferta y la demanda especialmente en el sector comercio pero ellos saben desenvolverse en el ámbito comercial. El crédito esta destinado para  el incremento de mercadería y al mejoramiento de los ambientes de trabajo. Los socios (as) no tienen mucha experiencia en el trabajo con grupos solidarios pero es un grupo bastante dinámico y dispuesto a asumir la responsabilidad que implica un financiamiento grupal.
texts.en:
The members of the community bank “New Rebirth” belong to an area of the neighbourhood Las Pampitas, and they are represented by Señora Zulma. Most of the members have small children in the neighbourhood. As a blood link, there is the family, raising the field, and absolutely no affiliations. The members do different economic activities, like selling clothing, cosmetics, shoes, jewelry, and the members participate in order to have their allowance of food. As in all commercial areas, there always exists supply and demand, especially in the commercial sector, but they know how to cope with the commercial ambiance. This loan would be destined to increase merchandise and improve working conditions. The members don’t have much experience in working with solidarity groups, but it is a reasonably dynamic group and disposed to assume the responsibility that is implied in group finances.

Translated from Spanish by Jessica Kaminsky, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operating Capital

loans.name: Amanullah

texts.en: Amanullah is the son of D. K.. He lives in district 9 of Kabul, Afghanistan and he supports all his family members through his monthly income. He is a carpet weaver and would like to expand his business. He has requested an individual loan of 30,000 Afghani for a term of 12 months. He is confident that through the loan he can buy good quality weaving materials and can weave carpets for which the demand in the bazaar is high.

loans.use: Buying good quality raw materials for weaving carpets

loans.name: Doris

texts.en: Doris is 26 years old and single. She sells hair extensions and hair cream. She hopes to expand this business. She needs a loan of N60,000 to purchase more hair extensions and hair cream to sell. She says "thanks" to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase hair extensions and hair cream

loans.name: Gregoria

texts.es: Gregoria tiene 43 años y es una madre soltera muy trabajadora, vive en su propia casa con su único hijo Ronald de 24 años. Diariamente realiza artesanías en miniatura, las cuales vende ambulatoriamente por las calles de la ciudad de Puno, recrea con sus manualidades tarros de leche, sacos de harina, bolsas de cemento, sacos de arroz y muchas otras cosas más, pero siempre en un tamaño reducido, puesto que en Puno se tiene la creencia, de que si compras estas cosas en miniatura luego se convierten en realidad. A Gregoria le gusta mucho hacer este trabajo, ya que se divierte mucho y lo realiza como jugando, lleva 15 años en esta actividad y desea poder exportar su producto a otros países y así generarse mejores ingresos. Lo más difícil de su trabajo es realizar todo a mano, lo cual hace que se demore mucho en tener la cantidad necesaria de mercadería para salir a vender. Es el primer préstamo de Gregoria con MFP, sabe que tiene que pagar todas sus cuotas a tiempo y está dispuesta a hacerlo, en su banco comunal es muy alegre y siempre para bromeando con las demás socias. Con los novecientos soles que solicita comprará materiales para la fabricación de sus miniaturas y espera incrementar el número de ventas que tiene actualmente.
texts.en:
Gregoria is a very hard-working 43-year-old single mother. She lives in her own house with her only son, Ronald, who is 24. Every day she makes miniature handicrafts, which she sells by traveling around the streets of the city of Puno. She hand-makes replicas of bottles of milk, sacks of flour, bags of cement, sacks of rice, and many other things, but always in very small sizes, because in Puno they believe that if you buy these things in miniature, they will turn into the real thing. Gregoria really likes her work because it's really fun and she feels like she's playing. She has been doing this for 15 years and wants to be able to export her products to other countries to increase her income. The hardest part of her work is that she has to do everything by hand, so it takes a long time to make enough merchandise to go out and sell. This will be Gregoria's first loan with MFP. She knows she has to make all of her payments on time, and she is willing to do so. She is very happy with her village bank and is always joking around with the other members. She plans to use the 900 soles she is requesting to buy the materials she needs to make her miniature crafts, and she is hoping to expand her current sales.

Translated from Spanish by Jill Heske, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy materials to make her handicrafts

loans.name: Febe

texts.en: Mrs. Febe B. is currently engaging in a sari-sari (convenience store) business. She lacks capital and has turned to Paglaum MPC for a loan of 14,000 PHP to purchase additional goods for her store, as well as for buying firewood and vegetables. She is 49 years old, married with 5 children and lives at Dipolog City. She aspires to send her children to school with the help of her business.

loans.use: To purchase additional goods for a store.

loans.name: Hassan

texts.en:
Hassan has been producing agrifood products since 2007. Hassan is a 59-year old man who lives in Bourj El Barajneh, in the southern suburbs of Lebanon, with his wife and their four children. Hassan has requested a loan of $1000 US from A. Majmoua in order to purchase merchandise for his work. This is the first time that Hassan has requested a loan.

Hassan is known for the good quality of his products. His clients are friends, neighbors and people from his region. He has not faced any difficulties since he first started his business. Hassan decided on this business because he wanted to work independently. In the future, he plans on expanding his business.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise for his business

loans.name: Ana

texts.es: Ana es una mujer muy emprendedora, pues los frutos en su negocio y en su familia son la prueba de la dedicación que pone en cada cosa que realiza con la finalidad de progresar junto a su pareja e hijo, con quienes vive. El esfuerzo de hace 12 años en su bodega han tenido grandes beneficios, pues su empeño y constancia lograron de su negocio el más concurrido de su localidad por la buena atención que brinda y porque siempre está a la disposición de sus clientes. Desde las seis de la mañana abre las puertas de su tienda para atender las necesidades de sus vecinos hasta la media noche, este ritmo de trabajo lo ha estado llevando todos estos años sola, más ahora cuenta con el apoyo de sus hijos, quienes ya son jóvenes y desean apoyarla para hacer más liviano su trabajo. Sin embargo, Ana tiene muchos proyectos por concretar y el más ansiado es la ampliación de su local, pues tiene gran variedad de mercadería que no puede vender porque el espacio le impide que los exhiba, y por ello está dispuesta a remodelar su casa, es el riesgo que está segura de asumir. Este es su treceavo crédito con MFP, Ana es parte de la junta directiva de su banco comunal y su responsabilidad como líder es incentivar a sus compañeras a realizar un buen trabajo. Los 3000 soles que requiere son para la compra de un mueble exhibidor/congelador, el cual es muy costoso, pero necesario para la venta de bebidas.
texts.en:
Ana is an enterprising woman whose fruits of her business and her family are proof of the hard work and determination that she puts into whatever she sets out to do with the aim of getting ahead alongside her husband and son, with whom she lives. Her efforts in her general store these past 12 years have brought great benefits because her determination has helped her business become the most frequented one in the locality because of her good customer service and because she is always at her customers’ disposal. She opens her doors from six in the morning until midnight to meet customer demand. She has fulfilled this shift on her own for years, but she now has the support of her children, who are now older and wish to support their mother in order to lighten her workload. Nevertheless, Ana still has many projects to accomplish, the most desirable of which is expanding her business space because there is a great variety of merchandise that she cannot sell because of the limited display space. For this reason, she is determined to remodel her house—a risk that she is willing to take. This is her 13th loan with MFP. Ana is a part of the board of directors in her microfinance institute, and her responsibility as a leader is to provide an incentive to her group members to do a good job. The 3,000.00 PEN that she is requesting will be used to purchase a convenience store cooler, which is very costly but necessary for beverage sales.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase convenience store cooler

loans.name: Maria Odilia

texts.es: Maria Odilia es una señora que le gusta ocuparse en algo, desde que ella quedo viuda tuvo que sacar a su familia adelante con otras ocupaciones. Pero ahora se dio la oportunidad de poner un puesto de comida, refresco y frituras. El negocio esta ubicado en un parque muy conocido  de la ciudad y visitado por su misma gente; la señora Odilia ya tiene cinco años vendiendo pero ve que le esta funcionando muy bien y quiere invertirle mas para así tener mas ventas y tener una buena utilidad.
texts.en:
Maria Odilia is a woman that enjoys always being occupied in something; since she became a widow she has had to get her family ahead by finding other occupations. Recently she has had the opportunity to open a food, drink, and fritters stand. The business is located in a well-known market in the city and is visited by her same clients; Ms. Odilia already has been selling for five years and because everything is going well she wants to invest more to increase her sales and make better profits.

Translated from Spanish by Mariela Cedeno, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To invest in the business.

loans.name: Juana Angelica

texts.es:
Juana es socia del Bancomunal  Avancemos Juntas
Juana es casada tiene 50 años,  tres hijos, dos gemelas y uno de 11 años que esta estudiando en la escuela estatal. 
Juana, no estudio nada por que se dedico a trabajar para darle educación a sus hijas, hace quince años vende comida, los vecinos la animaron por que la zona donde vive es céntrica, también hace tamales por pedidos para restaurantes y para  sus vecinos. 
Desde que Juana esta en Finca, pudo darle estudios a sus hijas que son policías
Juana necesita un préstamo de 1600 soles, para compra arroz por saco,maíz . 
El sueño de Juana es  techar su casa.
texts.en:
Juana is a member of the Community Bank “ Bancomunal Avancemos Juntas”. She is 50 years old, married and has 3 children, a set of twins and an 11 year old who is studying at a public school. Juana did not go to school because she started to work to provide for her daughters. She has been selling food for fifteen years. Her neighbors encouraged her to start the business since she lives in a central area; she makes tamales to sell to restaurants and neighbors.

Because of “Finca” Juana has been able to give an education to her daughters who are police officers. Juana is asking for a loan of $550 to buy rice and corn. Juana’s dream is to build the roof of her house.

Translated from Spanish by Adriana Pierce, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy sacks of rice and corn

loans.name: Dymphna

texts.en:
Dymphna A. is a 39 year old woman and a mother of two children namely Cazandra Mae and Cheyz June. Dymphna has been a member of ASHI for nine years and her loans from this institution have been very helpful to her and her family. The most significant change she realized about herself when she joined ASHI is her more positive attitude towards other people and perception towards circumstances she is having. Because of the opportunity of loaning she had with ASHI, she developed her self-esteem and she was able to manage her own business.

Residing in a village near the sea, the livelihood of most people is fishing. Dymphna started her buy fish vending business when she first loaned in ASHI while her husband drives a rented motorcycle with sidecar (popularly known as "tricycle"),  which is the main means of transportation of people in the whole municipality. Dymphna is striving hard to grow her business in order to save some of her earnings to buy a tricycle for her husband. In this way, they will earn bigger because her husband doesn't need to pay for the rental of the tricycle and this can also be used as her means to sell her fish directly to people in different villages.

Dymphna's was able to achieve her dream partially when she received her previous loan. She bought a motorcycle yet she still needs to buy a sidecar for a tricycle. This is the reason why Dymphna applied for another loan after her previous one was paid. Some of the amount of her loan will also be used in buying fish to sell.

Once Dymphna achieved her dream for her business, there will be no doubt that she will also achieve her dreams for her children. Cazandra is on her second year in high school while Cheyz is in his Grade 6 in elementary grade. Soon, Dymphna will be having college students and she hoped that she can sustain her children's education. Her loans from ASHI for her business would be a great help for her in achieving those dreams.

loans.use: Purchase of sidecar for motorcycle, and fish to sell.

loans.name: Charlotte

texts.en: Charlotte is 38 years old. She is married and has four children who are all still in school. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in a farming/commercial town in the Brong Ahafo Region of Ghana. She is a trader. She deals in local soap. Charlotte buys the soap from Kumasi and sells it at the local market square. She also hawks to sell in her community and treks to other towns to sell on their market days. She has been in business for four years and wants a loan to buy soap in bulk to increase her stock. Charlotte aspires to give her children a good education.

loans.use: To buy soap

loans.name: Albertina Jacinto

texts.pt:
Albertina jacinto N. de 53 anos de idade natural de matola província de Maputo, solteiro mãe de 3 filhos maiores de idade encontrando a vivem nas suas próprias residências. Estudou ate 6 classe do antigo sistema e vive na sua própria casa com o neto que está sob sua responsabilidade no bairro da Matola 700. 

Albertina cresceu na companhia dos seus pais e teve oportunidade de aprender vários ofícios, dentre os quais o serviço de cabalaria foi o que mais gosta de fazer. Possui um estabelecimento feito de material convencional (salão de cabalaria), onde tem feito os trabalhos de prestação de serviços de beleza.
Tem 30 anos de experiência nesta actividade e desenvolve o negocio sem grandes transtornos, também porque adquire os produtos de beleza a bom preço e tem tido clientes que lhe garantem a estabilidade do negocio. Rende diariamente 350,00MT e no final de cada mês consegue pagar o credito e sustentar a sua família.

Nunca teve empréstimos bancários em outras instituições e tomara conhecimento sobre a existência da Hluvuku-Adsema através da sua filha mais velha. Já levantou dois empréstimos de 6.000,00MT e 8.500,00MT, respectivamente para o exercício de actividade de salão de cabelaria.

Com o credito de 10.000,00MT pretende comprar materiais de construção para ampliar o estabelecimento (salão de cabelaria) para prestar serviços de qualidade aos seus clientes. Tem como desafio, ampliar as instalações e expandir o negocio.

Propõe se a pagar o empréstimo sem problemas para poder aceder a mais créditos com objectivo de fazer crescer o seu negocio e melhorar a situação social da sua família.
texts.en:
Albertina Jacinto N. is 53 years old, a native of Matola in Maputo province. She is a single mother of three children, all of whom are adults and live in their own homes. She studied until sixth grade under the old system, and lives in her own house with a dependent grandson in the neighbourhood of Matola 700. Albertina grew up with her parents and had the opportunity to learn various trades, amongst which hairdressing was the one she most enjoyed doing. She has an establishment made of conventional materials – a hairdressing salon – where she works providing beauty services. She has 30 years of experience in this activity and runs her business without great difficulty, in part because she acquires beauty products at a good price, and has had customers that guarantee her stability for her business. This yields 350 MT per day, and at the end of every month she is able to pay her loan and support her family. She has never had bank loans with other institutions, and came to learn about the existence of Hluvuku-Adsema through her oldest daughter. She has already taken out two loans, for 6,000 MT and 8,500 MT respectively, for carrying out the activities of her hairdressing salon. With the loan of 10,000 MT, she plans to purchase construction materials to increase the size of her establishment (hairdressing salon) to provide quality services to her customers. She has challenged herself to enlarge the installation and expand her business. She proposes to pay back the loan without problems in order to access more loans, with the objective of growing her business and improving the social situation of her family.

Translated from Portuguese by Heidi Petersen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of construction materials to build onto salon

loans.name: Aulio Moises

texts.es: Don Moises es originario de la comunidad de chiY. su actividad principal  como secretario de la oficina Juridica del Licenciado Julio Viviano,  hoy necesita de un credito para la culminacion de estudio de un su hijo como maestro de educacion primaria y en pensum de estudio esta la realizacion de un seminario sobre el tema de la contaminacion del medio ambiente, en donde se necesita bastante material  e instrumento para su realizacion y la cual no esta en la posibilidad economica por ello necesita de un credito para satisfacer las necesidad de su hijo

loans.use: Gastos de Estudios

loans.name: James' Group

texts.en:
M. James is 47 years old and the leader of his lending group in Ibanda. He is married with ten children aged between 24 and 2 years and all are in school.

James is a hardworking and determined man with a dairy farming business that he has been running for over fifteen years. He has cows that give him milk for sale and at times he buys from other farmers who do not have the means to transport their own milk. He also has a banana plantations that provides matooke (plantain) both for sale and for home consumption and this helps him pay school fees for his children.

James needs a loan to help him buy drugs and farm inputs which will enable him get enough quantity and quality of milk production.

loans.use: To buy drugs and farm inputs to improve his milk production

loans.name: Noeme

texts.en:
Noeme lives in the rural village of Gomez, San Isidro, Isabela. She is married to Ronald whose occupation is farming. They help each other in maintaining their livelihood so as to be able to provide their children with a better way of living.

Noeme manages a hog-raising business to give them an alternative source of income aside from farming. In this way, they can further support the needs of their family and the educational needs of their children.

Due to the difficulties of life, Noeme is asking for financial assistance from Kiva lenders in maintaining the needed feed supply of her hogs. She is asking for a loan of PHP 5,000 that will serve as business capital in maintaining her hog-raising business.

Noeme believes that her business is a great help in sending her two children to school. They are: Jay – 9 years old and John Kennedy – 8 years old. She is hoping that she will be able to help supply the important needs of her family by doing well in her pig business.

loans.use: To use as additional capital for her business

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Mrs. Gloria A. is engaged in the fattening of pigs. Her business is located in their village of San Jose Norte 1, Mallig, Isabela.

Mrs. A. ventured first in a retailing business through a variety store. Though her variety store business allows her to support the daily needs of her family she then decided to engage into raising pigs because she learned that she can earn more income in that business. With that, she decided to obtain a loan of Php 7,000 from ASKI which she will use to purchase feed for her pigs.

Mrs. A. is blessed with two children and at present she serves as a mother and father to her children. Their first child has already finished her studies and is presently working in Manila as a factory worker.

loans.use: To buy pig feed

loans.name: Dolores

texts.en:
This is Dolores S., 43 years old, with her husband Amancio, a shoe repairman. They live in Camarin, Caloocan City. Their eldest child is now in college and the youngest is in high school. Dolores owns a small general store where she sells, among other things, second-hand shoes which her husband salvages and repairs. They’ve been doing this for the last ten years, earning about P12,000.00 a month. The children’s education is their top priority, so Dolores budgets a substantial portion of her profits for their education. She is now on her 3rd loan cycle with the Center for Community Transformation (CCT) Credit Cooperative and is requesting a loan of P8,000.00 to improve her business.

About CCT The Center for Community Transformation (CCT) is an organized Christian response against poverty and social injustice. This is carried out through the fusion of social development initiatives and evangelical mission in a uniquely Filipino context. It serves urban and rural poor communities throughout the Philippines, in pursuit of its desire to see changed lives, strong families, and transformed communities centered in the Lordship of Jesus Christ.

CCT is a member of the Five Talents family.

loans.use: Additional capital

loans.name: Delia

texts.en:
At the age of 49, Delia is running a typical village store. She has been operating her store for almost two years now at Ramona, Angadanan. She wanted to acquire more income, so she needs a loan of 10,000 PHP to purchase more grocery items to sell. She has a daily net income of $6.75 a day, but her income is insufficient to maintain her business. She’s hoping to produce more income to support the education of her children.

Delia is married to Romeo M., who works as a carpenter in their village. The couple has been blessed with five children, three of whom are already married. The others are still single and presently studying. Their house is in front of their village rest house. She hopes that some generous lenders will grant her loan, for continuous productivity.

loans.use: To purchase more grocery items to sell

loans.name: Kancharisun Group

texts.es:
Nuestros socios, pertenecen al banco comunal “KANCHARISUN”. El nombre del banco comunal es D. origen del Quechua que traducido al español significa “iluminemos”. Este banco comunal está conformado por 16 miembros, ellos se reúnen una vez al mes en el local principal D. La Asociación Arariwa.  

Apolinaria tiene un puesto D. negocio donD. venD. ricos jugos D. varias frutas como jugo D. papaya, jugo plátanos, etc. Las socias Elizabeth, Lelia, Maria Laura y MatilD. se dedican a la enseñanza en diversos colegios del Cusco, ellas se esfuerzan por aprender a usar las tecnologías D. la información para enseñar a sus alumnos. La socia Manuela es asistente D. administración en la municipalidad del distrito D. San Sebastián. Otra D. nuestras socias se dedica a la venta D. artesanías como huacos retratos, collares, adornos con las características del Cusco y muchas cosas más. La socia Martha tiene 36 años es coordinadora del vaso D. leche. El programa social D. vaso D. leche es para apoyar a mujeres D. bajos recursos económicos, Nuestra socia Martha es casada y tiene un hijo y comprenD. lo muy trabajoso que es tener un hijo y educarlo y por eso ayuda en el programa social. Los otros socios trabajan haciendo servicio D. transportes y vendiendo juguetes en la ferias dominicales del Cusco. 

Los socios solicitan el préstamo para que lo utilicen como capital D. trabajo y asi D. esta manera incrementar sus productos y aumentar sus ventas, para dar mejor calidad D. vida a sus familias 

Los socios valoran y agradecen el préstamo otorgado mediante este medio y así mismo se comprometen a cumplir con el pago D. sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Our members belong to the KANCHARISUN Communal Bank. This Quechuan name of the bank is translated in Spanish as “iluminemos” (Light Givers). This bank is composed of 16 members and they meet once a month at the main office of La Asociación Arariwa (The Arariwa Association). Apolinaria has a stand where she sells a variety of wonderful fruit juices, such as papaya juice, plantain juice, etc. The members Elizabeth, Lelia, Maria Laura and MatilD. work at teaching in various schools in Cuzco. They are working to learn to use information technology in order to teach their students. Our member Manuela is an administrative assistant for the municipality of the District of San Sebastian. Others of our members work at selling handicrafts such as portraiture pottery, necklaces and ornaments characteristic of Cuzco, and many other things. Our member Martha is 36 years old and is the coordinator for Vaso D. Leche (Glass of Milk). This social assistance program provides support to women of low economic resources. Martha is married and has a son, and she understands what hard work it is to have a child and to educate him. That's why she assists with this social program. The other members are working at transportation services and selling toys at the Sunday Fairs in Cuzco. The members are requesting this loan for their use as working capital in order to increase their products and also their sales, so that they can proviD. a better quality of life for their families. The members value and appreciate the loan bestowed by this means, and at the same time they promise to comply with the installment payments according to the established plan.

Translated from Spanish by Daniel Kvaka, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy merchandise or for personal use.

loans.name: Janet

texts.en:
Janet is 69 years old. She is widowed and has given birth to eight children, some of whom are still in school. She lives with some of her children in a rented apartment in Axim. Axim is along the coastal area in the western region of Ghana. Fishing is the major occupation of the people there. 

Janet is a trader. She trades in cereals such as maize, rice, beans, etc. She buys from nearby communities and treks to sell in nearby towns. She has been in this business for 10 years and wants a loan to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy cereals

loans.name: Esther

texts.en: Esther is a married mother of three children. Her husband has been supportive but his business has slowed down, pushing most burdens on her. Esther is a 44-year-old trader. She believes in hard work and dedication as the primary antidote to minimizing poverty. She is very serious about her business. She trades in food items, such as plantain. Plantains can be used for fufu (thick porridge) and a local food called “ampesie”(plantain stew), served with sauce. She started her business twenty-five years ago, to bring in more income to take care of her children. She wants to use the loan to buy a larger supply of plantains to serve her customers throughout the season. She hopes to use the loan to take direct stock from the farmers, rather than the intermediaries who sell to her at a higher price. She would be glad for the loan assistance.

loans.use: To buy bulk supply of plantain and cassava.

loans.name: Hermila

texts.es:
Nuestra socia pertenecen al banco comunal “AHORRO ES PROGRESO - SAYLLA”, Nuestra socia vive en el distrito de Saylla, ubicado a 30 minutos en bus local de la ciudad del Cusco. Saylla es lugar de los restaurantes más famosos al aire libre, aquí se pude venir cualquier día de la semana a disfrutar del paisaje mientras se saborea de un deliciosos plato típico de Perú y en especial de a ciudad del Cusco, el chicharrón, (elaborado a base de carne de cerdo son trozos de 3 a 4 acompañadas con papas doradas y choclo dulce o salado con una ensalada de cebolla y hierba buena tipo menta).

Nuestra socia es la Sra. HERMILA, tiene 43 años de edad, es casada y tiene 3 hijos de 17, 10, 1 año y medio de edad, nuestra socia alterna sus actividades del hogar con el comercio minorista,  La socia tiene un restaurante chicharronería y vende el tradicional chicharrón entre otros y bebidas frías y calientes, La socia solicita el préstamo para poder comprar vajilla para el negocio, ella comprará tenedores, cuchillos, cucharas y cucharitas, también platos hondos y tendidos.

 La socia agradece y valora la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio, así mismo se compromete en cumplir con el pago de su deuda en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Our member belongs to the communal bank "Ahorro es Progreso - Saylla". She lives in the district of Saylla, located 30 minutes from the city of Cusco by bus. Saylla is home to the most well known open air restaurants, where you can go any day of the week to enjoy the scenery while savoring a delicious traditional Peruvian dish, especially the chicharron from the city of Cusco (made from pork, 3 or 4 pieces accompanied with golden potatoes and sweet corn, and a salad with onion and mint. Hermila is 43 years old, married, and has 3 children; ages 17, 10, and 1 and a half. She alternates her household chores with retail trade. She has a restaurant where she sells traditional chicharron, among other things, as well as cold and hot drinks. Our partner is requesting this loan in order to be able to purchase dinner sets for her business. She will buy forks, knives, spoons and teaspoons, as well as soup dishes and tablecloths. Our partner is grateful and values this opportunity provided to her through this medium. Likewise, she is committed to fulfill her payments in the established time frame.

Translated from Spanish by Mark Broscoe, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase dinner sets for her restaurant

loans.name: Isaias

texts.es:
Isaías, de 28 años, es un joven muy sencillo y trabajador, vive en la casa de sus familiares junto a su madre Carmen de 53 y lo que más desea es sobre salir en la vida.

Él trabaja junto a su madre en un quiosco de comida ubicado en uno de los mercados más importantes de la ciudad. Su negocio es muy concurrido por las personas que desean servirse un delicioso platillo nocturno, siendo la especialidad de su madre el arroz con fideos y papas fritas, platillo con el cual se ha hecho muy conocida entre sus comensales.
Por otro lado, lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es atender a los clientes, lleva 3 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es encontrar el tiempo necesario para realizar sus estudios universitarios. 
Para el futuro, espera juntar el dinero necesario para implementar un restaurante para su madre, donde puedan brindar un mejor servicio a sus clientes.

Este es el segundo préstamo de Isaias con MFP, sabe que tiene que pagarlo a tiempo, puesto que no quiere causarle problemas a las socias de su banco comunal, donde es uno de los pocos varones, y siente que tiene el compromiso de ser muy responsable. Con los mil nuevos soles solicitados comprará más ingredientes para preparar sus deliciosos platillos.
texts.en:
Isaías, 28, is an unassuming and hardworking young person who lives in his family's home with his 53 year-old mother, Carmen. What he desires most is to succeed in life. He works with his mother in a kiosk where they sell food, located in one of the most important markets in the city. His business is very busy because of the many people who want to have a delicious meal served at night. His mother's specialty is rice with noodles and fried potatoes, a dish with which she has become well known amongst the diners. What he enjoys most about the work is attending to the customers. He has been carrying out this activity for 3 years now, and what he finds most difficult is to find the time he needs to complete his studies at the university. In the future, he hopes to gather together the money needed to open a restaurant for his mother, where she can provide better service to her customers. This is his 2nd loan with MFP, and he knows that he has to make the payments on time. He does not want to create problems with the members of his communal bank where he is one of a small number of men, and he feels that he has a commitment to be very responsible. With the 1,000 Peruvian soles requested he will buy more ingredients to prepare his delicious dishes.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy food, ingredients for his meals

loans.name: Sendenbadam

texts.en: Sendenbadam is 58 years old and lives with her husband and two children in Bayanhongor province, Mongolia. She and her family live together in a ger, the Mongolian nomadic tent. Their quality of life is average. She provides vegetables to her family by planting them during the summer. Sendenbadam's son owns and operates a horsecart. Sendenbadam started her water selling business with a horse cart in 1990. Currently, they have been using 9 horse carts for their business, and providing jobs for six people. They will continue this business. Sendenbadam is a very hardworking person and says, “I will constantly operate this business and from the business’ profit I will buy a car for my son.”

loans.use: To purchase horse hay and to buy a car.

loans.name: Mrs. Chroeun Seng Village Bank Group

texts.en:
This village bank loan has sixteen members who live in Phnum Lonteah village in Takeo province. They will each use the loan for a different purpose.

Mrs. Chroeun S. is the village bank president who has been selected by the members. She is a farmer who owns a small 1.5-hectare (3.75-acre) piece of land on which she cultivates rice to support her family. Her husband, Mr. Saret Phor, is a motorbike taxi driver.

In the rice field, they have a problem because it is time to farm but they do not have enough money to grow their crop. Hence, Mrs. Chroeun S. decided to apply for a loan to grow rice during this growing season.

This couple has four children, three of whom are attending the local public school, while the other is too young to go to school or work.

loans.use: To grow rice during this growing season

loans.name: Antonia

texts.es:
Antonia, tiene 44 años, tiene cuatro hijos, es una madre responsable que saca adelante a sus hijos y quiere darles una profesión para que puedan defenderse mejor en la vida. 

Antonia es mujer trabajadora que se dedica a  la venta de artesanía como por ejemplo al tallado de piedra y confección de chompas de lana, ella tiene un pequeño taller donde confecciona sus productos y nos cuenta que se levanta muy temprano para hacer sus actividades del hogar y después sale a vender sus productos. Ya son 13 años que se dedica al negocio y le ha ido muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo.
 
Antonia requiere el préstamo para comprar materiales de trabajo como por ejemplo lana y piedra fina. 
 
La socia se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Antonia is 44 years old and has four children. She is a responsible mother who succeeds on behalf of her children so that they will be able to pursue a profession and have a better life.

Antonia is a hardworking woman who sells crafts such as stone carvings and handmade wool sweaters. She has a small workshop where she makes her products. Antonia says she wakes up very early to complete her household activities and then leaves to sell her products. She has been in this business for 13 years and has done very well because of the effort she puts into her work.

Antonia needs a loan in order to buy materials for her work, such as wool and fine stone. She is grateful for this opportunity and commits to making her payments on time.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase wool & fine stone

loans.name: Djiguiya Group

texts.fr:
Les femmes du groupe Djiguiya, toutes mariées, ont en moyenne 33 ans, 4 enfants et vivent dans des familles traditionnelles élargies à Sirimou, sous préfecture de Fana, Région de Koulikoro (deuxième région  administrative de la république du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté et font le commerce de sacs de charbon de bois et de céréales tels Awa C..
 Après trois prêts tous correctement remboursés, ces femmes du groupe Djiguiya sont à leur quatrième prêt solidaire et Awa C. compte utiliser le sien  pour acheter, des sacs de céréales au niveau du village et dans les environs. Elle effectue sa vente sur place, au marché de Tingolé et dans les foires environnantes, au comptant, en détail et à crédit, à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes.
Elle envisage réaliser  un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 20.000FCFA qui sera utilisé dans les dépenses  quotidiennes de la famille et le reste sera  réinvesti dans les activités de commerce.
texts.en:
The women of the Djiguiya group are all married, are on average 33 years old with four children, and all live in traditional extended families in Sirimou, in the Fana sub-prefecture of the Koulikoro region (2nd administrative region of the Republic of Mali). They became acquainted through family ties and trade charcoal and grain cereals like Awa C.. After fully reimbursing three previous loans, the Djiguiya group women are requesting a fourth group loan. Awa C. will use her portion of the loan to buy bags of cereals locally, in the village and the surrounding area. She sells locally at the Tingolé market and in surrounding market fairs, for cash, retail and on credit, to both women and men customers. She hopes to reach an average monthly income of 20,000 FCFA which will be used for daily family expenses, the remainder being reinvested in the commercial activities.

Translated from French by René McConnell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy grain cereals

loans.name: Norma

texts.es:
Norma es socia D. Banco Comunal Sumacc Huayta que significa Bella Flor en quechua.
Norma es soltera y tiene 41 años, Norma tiene un taller de confección de prendas de vestir en su casa, realiza trabajos de alta costura y ropa típica, sus productos los vende en el puesto de su hermana.
Norma necesita un préstamo de 1500 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de telas.
Norma sueña con ampliar su negocio.
texts.en:
Norma, 41, is a member of the Sumacc Huayta (Beautiful Flower in Quechua) communal bank. She has a seamstress workshop in her home where she makes both haute couture and traditional articles of clothing; she sells her items in her sister’s stand. Norma needs a 1500 sol loan to buy fabric. Norma dreams with enlarging her business.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fabric.

loans.name: Maribel

texts.es:
Nuestra socia pertenece al banco comunal “KILLA”; Nuestra socia vive en el distrito de Huanchac en la provincia de Cusco, departamento de Cusco.

Nuestra socia es la  Sra. Maribel,  ella tiene 26 años de edad es madre soltera y tiene 1 hijo de  7 años de edad, Nuestra socia alterna sus actividades del hogar con el préstamo de servicios de llamadas telefónicas a celulares nacionales; La socia es una madre trabajadora y por no separarse de su niño cuando no está en sus clases está con ella en un pequeño espacio que acondiciono de forma ambulante, trabaja desde las 7 a.m. hasta a las 7 p. m. Nuestra socia solicita el préstamo para  recargar sus celulares.
  
La socia agradece y valora el apoyo brindado mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de su deuda en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Our partner belongs to the Killa village bank and lives in the Huanchac district in Cusco, Peru. Her name is Maribel and she is a 26 year old single mother with one son who is 7. She juggles her household duties with her business offering national cell phone calling services. She is a hard-working mother who has found a way for her son to be with her when he is not in school and while she is out selling her phone services. She works from 7 am to 7 pm. She is seeking a loan to recharge her cell phones with more minutes. She is grateful for the support she is receiving and promises to repay her debt on time.

Translated from Spanish by Scott Crandall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Recharge cell phones with more minutes

loans.name: Melly

texts.en:
Melly A. is a 52-year-old widow who supports her family by running a general store business. She lives in Phase III, Blk 7, Lot 7, Urban San Carlos City, Negros Occidental with her three children aged between 18 and 32 years. Two of her children work and the other is currently in school.
Melly has been a member of Kiva partner, NWTF-Project Dungganon, since 2005. She has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her general store business, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of 5,000 PHP.
Melly is now borrowing 10,000 PHP as additional working capital for her general store. This will be her 17th loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of 10,000 PHP, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey toward economic freedom. Melly aspires to elevate her family’s living conditions and ensure their future wellbeing by following the 'Dungganon' way.

About NWTF
In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means 'honorable'). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them 'Dungganon' – a title of esteem that is bestowed on a member of the community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

loans.use: As additional working capital

loans.name: Luz Argentina

texts.es:
Luz Argentina C. de 55 años es una persona trabajadora y madre abnegada  que le brindo todo lo que estuvo a alcance a sus cuatro hijos los cuales son mayores de edad. Ella tiene una tienda de abarrotes donde vende de todo un poco desde granos básicos, ropa, bisutería, zapatos, chinelas etc.
 
C. invertirá el crédito en surtir su tienda especialmente en comprar quintal de arroz, frijoles, azúcar, maíz, harina, maseca, etc.  El sueño de ella es poder trabajar con su propio capital pero para ello necesita aumentar sus inversiones.
texts.en:
Luz Argentina C., 55, is a hard-working and selfless mother who gave everything she had at to her four children who are now all adults. She has a grocery store where she stocks a bit of everything from basic grains to clothing to costume jewelry to shoes to slippers, etc. C. will use the funds to buy stock items for her store, especially rice, beans, sugar, corn, flour, cornmeal, etc. Her dream is to work with her own capital but to reach that goal she needs to increase her investments.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy stock merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Fe

texts.en:
Fe S. is a 45-year-old married woman who supports her family by selling eggs. She lives in Purak Bontoy, Barangay Ticad, Bantayan, in the province of  Cebu with her husband and their six children. One of their children has their own family already while the rest are going to school.

Fe has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2002 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her egg-selling business, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of Php 15,000.

Fe is now borrowing Php 25,000 so that she can use it as additional working capital. This will be her 17th loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of Php 29,500, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey towards economic freedom.

Fe aspires to elevate her family’s living conditions and ensure their future wellbeing by following the “Dungganon” way.


 About NWTF:
In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress out of earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

loans.use: To use as additional working capital for her business

loans.name: Sofía Esperanza

texts.es: Sofía Esperanza A. Vda. D. C., es una señora muy alegre y trabajadora, quien se dedica a elaborar tortillas en su casa D. habitación, vive en Tonacatepeque, ubicado en el departamento D. San Salvador. Vive junto a su esposo D. 66 años D. edad, y junto a sus hijos los cuales son menores D. edad y se dedica a estudiar. A sus 55 años D. edad, Sofía trabaja muy duro elaborando tortillas D. lunes a domingo, sus hijos le ayudan en el negocio, repartiendo las tortillas en las casa D. los diferentes clientes. Sofía es una señora que se esfuerza por sacar adelante a su familia y D. esta forma brindarle ayuda a su esposo con todos los gastos del hogar, lo cual es muy necesario para poder salir adelante. Es por esta razón que ella solicita un préstamo a Integral con el deseo D. comprar maíz por mayor para obtenerlo a precios más bajo, D. esta forma ella podrá obtener mayores ganancias las cuales sean D. mucho beneficio para su hogar.
texts.en:
Sofía Esperanza A. Vda. D. C. is a cheerful and hardworking woman. She makes tortillas out of her home in Tonacatepeque, which is located in the Department of San Salvador. Sofía lives with her husband, age 66, and her dependent children who are in school. At 55 years of age, she continues to work very hard making tortillas Monday to Sunday. Her children help with the business by delivering tortillas to the homes of her various customers. Sofía is a woman who is determined to move her family forward and proviD. assistance to her husband in covering all of the household expenses necessary for them to succeed.

For this reason, she is requesting a loan from Apoyo Integral. She wants to buy corn in bulk so that she can receive the lowest price. This will allow her to generate better earnings, which will be of great benefit to her household.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase corn in bulk

loans.name: Ángela Concepción

texts.es: Ángela Concepción L. D. A. D. 46 años D. edad, es una señora muy trabajadora la cual comercializa leche, crema, queso y todos sus derivados, esto lo venD. en su casa y así mismo se dedica a la venta D. ropa para damas. Ángela vive junto a su esposo el cual trabaja como comerciante D. productos varios, y también vive junto a tres hijos D. 19, 17 y 14 años D. edad, los cuales se dedica a estudiar. Ángela quien se dedica D. lleno a su familia, venD. los diferentes tipos D. lácteos en su hogar, en donD. sus hijos le ayudan a atender el negocio, mientras ella sale a vender la ropa D. forma ambulante por diferentes pueblos, y cantones D. Usulután, departamento en el cual vive junto a su familia. Ella solicita un préstamo a Integral con el deseo D. poder invertir en sus negocios, y D. esta forma comprar los productos lácteos por mayor y así obtenerlos a precios más bajos, D. esta misma forma ella quiere invertir en la venta D. ropa, comprando más variedad D. prendas D. vestir y así obtener más clientes. Angela desea mucho obtener mayores ganancias ya que las ganancias generadas por su esposo no dan a basto con todo lo necesario en el hogar, es por esto que es preciso seguir adelante con las ventas hechas por ella y obtener la mayor cantidad D. ganancias posibles.
texts.en:
Ángela Concepción L. D. A., age 46, is a very hard-working woman. She sells milk, cream, cheese, and all of its derivatives. She sells in her house. She also sells women’s clothing. Ángela lives with her three children; ages 19, 17, and 14. The children go to school. Ángela devotes herself entirely to her family. She sells different types of dairy products in her home. Her children help her take care of the business when she leaves to sell clothes in an itinerant manner in the different towns and cantons in the Usulután department, which is where she lives with her family. She is requesting a loan from Integral because she wishes to be able to invest in her businesses. She will buy dairy products wholesale for a lower price. She also wants to invest is her business of selling clothes. She will buy a variety of garments and get more customers. Ángela wants to get greater income because the income generated by her husband does not cover all of the household necessities. That is precisely why she will continue on with the sales she has maD. and get the greatest income possible.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy dairy products and clothes to sell

loans.name: David Carlos

texts.es: El Sr David vive en la ciudad de la Paz, en la zona de Pasankeri sur, la casa donde vive fue heredado por los padres como terreno, en la actualidad tiene una construcción de dos plantas que fue fruto del  trabajo del cliente, tiene un  1 niño de 4 años de edad vive con su esposa la Sra.  Virginia  que apoya a don David en todas sus actividades impulsándolo en las malas y en las buenas. El Sr. Se dedica a la construcción de ataúdes para muertos, Cuenta con 10 años en este rubro mismo que fue adquirido como ayudante del tío durante su juventud. El crédito será utilizado para comprar una maquina cortadora de madera que el cliente la denomina cierra circular sin fin, esta muy agradecido con la institución por el apoyo, en la foto el Sr se encuentra en compañia de su esposa.
texts.en:
David lives in the Pasankeri Sur area of La Paz. Both the house he lives in and the lot it’s on were passed down to him from his parents. He currently has a two-story house that he got through his own efforts. He has a one-year-old son and lives with his wife, Virginia, who supports all David’s efforts inspiring him both in good times and bad. David manufactures coffins. He has been in this line of work for 10 years having learned the trade as a young man working as his uncle’s assistant. He will use the funds to buy a band saw that he calls a “never ending circular saw.” He is very grateful to the institution for the support. His wife is pictured with him in the photo.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a band saw.

loans.name: Trust In We Group

texts.en:
These are women with small-scale businesses in Makeni, a city in northern Sierra Leone. They have come to SMT, a Kiva partner, to seek a loan of SLL 800,000 each to enable them to expand their businesses. With a loan of SLL 800,000, they will each be able to add more stock to their business, make more sales, and make more profit. 

Ramatu K. is the leader of this group. She was born in Makeni forty-two years ago and is married with three children. Her husband works for the city council and one of her children is attending primary school. 

Ramatu sells slippers and has been doing this for many years now. With her share of the loan, she will expand her business by buying more slippers wholesale to add to her stock. 

Attached to this photo is a snapshot of a borrower who was not able to be present for the group photo.

loans.use: To buy slippers in large quantity to sell

loans.name: Handdorj

texts.en:
Handdorj S. is 69 years old and lives with his wife in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. He and his wife live together in a 'ger', a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent in a 'ger' district of Ulaanbaatar. His wife is retired. 

Handdorj operates a shoe repair business. He has been repairing a variety of boots in his workshop near the bus station in Ulaanbaatar, since 2000. He also makes felt slippers for sale. His daily average income is between 20,000-30,000 MNT.
