 Handdorj hopes to grow his business. He is requesting a 800,000 MNT loan in order to buy more repair materials and supplies for his business.

loans.use: To buy more repair materials and supplies

loans.name: Teofila

texts.en:
Teofila M. is a married woman who lives in Purok Mangga, Brgy. Dumlog, Toledo City, Cebu. She earns her living by operating 3 business ventures: restaurant/food vending, dressmaking, and vegetable vending.  Her husband, Edgardo B. M., who is 55 years old, works as a Mechanic to earn his living and also helps with his wife's business activities. They have 10 children who are 18 to 32 years old.

Teofila joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 1999 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past 16 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Teofila has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 12,000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 6,000, thus uplifting the family's standard of living.  This time, for her 17th cycle loan, she is borrowing PHP 12,000, which she intends to use to purchase raw materials for her restaurant so that she can continue to save up for the future and her children's education. Teofila M. is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path towards the achievement of her dreams.

About NWTF:  In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.  Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: To purchase raw materials for restaurant.

loans.name: Tulipanes De Orizaba Group

texts.es:
Esta foto fue tomada en la casa D. Roberta Consuelo H. un integrante del grupo Tulipanes D. Orizaba que está ubicado en el Estado D. Veracruz en México. Se ve al grupo D. mujeres en el bazar D. la señora Roberta que se ubica dentro D. su domicilio en la foto. Ella se dedica a  compra y venta D. muebles y artículos usados que inicio hace 2 años. Solicita el préstamo para compras más muebles y enseres para vender. Sus  clientes la consideran una persona honesta y trabajadora. Al momento D. solicitar este préstamo se siente contenta por reactivar su negocio con más mercancía D. la que tiene actualmente. Tiene 50 años, estudio hasta la carrera D. enfermería, es soltera y tiene en total 1 hijo varón. Quiere este crédito para comprar más cosas usadas para vender y hacer crecer su negocio. También espera poder comprar un terreno para pasar su bazar para allá y adecuar su casa ahí mismo ya que actualmente renta el lugar donD. vive y tiene su bazar.
Margarita J. es la presidente del grupo. Tiene 61 años,  estudió hasta carrera comercial, es casada  y no tiene hijos. Ella se dedica a la venta D. ropa que inicio hace 5 años. Solicita el préstamo para comprar ropa D. temporada para vender.El grupo esta conformado por 9 integrantes.
texts.en:
This picture was taken in the home of Roberta Consuelo H., a group member of Tulipanes from Orizaba which is located in the state of Veracruz in Mexico.   The women in the picture are seen in the variety store located insiD. Roberta's home.  She started buying and selling used furniture and other used items 2 years ago.  She will use the loan to purchase more furniture and appliances to sell.  Her clients consider her to be an honest and hard-working person.  She is very happy upon requesting the loan, knowing she can stock her business with more merchandise than what she has now.  She is 50 years old, single, has one boy, and studied nursing in school.  She wants this loan to purchase more used items to sell and be able to grow her business.  She also hopes to purchase some land so she can move her variety store and build a home there since she currently rents where she is at now.

Margarita J. is the president of the group, she is 61 years old, married, no children, and studied business in school.  Five years ago she began selling clothes and is requesting the loan to purchase clothes that are in season for re-sale.  The group is maD. up of 9 members.

loans.use: Purchase furniture and appliances for re-sale.

loans.name: Flor

texts.es: Flor, de 23 años, es una mujer “luchadora” que, como toda madre soltera, trabaja para mantener a su hija Dennis, de 4 años; a la que cuida y educa en casa de sus padres; ubicado en la zona rural de Santa Clara. Su principal aspiración es construir su casa propia, en la que pueda brindarle las comodidades suficientes a su pequeña hija; por ello todas las mañanas, trabaja con ahínco en sus terrenos de cultivo. Ya tiene 3 años dedicándose a la agricultura; los sembríos de papa, es su principal actividad, es así que las diferentes variedades de la misma, le permite vender su producción todo el año, Sin “mayores dificultades”, menciona. Pero no solo  a ello se dedica Flor, también se encarga del cuidado de 3 vacas de buena raza, que le proporciona la leche necesaria, para poder preparar “queso”, el que después comercializa a buen precio, entre los pobladores de su localidad. Es el quinto crédito con MFP, y al ver el progreso que tuvo gracias a su banco comunal, recomendó a su hermano, para que pueda; como ella, salir adelante. Con el crédito que obtendrá, comprará abono y semilla de papa de la variedad “única”, con ello piensa, abastecer  su producción para la campaña agrícola que se aproxima.
texts.en: Flor is 23 years old and she is a fighter.  Like all single mothers, she works to care for her daughter, Dennis, of 4 years, who she takes care of and educates in her parents house; located in the rural area of Santa Clara. Her main aspiration is to build her own house, so that she can provide the commodities necessary for her small daughter. Because of this, she works eagerly every morning on her crops. She has worked in agriculture for 3 years, the potato crop being her main activity so that different varieties of the same crop can be sold throughout the year without "major difficulties", she says. However, this is not all Flor does, she also cares for 3 cows of good breed, which give enough milk to prepare "cheese", which is later sold at a good price from local villagers. This is her fifth loan with MFP, and seeing the progress she has had thanks to the community bank, she advised her brother to do the same so that he can, like her, get ahead. With the loan she receives, she will buy fertilizer and a variety of "única" potato seeds, with this she believes she can supply her production for the approaching agriculture season.

loans.use: To buy potato seeds and fertilizer for her next harvest.

loans.name: Em

texts.en: Em S., 36, is a blacksmith in Takeo province. He is married with four children. On average, he is able to make about $6 USD per day. His wife, pictured here, stays at home. Since 2003 she has been raising pigs and makes $4 USD a day. Em S. is asking for a loan of $1,000 USD to purchase blacksmith tools.

loans.use: To purchase blacksmith tools

loans.name: Teresa

texts.en:
This is Teresa B., 48, a resident of Caloocan City, Philippines. Finishing only elementary school, Teresa is ever determined to break people's low expectations of her. She is a CCT* community partner and is married to Elmer, 39, an auto mechanic. They have been blessed with eight children, three of whom are already employed and five are still studying in elementary and high school.

Teresa's home serves both as an abode of rest and a venue for business, because at her home she has set up a sari-sari (variety) store to earn a living. She sells a wide range of products to the neighborhood, which includes items from rice and noodles to detergent powder and soap bars. With this, Teresa earns a net average of Php300 per day. She is working hard in her business and to make sure she helps her husband earn a living. 

To help her continue of her business, she is requesting a Php10,000 loan. Adding more products to her store is a priority for her to improve her business,  She looks forward to making the store grow and eventually expand.

At present, Teresa finds it hard to follow up customers who do not pay their debts on time. But just like any other hardworking entrepreneur, Teresa sees to it that no challenge will  ever wear her out. She dreams of having her variety store improve thus enabling her children to finish their college education and eventually get a stable job.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To add more stock to her variety store

loans.name: Alice

texts.en:
Alice is a married woman with two children, both of whom attend school. She owns a house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

She operates a water selling business from home, selling to her neighbours and passersby. In addition, she operates a poultry business which contributes to her income.  Alice faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. She hopes to open another business in the future.

With the Kshs 40,000, she wants to purchase water pipes to pipe water for sale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to improve her business.

loans.use: To purchase water pipes

loans.name: Francisca

texts.en:
Francisca R. is from the village of Mapuroc San Mateo.  She is 42 years old.  Francisca is married and has 2 school-aged children.  To make a living, Francisca owns and operates a general store.  While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling a variety of different products in the local community.  Francisca has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Francisca joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Francisca is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell.  This loan will be the 1st loan taken out by Francisca from ASKI.  She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell.

loans.name: Vilma

texts.en:
Vilma A. is from the village of Liong, Guinsiliban, Camiguin Province. She is 40 years old. Vilma is married and has three school-aged children. To make a living, she owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop, selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap, canned goods, snack foods and toothpaste in the local community. Vilma has been engaged in her business for over four years and earns approximately $125 a month for these activities.

In 2009, Vilma joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. 

Vilma is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell like detergents and snack foods. This will be her 3rd loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell like detergents and snack foods

loans.name: Sonia Verónica

texts.es: Sonia: tiene 26 años es soltera vive con su hermana gemela, sus padres ya fayecieron ella lucha con su hermana para salir adelante, sonia cuenta con la venta de ropa, tipica como sueteres y cortes tipicos, y en temporadas venden frutas y verduras, en el mercado de su comunidad, el sueño de Sonia es mejorar su calidad de vida, por eso solicita este credito para aumentar su capital y su ganancia, y asi poder salr adelante con su familia.
texts.en: Sonia, aged 26, is single and lives with her twin sister. Their parents already passed away. Sonia, along with her sister, struggles to get ahead. She sells typical clothing, such as sweaters and other traditional dresses. In addition, during the season she sells fruits and vegetables at the market in her community. Sonia's dream is to improve her quality of life. Therefore she applied for this loan to increase her working capital and income, and thus progress with her family.

loans.use: To buy traditional clothing

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Additional working capital for a business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy gas accessories

loans.name: Olga Visitación

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “AMAUTA”; Este banco está ubicado en el distrito D. Urubamba, provincia D. Urubamba, departamento D. Cusco.

La socia es la Sra: Olga; La socia tiene 70 años D. edad; La socia es casada y tiene 2 hijos todos ellos son independientes;  La socia  es una mujer trabajadora y llena D. felicidad, la socia se dedica a administrar y trabajar en su farmacia; la socia tiene una farmacia y desea comprar medicamentos base, para lo cual la socia desea invertir el crédito, la socia trabaja con sus hijos y todo lo que ingresa es para reinvertirse en la compra D. medicamentos, La socia cuenta con proveedores a los cuales ella debe cancelar las cuantas que le dejan, La socia requiere el crédito para invertir en la compra D. medicamentos para abastecer su farmacia.

La socia se encuentra satisfecha con el préstamo otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con el pago D. sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Olga is a member of the "AMAUTA" community bank which is located in Urubamba district, in Urubamba province, in Cusco department.

Olga is 70 years old, married, and has 2 children who both live independently.  She is a hard-working woman who is full of happiness.  Olga owns a pharmacy which she manages and works in.  She would like to buy basic medicines with her loan money.  Olga works with her children and she re-invests all the money she makes into buying more medicines.  She has suppliers and she must pay the bills that they leave with her.

Olga requires this loan to invest in buying medicines to stock her pharmacy.  She is happy to be receiving the loan and pledges to make her repayments according to schedule.

loans.use: to invest in buying medicines to stock her pharmacy

loans.name: Wilmer

texts.es: Wilmer tiene 28 años de edad, es casado y no tiene hijos. Vive en la parte rural del distrito de Reque, una zona ubicada a veinte minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo. Desde hace más de 5 años, Wilmer se dedica a la crianza y engorde de ganado. Cuando los animales alcancen un buen nivel de desarrollo, los vende en el mercado local. Actualmente, cuenta con un torete y una vaca. Realiza esta actividad, con la apoya de su esposa, en una parte posterior de su casa. Además, para generar más ingresos, hace faenas agrícolas en chacras en su caserío. Desea invertir su crédito en la compra de dos toretes para engordar y vender. Por ello, ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un préstamo de 1000 nuevos soles. Wilmer es muy trabajador. Cuenta con buenas referencias personales y laborales de sus vecinos. Su esposa y él trabajan juntos para seguir adelante y lograr mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Wilmer is 28 years old, married, and has no children. He lives in the rural section of the District of Reque, which is twenty minutes away from the city of Chiclayo. Wilmer has been raising and fattening cattle for more than five years. When the animals have reached the proper level of development, he sells them at the local market. At the moment, he has one bull and one cow. Wilmer’s business is located in an area behind his house and he manages it with the help of his wife. To generate more income, he also works on other farms in his village.

Wilmer wants to invest in the purchase of two bulls to fatten and sell. For this reason, he is requesting a loan from Edpyme Alternativa in the amount of 1000 PEN.

Wilmer is a hard worker. He presents good personal and work-related references from his neighbors. Wilmer and his wife work together so that they can get ahead and create a better quality of life for their family.

loans.use: To purchase two bulls.

loans.name: Norma

texts.es: La señora Norma es comerciante de peluches al por mayor y menor  vende los días jueves y domingos en la ciudad de El Alto; su esposo trabaja en una tienda como vendedor; el crédito lo requiere para la  compra  de peluches y juguetes de plástico para aumentar su mercadería y atender a sus clientes. Con los ingresos que obtiene logra cubrir las necesidades de su familia. Vive en casa de sus padres ubicada en la zona 16 de Julio de la ciudad de El Alto; es casada y tiene  un hijo. Con los anteriores créditos ella aumentó su capital de trabajo y es cliente de IMPRO desde el año  2008.
texts.en:
Norma sells stuffed toys wholesale and retail.  She makes her sales on Thursdays and Sundays in the city of El Alto.  Her husband works in a store as a salesman.

Norma requires a loan to buy stuffed toys and plastic toys in order to increase her stock and serve her customers.  She uses the income that she makes to cover her family's needs.  Norma lives in her parents' home in 16 de Julio neighborhood, in the city of El Alto.  She is married and has one child.  She used her previous loans to increase her working capital and has been a client of IMPRO since 2008.

loans.use: to buy stuffed toys and plastic toys to sell on her stall in the 16 de Julio market in El Alto

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose B. lives in the Kamwokya Kifumbira neighborhood in the city of Kampala, Uganda. She is married and has six children, two of whom are in school. Rose lives in a home that she owns. She has access to electricity and has access to piped water.  Her major monthly expenses include school fees, food and paying utility bills.   

Rose has a business of a bar. She has been in this business for three years, and she works six days out of every week. Rose sells her products from home, by means of retail. She also generates additional income through rental rooms.

Rose has requested a loan of 1,000,000 UGX from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more jerrycans of local gin. 

The main business challenges for Rose include transportation and the rainy season. Her goals and aspirations for her business are to own a delivery van.

loans.use: To buy more jerrycans of local gin to resell.

loans.name: El Puente Group

texts.es:
el grupo El Puente esta ubicado en el barrio los Jazmines Trojes El Paraiso, esta integrado por tres personas que poseen negocios propios y que tienen mucha experiencia en la administración de los mismos, se conocen muy bien ya que todos viven cerca uno del otro, tomaron la decision de formar el grupo con el propósito de solicitar un credito para invertirlo en sus negocios, ya que por no contar con garantías suficientes no son sujetos de crédito en la banca nacional. el credito lo utilizaran para comprar mas mercaderia y asi satisfacer la demanda de sus clientes, esto les permitira mejorar sus ventas y así obtener mayores ganancias para mejorar las condiciones de vida de sus familias.
Dilcia tiene una pulperia, Iris vende leña y tortillas y Mario tiene una pulperia.
texts.en:
The group El Puente is located in the neighborhood Jazmines Trojes El Paraiso and is comprised of three people who own their own businesses and have a lot of experience in administration of them.  They know each other very well since they all live near one another. They decided to form the group in order to apply for a loan to invest in their businesses, because they do not have adequate guarantees and are not subject to national banking credit. The loan will be used to buy more merchandise to meet the demand of their customers.  This will enable them to improve their sales and thus have profits to improve the lives of their families.  

Dilcia has a grocery store, Iris sells firewood and tortillas and Mario has a grocery store.

loans.use: to purchase beans, rice, sugar, butter, oil, salt, meat, ice cream, firewood, corn, toilet paper, sanitary napkins, churros, soft drinks, and juices.

loans.name: Victoire

texts.fr: Née en 1971, Victoire est mariée à Joseph un boulanger. Le couple à quatre enfants, tous scolarisés et à charge. Victoire vit avec son mari et ses enfants. Victoire assure avec son mari les différentes charges de la maison. Depuis sept ans environs, Victoire vend des fruits de façon ambulante. Victoire s’approvisionne dans un marché du Sud du Bénin. Cette activité lui génère des revenus l’aidant à couvrir les diverses  charges de sa famille. Dans l’optique de rehausser davantage le niveau de son activité et d’accroître son profit, Victoire sollicite un quatrième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Les trois premiers crédits dont Victoire avait bénéficié ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en: Born in 1971, Victoire is married to Joseph, a baker. The spouses have four dependent children, all in school. Victoire lives with her husband and children. Victoire and her husband jointly provide for household needs.  For about seven years, Victoire has been selling fruits as a street vendor. She stocks up at a market in the south of Benin. This business activity brings her an income allowing her to cover various family needs. With the view of expanding her business further and increasing her revenues, Victoire is seeking a fourth loan from ALIDe. Her first three loans have been duly repaid.

loans.use: to buy fruits

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy goats for resale

loans.name: Luisa

texts.es: Luisa madre soltera, mujer luchadora, emprendedora, trabajadora, ha logrado salir adelante con su hijos ahora sus hijos trabajan por cuenta propia, le ayudan económicamente. Su mayor proyecto es mejorar la infraestructura de la vivienda. Su trabajo es humilde y honesto desde hace un tiempo trabaja. Con el préstamo comprara materiales de construcción como. Cemento, arena, piedras cantera, hierro, piedrines siendo utilizado en la mejora de un cuarto, obteniendo mejores condiciones de vida, seguridad y comodidad.
texts.en:
Luisa is a single mother as well as a determined, enterprising, and hardworking woman. She has been able to succeed on behalf of her children. Now her children work on their own and help her financially. Her greatest priority is to improve the infrastructure of her home. She has a modest and honest job in which she has worked for some time.

Luisa will use this loan to buy construction materials such as cement, sand, quarry stone, iron, and gravel for making improvements to a room. This will provide better living conditions, as well as make her home more secure and comfortable.

loans.use: to purchase materials for home improvements.

loans.name: Balel Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe Balel est composé de deux femmes monogames et deux veuves. Elles ont en moyenne 45 ans, 6 enfants  et habitent toutes le quartier Hamdallaye de Ségou (4ème Région administrative du Mali). Elles se sont connues à travers leurs activités génératrices de revenus au marché Château de Ségou. Les membres du groupe font le  commerce d’articles tels,  les céréales avec Baya qui est la première debout à gauche, en main le riz dans une tasse en plastique, les draps de lits,  les fruits (banane et mangue) et le bois de chauffe. 
Dans le besoin d’augmenter leurs fonds de commerce, les membres du groupe ont adhéré au programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso avec qui ils sont à leur 7ème prêt solidaire.
Baya est connue à Hamdallaye pour sa vente de céréales de bonne qualité au marché Château de Ségou. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter, 3 sacs de riz au grand marché de Ségou avec les forains de Niono. La revente se fait au comptant et à crédit à domicile et au marché Château de Ségou à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Baya espère réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 25 000FCFA qui sera utilisé pour être réinvesti dans l’activité et prendre en charge les petits nécessaires du foyer. Elle a pour ambition de devenir grossiste dans cette relation avec Soro Yiriwaso.
texts.en:
The Balel group is made up of two monogamous women and two widows. They average 45 years of age with six children each and all live in the Hamdallaye district of Ségou (Mali's fourth administrative region). They got to know each other through their income generating activities at the Château market in Ségou. The group members sell products such as cereals (this is the case for Baya who is standing on the far left of the photo with a plastic bowl of rice in her hand), bed sheets, fruits (bananas and mangos) and firewood.

As they need to increase their working capital, the group members have joined Soro Yiriwaso's loan program and are on their seventh solidarity loan.

Baya is renowned in Hamdallaye for the sale of her high quality cereals at the Château market in Ségou. She is planning to use her loan to buy three sacks of rice from the Niono fairpeople at Ségou's Grand Market. She resells the rice for cash and on credit from her home and at the Château market to a customer base made up of men and women.

With this loan Baya is hoping to make an average monthly profit of 25,000FCFA, which will be used to reinvest in her business and to provide for small household necessities. Her ambition is through this relationship with Soro Yiriwaso to become a wholesaler.

loans.use: to buy rice

loans.name: Juliana Lizbeth

texts.es:
La señora Juliana y su esposo el señor Ángel Carlos tiene tres hijos que actual mente están estudiando y desean que terminen una carrera profesional.
Solicitan un préstamo para poder pagar las inscripciones de la escuela y comprar de los útiles que son libros, cuadernos y también los uniformes.
Doña Juliana pagar el crédito con el sueldo que recibe de su trabajo como empleada de la compañía de gas, ya que el señor Ángel Carlos se encargara de los gastos familiares con el ingreso que recibe de su trabajo. 
Desean fortalecer y mejorar el porvenir de sus tres hijos y así tenga un futuro mejor.
texts.en:
Juliana and her husband, Angel Carlos, have 3 children who are currently in school and they want them to become professionals. They are asking for a loan to be able to pay school entrance fees and to buy supplies like books, notebooks and uniforms.

Juliana will pay the loan with her salary from her job at the gas company, since Angel Carlos covers the family's living costs with the income from his job.

They want to strengthen and improve the future of their three children.

loans.use: to pay school costs.

loans.name: Hawa

texts.en:
This is 56 year-old Hawa. She is married to a small trader, and has six children aged 7, 9, 12, 22, 26 and 32 years old. In 1981, Hawa established her clothing business. She began her business to help her husband support their family. Working six days a week and 10 hours a day, she earns about Le 1,100,000 every month from this business. She would like a loan in the amount of Le 4,000,000.  

Hawa has already received and successfully repaid two loans. She now requires a new loan in order to buy lace, wax cotton, local cotton and Bamakor cotton. She hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her monthly profits by approximately Le 200,000.  

Hawa travels to Freetown by public transport to purchase her supplies every week in the dry season and twice per month in the rainy season. Sales are sometimes slow in the rainy season. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To pay for supplies for her apparel-making business.

loans.name: Bakari

texts.en:
Bakari is a married man with nine children, eight of whom attend school while one is still too young for school.  He owns a house that has electricity but not piped water. His greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past five years, he has operated a barber shop business; his potential customers are neighbours and passersby. He faces a major challenge of seasonality in his business. He dreams of expanding his business and employing more people in the future.

With the Kshs 10,000 he wants to purchase a shaving machine and a mirror. He decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost his business.

loans.use: To purchase a shaving machine and a mirror.

loans.name: Khim

texts.en:
Mr. Khim is a 33-year-old flexible man who resides in the Reussey Keo commune of Phnom Penh City. He has two single children and both of them are still attending the local school, depending upon his daily income.

Mr. Khim is a tuk tuk (a motorcycle-based taxi) driver. He has run this service since 2008 and he makes a profit of around 10 USD each day to cover his family’s needs. Mr. Khim has a good manner and he is able to apply this good point to his clients and other people around him, so that is certainly why he increases his income from day-to-day. To generate more income, Mr. Khim’s wife is employed in the industry sector as a garment factory worker. Mr. Khim would like to ask for a loan from HKL and Kiva to repair his old house.     

In the future, Mr. Khim will use any increase in income to rebuild his old house and some percentage of it to support his school-going kids to finish a high level of education.

loans.use: to repair his old house

loans.name: Damaris

texts.en:
Damaris, age 29, operates a taxi in the Kitengela area. She has been in this business for the last three years and earns an income of KES 25,000 per month. She and her husband Martin are blessed with two children.

Damaris is applying for her first loan of KES 30,000 from KADET Ltd., and she intends to use the full amount to pay for necessary repairs to her taxi.  She will save the anticipated profits toward the purchase of another vehicle.

She hopes eventually to own a chain of taxis. She is disciplined and hardworking.

loans.use: to pay for necessary repairs to her taxi

loans.name: Juan Carlos

texts.es: Juan Carlos trabaja para la Alcaldia Muncipal de Juigalpa desde hace 2 años, desempeñandose como  colector. Esta solicitando  su 2do credito con el objetivo de mejorar su cuarto repellandolo y poniendole el piso y brindarle mayor comodidad a su familia. Cabe señalar que con el credito anterior logro reparar el techo del cuarto, y espera seguir contando con el apoyo de kiva para continuar mejorandolo.
texts.en: Juan Carlos has been working as a collector for the Juigalpa City Hall for 2 years. He is requesting his second loan to make improvements to his room by plastering it and by installing a floor, aiming to offer a better comfort to his family. It’s worth mentioning that with his previous loan he was able to repair the roof of his room, and he hopes to keep on counting on Kiva’s support to continue improving his room.

loans.use: To remodel his room.

loans.name: Florentina

texts.es:
La señora florentina cuenta con 38 años de edad y está casada con el señor bismar, con quien tiene 2 hijos, diana y Ricardo, de los cuales los dos estudian la mayor está cursando el segundo año de secundaria y el otro en cuarto año de primaria, se dedica a la venta de ropa, desde hacen 10 años.
Ella dice que decidió iniciar con este negocio, porque buscaba apoyar a su familia, para mejorar su calidad de vida y contar con una buena solvencia económica y así continuar ayudando a sus hijos con sus estudios, el crédito que recibió, lo va a invertir en la compra de mas ropa como son: pantalones, shorts, camisas, playeras, blusas, faldas, vestidos y ropa interior, para tener una amplia variedad de prendas.
El más grande sueño que tiene doña flor (como la conocen en su comunidad), es el de invertirle mucho mas al negocio, para hacerlo crecer rápidamente, ya que quiere construir un local y poner su tienda de ropa en su propia casa, puesto que así incrementara sus ingresos, y asegurar la educación profesional de sus hijos.
Dice que está profundamente agradecida con los donadores y fundación realidad, por este gran apoyo que les están brindando.
texts.en:
Florentina is 38 years old and married to Bismar.  The couple have two children, Diana and Ricardo, who are both in school.  Their daughter is in her second year of high school and their son is in his fourth year of elementary school.  Florentina sells clothes and has been in this business for 10 years.

Florentina says that she decided to start working in this business because she was looking to support her family, improve their quality of life and be in a good financial position.  She also wanted to continue helping her children with their education.  She invested the loan that she received in buying more clothes such as pants, shorts, shirts, t-shirts, blouses, skirts, dresses and underwear, so that she could have a wider range of garments available.

Flor (as she is known in her community) tells us that her biggest dream is to invest a lot more in her business so that she can make it grow quickly as she would like to build a sales location and set up a clothes store in her own home.  This would increase her income and guarantee her children's education.  She says that she is deeply grateful to Kiva lenders and Fundación Realidad for the great support that they are providing.

loans.use: to buy more clothes such as pants, shorts, shirts, t-shirts, blouses, skirts, dresses and underwear

loans.name: Ndzinza

texts.en:
Ndizinza is a widowed woman with three children who are all independent. She has a house with neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for herself. 

Ndizinza has operated a fruit and coconut stall for the past three years; her potential clients are the people who come to the market. She faces a major challenge of transporting her goods to the market. She dreams of expanding her business to supplying her products to the factory.

With the Kshs 40,000, she wants to purchase more fruit and coconuts for resale, and she wants to start a retail shop. She decided to join Yehu to boost her life economically.

loans.use: To purchase more fruit and coconuts for resale and to start a retail shop.

loans.name: Hoa

texts.en: Hoa is 28 years old. She is married and has two children. She is a teacher. She has been working at this job for three years. She has a monthly income of about 2.500.000 Vietnamdong (VND).  She wants to earn more money. So in addition to teaching she also breeds  pigs and poultry. Last time she borrowed 6.944.000 VND and repaid punctually. This time she would like to borrow 8.736.000 VND to buy food for her pigs.

loans.use: to buy food for her pigs.

loans.name: Patricio

texts.es:
El señor Patricio ya ha tenido dos créditos con KIVA los cuales a pagado puntual y han sido para mejorar su vivienda. 
A su casa le está haciendo falta el piso de concreto y el vitropiso, pero no cuenta con el dinero necesario para realizar la inversión. Es por eso que solicita un préstamo para comprar el materia que es (cemento, arena, vitropiso y el pegamento especial para pegar). 
Don patricio se encargara de realizar la mejora en horario adicional a su trabajo de la construcción, con una parte del sueldo que recibe planea pagar el crédito, es la fuente de ingreso que tiene ya que su esposa la señora Eleuteria se encarga de atender y cuidar a su hijo. 
Desea proteger a su familia de enfermedades y que tenga un lugar seguro y como para ellos.
texts.en:
Señor Patricio has already had 2 loans with Kiva which he has repaid puntually and were for home improvements. His house needs a concrete floor and glazed floor tiles but he doesn't have the money necessary to make the improvements. This is why he is asking for a loan to buy building materials such as cement, sand, glazed floor tiles and special glue. 

Don Patricio is responsible for making the improvements in addition to his work in construction. With part of his salary he plans on paying off the loan. This salary is his sole source of income as his wife Señora Eleuteria is in charge of taking care of their child.
 
He wants to protect his family from illness and ensure that they have a secure and comfortable place of thier own.

loans.use: to put a concrete floor and glazed floor tiles in place in his house.

loans.name: Timothe

texts.fr:
Client de 50 ans, marie et père de 2 enfants dont l'age varie entre 21 et 23 ans.Après ses etudes universitaires , n'ayant pas trouve du travail, il se lance dans la vente des ustensiles en plastique tel que des séries de cuvettes, des seaux, des chaises, des bassines et des gobelets...
Il a des recettes de 50.000frs a 100.000frs par jour, par moment il va a Kinshasa pour aller s'approvisionner .

A l'octroi de ce nouveau prêt, il va renforcer son commerce et agrandir le stock de ses marchandises.Ces differents prêts  ont agrandi son capital, aujourd'hui il n'achète plus a crédit, les achats se font en gros , il a fait des épargnes considérables et a rembourser sans difficulté.

Son ambition est de d'élargir son dépôt et d'ouvrir un autre coin de vente pour satisfaire les désirs de ses clients.Il est le pilier de sa famille , soutien les etudes universitaires de ses enfants et il est très populaire dans son quartier.
texts.en:
The 50-year-old client is married and the father of two children who are 21 and 23 years old. After his university studies, when he couldn't find work, he went into business selling plastic kitchenware, such as washbowls, buckets, chairs, bowls and cups. His income is between 50,000 and 100,000 frs per day and at times he goes to Kinshasa to stock up. 

With this new loan, he is going to expand his business and increase his stock of merchandise. These various loans have increased his capital and today he no longer buys on credit; he purchases wholesale. He has made considerable savings and paid back his loans without any problems.

His dream is to expand his store and to open another storefront to satisfy his customers' needs. He is the pillar of his family, supporting his children's university studies, and he is very popular in his neighborhood.

loans.use: To buy bowls, baskets, tables, basins, etc.

loans.name: Akua

texts.en: Akua  sells second-hand clothes and slippers at Besease near Elmina. She has been selling second-hand clothes for nine years. Ekua is married to a tailor and has four  dependents. She uses her income to assist her husband to provide for their family. She will use her loan to purchase more clothes and slippers for sale. With the new profit Ekua plans to get a shop for the sale of her clothes.

loans.use: purchase more clothes and slippers for sale.

loans.name: Flerida Lucia

texts.es:
EL Banco Comunal Camino Al Progreso se reúne cada quince días en la ciudad de Montecristi, conocido por su rica cultura pre colonial y por su artesanía que es reconocida a nivel nacional e internacional. Lugar de los famosos sombreros de paja toquilla.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Flerida, tiene 36 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen dos hijos de 8 y 5 años de edad que estudian en escuela. Su esposo es militar. 

Ella se dedica a la venta de ropa de todo tipo, su forma de  venta es puerta a puerta aunque la mayor parte de sus ventas las realiza  en su  casa donde tiene un pequeño local con unas vitrinas, la mayor parte de sus ventas las realiza a base de pedidos. Ella sale a recorrer cuatro días a la semana más que todo en las mañanas y en su casa vende todos los días, deja a crédito a sus clientes  y cobra cada quince días. Su mercadería  la va a comprar a  Guayaquil y también viaja hasta Ipiales (Colombia) y Huaquillas (Perú) cuando necesita mercadería, lleva en su negocio ya por 15 años y que le va muy bien.

Este crédito lo va emplear en comprar más mercadería como: pantalones, blusas, camisetas y ropa de niños. Está en el Banco Comunal 13 años   y le gusta porque los créditos le son de gran ayuda.
 
Su sueño es tener un almacén o una boutique.
texts.en:
The “Camino al Progreso” (Road to Progress) communal bank meets every two weeks in the city of Montecristi.  The city is known for its rich pre-colonial culture and for its handicrafts.  It is recognized on a national and international level, and it is the home of the famous Panama hat. 

This is where we meet Flerida, age 36.  She is married, and she and her husband have two children.  The children are eight and five years old, and they go to school.  Her husband is in the military.

She sells all types of clothes.  She sells door to door even though most of her sales are made in her house.  She has a small place with some display cases.  Most of her sales are made through orders.  She goes out to sell four days of the week, mostly in the mornings.  She sells from her house every day.  

She gives her customers credit, and she collects every two weeks.  She goes to Guayaquil to buy her merchandise.  She also travels to Ipiales (Colombia) and Huaquillas (Peru) when she needs merchandise.  She has been in this business for 15 years, and it is going very well for her.

She will use this loan to buy more merchandise like pants, blouses, t-shirts, and children’s clothing.  She has been in the communal bank for 13 years.  She likes it because the loans are a big help to her.

Her dream is to have a store or a boutique.

loans.use: to buy pants, blouses, t-shirts, and children’s clothing.

loans.name: Andre

texts.en:
Andrea has been  an Esperanza Internacional borrower for 10 years.  She came to us because she  needed capital for her business. She started her business after she was working in a beauty salon, and she decided to have her own. Andrea is a single mother with 3 children. Andrea  took out her first loan to expanded her business because it was pretty small, and the clients were uncomfortable.

Andrea wishes to have a successful business. She enjoys her business. In her beauty salon she also sells, cosmetics, hair and beauty products and  sometimes she also sells clothing or shoes. This loan will be used especially to buy  beauty and hair products, because her clients also buy their hair products from her. Andrea thanks all of you for your support!

loans.use: to buy beauty and hair products

loans.name: Luthgarda

texts.en:
Luthgarda is married with four children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. She is 51 years old, and has one child who is in school.

Luthgarda has a restaurant business in the Philippines, and has requested a PHP 13000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional ingredients for her restaurant business.  Luthgarda has been in this business for four years. In the future, she would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase additional ingredients for her restaurant business.

loans.name: Fe

texts.en:
Fe is 45 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 3 children. Fe has a food shop or sari-sari (variety) store that sells canned goods, snacks & beverages. She has had this business for 10 years. 

She requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages. She has been a member of HSPFI since 2004. In the future, Fe hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages

loans.name: Hannan

texts.en:
Hannan is a 23-year-old woman who never finished high school but is determined to create a better future. She learned to raise animals and has now opened a business raising sheep. She buys baby ewes, raises healthy sheep and resells them at a good profit. 

She took this loan to purchase additional sheep and ewes.

Hannan wants to see her business activity expand and eventually begin selling meat.

loans.use: To purchase additional sheep and ewes

loans.name: Yudi Diam Keur Demba Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de crédit Yudi Diam, représenté par la dame Awa qui se trouve sur la photo au milieu en écharpe bleu ; rassemble cinq femmes qui évoluent dans le même secteur d’activité. Madame Awa est mariée et mère de famille, elle s’active dans l’agriculture depuis plusieurs années et travaille la matinée pour se reposer l’après midi.  Avec les produits de son activité, elle réussi à gérer la dépense quotidienne de la maison.
Elle désire accompagner ses enfants jusqu’à ce qu’ils aient leur propre activité.

loans.use: acheter des semences et de l'engrais pour préparer lhivernage

loans.name: Ebenecer Group

texts.es: El grupo está formado por tres socias emprendedoras una de ellas es Justa mujer de 49 años de edad, casada, su negocio es la venta de ropa usada desde hace 10 años, sus productos los comercializa ambulante y en su comunidad. El crédito lo requiere para comprar pacas de ropa usada. Delia mujer de 33 años de edad su negocio es la venta de lácteos y Julia mujer de 46 años de edad y su negocio es una pulpería ubicada en su domicilio.
texts.en:
This group is made up of three entrepreneurial partners, on of whom is Justa. She is a 49 year old, marries woman, and her business is selling used clothes for the past 10 years. She markets her products by traveling, and in her community. She needs the loan to buy bales of used clothing. 

Delia, a 33 year old women, sells dairy products for her business, and Julia, a 46 year old woman, has a grocery store located in her home.

loans.use: to buy bales of used clothing wholesale.

loans.name: Esam

texts.en:
Esam is 38 years old; he lives in Gaza with his wife and his four children . He sells various kinds of foodstuffs such as cookies, candies, soft drinks, juices, macaroni, and many other items in his grocery store. He opened it 2 years ago.
 Esam is applied for this loan to purchase a stock to sell (candies, soft drinks, juices, macaroni, and many other items). This will allow him to be able to increase his stock. And led to increase the number of the client, and increase his income, which will help him to improve the financial conditions for his family.  
His dream is to expanding his business, Esamis very grateful to everyone who helps him to achieve success in his business with this loan.

loans.use: to purchase a stock to sell (candies, soft drinks, juices, macaroni, and many other items). This will allow him to be able to increase his stock. And led to increase the number of the client, and increase his income.

loans.name: Lydie

texts.fr: Lydie âgée de 49 ans a arrêté l’école au niveau secondaire est veuf et est père de trois enfants, tous scolarisés et un à sa charge. Lydie vit avec ses enfants. Les diverses charges de la famille sont supporté par la bénéficiaire. Pour cette raison, Lydie vend depuis quatorze ans des chaussures par la technique de distribution.Parallèlement à son activité, Lydie vend également des vivres. Cette activité lui génère des revenus l'aidant à subvenir à ses besoins et à ceux de ses enfants. Lydie achète ses produits dans un marché du Bénin. Dans le but de renforcer son activité et de mieux satisfaire sa clientèle, Lydie pour une quatrième fois sollicite, un crédit auprès de ALIDé. Les prêts antérieurs ont été bien remboursés.

loans.use: Acheter des chaussures et des vivres.

loans.name: Shaka Group

texts.fr:
Jean   fait partie du groupe  Shaka  et  habite à  Gitega. Il a 53 ans et est marie à Euphrasie, une cultivatrice. 

Il fait  de planche  depuis 15 ans. 

Il  est s à son cinquième  crédit  à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’il obtient, il va  augmenter son capital et acheter beaucoup de  planches  à revendre pour gagner plus.
texts.en: Jean is part of the Shaka group and lives in Gitega. He is 53 years old and married to Euphrasie, a farmer. He has been making boards for 15 years. He is on his fifth Turame loan. With the Kiva loan he will receive, he will increase his capital and buy a lot of boards to resell and earn more.

loans.use: to increase his capital and buy many boards to resell and earn more.

loans.name: Hudoyor

texts.ru:
Худоер молодой мужчина 41 года. Он женат и имеет 6 детей. Живет Худоер со своей семьей в сельской местности. У него собственный частный дом.
Худоер торгует на рынке медом. Он покупает мед оптом и продает в розницу. Для этого арендует магазин. У него мед хорошего качества и поэтому хорошая торговля. От данного дела Худоер получает хороший доход.
В данный момент Худоер хочет расширить свой бизнес, для этого ему понадобились деньги. Поэтому он обратился в Арванд за кредитом.  
Он заранее благодарит Арванд за поддержку и надеется на положительный результат.

loans.use: for business expansion

loans.name: Florence

texts.en: Mrs. Florence I. is 40 years old woman who learnt her trade business for the past 10 years. She is happily married with three (3) children. She needs the above amount for her business expansion.

loans.use: To buy more food items for sale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: She would like to purchase a hybrid dairy cow

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To Purchase a Cow and Expand her Farming Business

loans.name: Yelena

texts.en: Yelena sells attractive leather purses from a little space at the busy Rushski Market in Melitopol, Ukraine. A good location in the market helps boost her sales and has contributed to the success of her business. Financial assistance from Nadiya Ukraine has also been instrumental in helping her through the years she has been in business. She has been a great client, repaying each loan she has received with no delays. Yelena enjoys selling purses and with two daughters, the business is a neat fit for her family, as well. Yelena has requested a loan of $450 to help her purchase additional inventory for her business.

loans.use: Increase inventory

loans.name: Sin

texts.en: Mrs. Sin S. is a 50 year old, married mother of three children. The children are all in school, and they live in Phnom Penh, Cambodia. She works as a teacher, earning around $2.50/day in revenue. Her husband (he is pictured) is a motor-taxi driver and generally earns around $1.50 a day. He would like to sell ice-cream in his community, which would enable him to make more money than driving a motor-taxi, but he faces a financial problem. To do so, he has applied for a loan amount of $500 to purchase a cart to attach to his motorcycle to operate a business.

loans.use: To purchase a cart to attach to a motorcycle, to sell ice cream in their community.

loans.name: Eunice

texts.en: Eunice is a 34-year old mother of six school going children. She lives with her family in Rongo town, Kenya.  She is a beneficiary of two previous microfinance loans from KMET.  She was initially employed as a dress maker until 2006 when she initiated her own business. She started this  by hiring a sewing machine at US $45 a month. Through hard work, she managed to purchase her own machine in August 2006 and now has four. She specializes in making women dresses and school uniforms. The central location of her shop in a busy town coupled with many years of doing good business within the community, has gained her a good reputation and a wide customer base.  With access to KMET loans she’s able to expand her business to include training site (dressmaking) for school dropouts within the community. She intends to acquire an additional stock of dressmaking materials with a portion of the US $800 loan she has applied for.

loans.use: Buy dressmaking materials

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
This is a typical ‘genge’, a stall selling fruit and vegetables, eggs and other miscellaneous food, and random non-food items (see if you can spot the toilet paper Where’s Wally style!). This is Mama Agleni’s genge and she requires a loan of $275 to purchase additional stock. At just 37, Mama Agleni is a widow and relies on the profits from her business to support her 9 year-old daughter Agleni and her 11 year-old nephew, Sallumu.

About SELFINA
SELFINA is engaged in economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through a leasing and leaseback arrangement as a practical way to achieve economic and social emancipation.

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro Leasing. Customs and traditions in Tanzania normally make it difficult for women to own land and assets, and they are therefore termed not-creditworthy by financial institutions as they lack tangible collateral assets. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes.

SELFINA buys and leases equipment to women. Where a client needs working capital, SELFINA buys equipment from the said client, extending a loan to her, and then leases back the same equipment – a process called "sale and leaseback".

loans.use: To purchase additional stock for her food stall

loans.name: Ni Made

texts.id:
Living in the village, far from the nearest market, Ni Made W. realized that there was a business opportunity. She decided to open up a food kiosk after realizing that there are only a few food vendors in her village and the villagers need to travel far to the market to buy groceries. With $550 loan from Dinari, Ni Made W. planned to improve and renovate her kiosk. She wanted to fix damaged part of her kiosk, like flooring and wall. Besides that, she planned to buy glass shelves and cabinet to display her merchandise to look more attractive. With all these improvements, Ni Made W. is confident that she can increase her income by attracting more customers.

Translated from Indonesian by Kresna Hartandi, Kiva Volunteer

Tinggal di pedesaan dan jauh dari pasar, membuat Ni Made W. melihat hal itu sebagai sebuah peluang usaha. Salah satu faktor yang membuatnya untuk memutuskan untuk menekuni usaha warung, karena di desanya masih sedikit ada warung dan masyarakat harus jauh pergi ke pasar untuk membeli kebutuhan sehari-hari, seperti beras, minyak, bumbu dapur dan lain – lain. Dengan pinjaman dana sebesar Rp. 5.000.000.- dari yayasan Dinari, Ni Made W. berencana untuk menambah fasilitas warungnya dan yang terpenting adalah memperbaharui kondisi warungnya. Ni Made W. berencana untuk memperbaiki bagian – bagian yang sudah rusak seperti dinding dan lantainya. Selain itu, pinjaman tersebut akan digunakan untuk membeli rak kaca untuk etalase memajang dagangannya sehingga kelihatan lebih menarik. Dengan semua perubahan itu, Ni Made W. yakin pendapatannya akan meningkat, karena pelanggan akan merasa nyaman di warungnya.

loans.use: Fix Kiosk and buy Display Shelves and cabinets

loans.name: Zara

texts.es:
From the time Zara was very young, she has dedicated herself to work. She did not allow her lack of a profession and her humble economic situation to become obstacles. Her four years of studies in cosmetology have opened doors for her which she'd never imagined. The quality of the work she offers has turned her into a well respected and well known professional in her area. She offers haircuts, styling, tints, etc. Her clients like that she offers a service in their homes, and she is also asked by a friend of hers, who owns a salon, to work occasionally as a stylist there as well. Zara is happy with what she has achieved and this fills her with satisfaction. But she continues to work hard because she hopes to one day have her own salon in the city center, as well as other branches throughout the country. This great vision that she has is motivated by her love for her 3 children. Zara wants to improve the infrastructure of their house as well as invest in more supplies for her business. You can help this hardworking woman achieve her goals.

Zara, desde muy joven a trabajado dedicándose al comercio, luego que se unió a su esposo la responsabilidad de trabajar fue mayor y siempre sus ansias de prepararse para la vida aunque no puede acceder a una profesión por su humilde situación económica no fueron obstáculos para encontrar su vocación a la que hoy se dedica; después de estudiar en un centro de educación ocupacional hace 4 años la carrera técnica de cosmetología ha abierto puertas que jamás imaginó, la calidad del trabajo que ofrece la ha convertido en una cosmetóloga bien dedicada y de prestigio en su zona, por el momento ofrece sus servicios de cortes de cabello, peinados, tintes, etc. al gusto de su clientela y lo mejor es que lo solicitan en su hogar, ahora ofrece un servicio a domicilio y ocasionalmente una de sus amigas dueña de un centro de belleza la llama para que ella sea una de sus estilistas. Zara está contenta de ejercer lo que le agrada y eso la llena de satisfacción más no de conformismo porque desea a futuro tener su propio centro de belleza en el centro de la ciudad para incrementar con el tiempo sucursales en todo su país. Esa gran visión que posee es motivada por el amor ilimitado que siente por sus tres hijos. Para seguir brindando comodidades a sus hijos desea mejorar la infraestructura de su casa y comprar algunos insumos de cosmetología. Colabora con Zara, una mujer con muchos deseos de disfrutar la vida al lado de los suyos.

loans.use: TO MAKE IMPROVEMENTS ON HER SMALL HOME AND PURCHASE ADDITIONAL SUPPLIES FOR HER COSMETOLOGY BUSINESS.

loans.name: Yesenia

texts.es:
At twenty-nine years old, Yesenia is a hard working woman, with an enterprising character. She has been running her new business for two months. Before that, she had a shop which she managed for a year and a half. However, her sisters-in-law suggested that she started making pillows. Which is why, with two other people, Yesenia decided to leave her shop and start up this new project. Yesenia has a lot of expectations. She works night and day in order to expand her business as quickly as possible. For the time being, anything she earns she invests back into the business. Luckily, her husband takes care of the house and her two young childrem, aged eight and two. For the future, she hopes to update the machines which she has (which are second hand) and extend her business to produce clothing.

Translated from Spanish by Lucy Williams, Kiva volunteer

A sus veintinueve años Yesenia es una mujer muy trabajadora y que tiene un espíritu emprendedor. Hace dos meses que maneja su nuevo negocio. Anteriormente, tenia una tienda que la mantuvo durante año y medio. Sin embargo, sus cuñadas le propusieron empezar con la confección de almohadas. Es así que con dos personas más Yesenia se animó dejar su tienda y empezar en este nuevo proyecto. Yesenia esta con muchas expectativas. Y trabaja día y noche para hacer crecer sin demora este negocio. Por ahora, lo que gana lo vuelve a invertir, felizmente su esposo se encarga del mantenimiento del hogar y de sus dos pequeños hijos de ocho y dos años. Lo que ella espera en un futuro es renovar las maquinarias que tiene (ya que son de segunda mano) y extender el rubro de producción a ropa de vestir.

loans.use: Update her sewing machines

loans.name: La Antorcha Futura Group

texts.en:
Illuminada lives in Samana, a city on the east coast of the Dominican Republic. She has three children, ages 22, 20 and 18, and runs a small cafeteria from her home, where she sells fruit, bread, cheese, sugar and other daily essentials to her community. In her free time she enjoys talking with her neighbors and sharing stories about their families, businesses and lives. Her favorite foods are rice, beans and meat. Her dream for the future is to watch her business continue to grow bigger and bigger, and to be a successful business owner in her town.

This is the first loan that the women of La Antorcha Futura (The Future Torch) have applied for, and they are excited to see how it will transform their lives and the lives of other women in the community. On behalf of Esperanza, thank you for your support. We are looking forward to watching these women improve their lives!

loans.use: To buy more essentials such as beans, lentils and vegetables for her cafeteria

loans.name: Reourn

texts.en:
Mrs. Reourn S. is 48 and is a subsistence farmer. She has asked for a loan to buy more timbers to build a house in order to improve her living conditions. She lives in Kos Prak Village in Kandal Province. She is the mother of five children, four of whom are working in a garment factory while the youngest one is attending state school. Her husband, Sophal Ven, is also a farmer and he always helps his wife in the fields.

Last year, Mrs. Reourn S.’s children got a cold and they had to buy medicines to cure them causing a financial crisis for the family.

Mrs. Reourn S. has never obtained a loan before but now, in order to build a new house, she has asked for a loan. In the picture you can see Mrs. Reourn S. with her husband and, in the background, the pillars of their new house.

loans.use: Buy more timbers to build a new house

loans.name: Kon

texts.en:
Mrs. Kon N. is a Khmer cake seller in Anlong Tnot Village in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. Mrs. Kon N. is 47 and the mother of four children, one of whom is employed in a garment factory while the three others attend school. Her husband, Mr. Khon Pros, is unemployed and assists his wife in making Khmer cakes.

As her business has improved in the past months, Mrs. Kon N. wants to expand her business. Therefore, she is requesting a loan to buy more raw materials with which to make more Khmer cakes to sell.

loans.use: To buy more raw materials to make Khmer cakes for sale

loans.name: Sayed Ghulam

texts.en:
Sayed Ghulam S. grew up in refuge in neighboring Pakistan during the Afghan civil wars. His father is an old and weak man, so Ghulam S. as a boy was virtually the only breadwinner and had to work hard to support his 8-member family. The family had rented a small store for Ghulam, which he tended to full-time, 7 days a week. The business went well and Ghulam was soon able to purchase that store.

After the fall of the Taliban, Ghulam and his family decided to return to their homeland, Afghanistan. They are residents of the eastern Ningarhar province. Ghulam is pursuing the same business of retail in Afghanistan, but the business is not going well because the inventory is too small for his clientele.

Ghulam S. hopes to expand his business and therefore his profitability by increasing his store inventory. Increase of inventory will also make the business interesting as he is bored and almost fed up with the size of the business he has right now. Sayed Ghulam S. has applied for a 50,000 Afghanis loan to achieve this goal. Ghulam hopes that by increasing his business, he will be able to support his family, send his siblings to school, and watch them become doctors and engineers.

loans.use: To buy enough things for his shop

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase of hangbags for sale

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es:
Rosa is 55 years old, mother to 4 grown children, lives with her husband Santos, who supports her in everything. For 2 years she has worked growing flowers and ornamental indoor and outdoor plants and selling chicken. Her plants are purchased by different government institutions and she sells her chicken to various chicken processors. She does this work over various hours of the day. What she likes about her work is socializing with others and being able to keep the support of the institutions. What is difficult is not having adequate land for her plants, which she grows inside of her home. Rosa asks for this loan because she wants to increase the quantity of seeks, of different varieties of plants and flowers. In the future she would like to become an exporter.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

Rosa, de 55 años de edad, es madre de cuatro hijos, quienes son ya independientes, vive con su esposo Santos, quien la apoya en todo. Desde hace 2 años se dedica al cultivo de flores y plantas ornamentales para interiores y exteriores, y la venta de carne de pollo. Sus plantas son compradas por diferentes instituciones del gobierno y la carne de pollo las vende a diversas pollerías, esta labor le toma solo algunas horas del día. Lo que le gusta de su trabajo es que se socializa y poder conservar el apoyo de las instituciones. Lo difícil es no contar con un terreno adecuado para sus plantas, lo hace en el interior de su vivienda. Rosa solicita este préstamo porque quiere incrementar la cantidad de semillas, de distintas variedades de plantas y flores, posteriormente le gustaría ser exportadora.

loans.use: Buy seeds for different types of plants and flowers

loans.name: Jesus

texts.es: Jesús tiene 49 años, trabaja en un aserradero, se siente muy contento con su trabajo, puesto que con esto solventa los gastos de estudios de sus 4 hijos, que espera en el futuro sean hombre de bien, su esposa Lizbeth lo apoya mucho en lo que se propone, y juntos llevan adelante a su familia.Jesús se asoció con un grupo de amigos, he hicieron un aserradero propio, en el cual, distintos madereros requieren de sus servicios para hacer trabajar la madera que traen, por ello, tiene la necesidad de comprar herramientas para implementar su aserradero.Adicionalmente a esto, quiere dedicarse a la venta de combustible, por  la razón de  que sus clientes (madereros) requieren de dicho elemento. Para cumplir con su objetivo es que Jesús solicita el presente este préstamo.
texts.en:
Jesús is 49 years old and works in a sawmill. He feels very pleased with his work, since with this he settles the expenses of the studies of their 4 sons, who he hopes in the future to be successful men. His wife, Lizbeth, supports him a lot in what he does, and together they move their family forward. Jesús is associated with a group of friends who have built their own sawmill where certain timber merchants require their services to work the wood that they bring. Because of this, he has the need to buy tools for fitting their sawmill. In addition to this, he wants to sell fuel, because their lumber clients require said element. To comply with his objective, Jesús now requests this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Barbara (B) Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy tools to fit his sawmill.

loans.name: Sorn

texts.en: Mr. Sorn C. is a villager in Knach Krasang village in Kampong Cham Province. His wife, Mrs. Kim Sreymom, is a housewife who takes care of the house and their child. She is on the left of the photo. Mr. Sorn C. owns a small piece of land to cultivate rice. He faces a challenge in his field. Thus, he has decided to ask for a loan to purchase fertilizer and hire laborers to enable his field to yield a more productive crop. He is 24 years old and the father of a one-year-old child, too young to work or study.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer and hire laborers to enrich his field and make the crop more productive.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary O. is 50 years old and married with 7 children. She and her family live in Benin City. She sells second hand clothes and shoes to those who cannot afford to buy new ones. She is a LAPO client. She barely satisfies her customers’ demands because she has little money to finance her business. She hopes for the loan amount of N140,000 to purchase more second hand clothes and shoes to sell. She says "thank you" to all that made this loan possible.

loans.use: To purchase more second hand clothes and shoes to sell

loans.name: Bikobila

texts.en:
I. Bikobila was born in 1968 in Khujand. She is divorced with 3 children. She does not have higher education but she has good skills in business, and she has been engaged in business for 14 years. She started business selling small wares but today she has a trade outlet for selling food products (meat products, such as sausages and salami; sour milk products, such as curd and kefir; flour, vegetable oil, juices and sweets). She brings the parcels from Uzbekistan, Russia and the Kyrgyz Republic.

Mrs. I. Bikobila applies to KIVA with the request of a loan of 1500 STJ for 6 months to open a perfumery. She thanks KIVA for its support.

loans.use: Open a perfumery

loans.name: Clementina

texts.en:
Clementina is a member of the Nueva Vida (“New Life”) Village Bank. Clementina is 38 years old. She is married and has three children. Clementina bakes traditional Peruvian breads in her father-in-law’s oven, with the help of three employees. She distributes the bread wholesale to local stores. Clementina needs a loan of 1000 soles to buy flour.  Clementina dreams that her children will finish school and of opening another business.  
Translated from Spanish by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva Fellow
Clementina es socia del Banco Comunal Nueva Vida. 
Clementina es casada, tiene 38 años y 3 hijos, Clementina se dedica a la elaboración de panes típicos, actividad que realiza en el horno de sus suegro con la ayuda de 3 personas, los panes los reparte por mayor a las tiendas. 
Clementina necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de harina. 
Los sueños de Clementina son que sus hijos culminen sus estudios y tener otro negocio.

loans.use: Buy flour

loans.name: Maryam

texts.en:
Maryam is a food seller in the Melinne neighborhood of Zanzibar for six years. She currently earns an average monthly profit of $60, working every day at her business for six hours.

Maryam is requesting her second loan from BRAC Tanzania so that she can buy more food materials for her business. She hopes to increase her profits and expand her business.

Maryam is 22 years old, married, and has one child who is six years old.

loans.use: To buy more ingredients for her food business.

loans.name: Tembiapora Group

texts.es:
Este Comité se formo de  la desintegracion de dos comites en la cual era integrantes la señora Rosa Maria B. y Teodora G.. .
El presente comité se encuentra, en su octavo ciclo. Podemos hablar de la Sra.Teodora G. 40 años , tiene 5 hijo que se queda con la hermana mayor en la casa mintras ella se  va a vender sus comidas por la calurosa zona de Viñas Cue alrededor de su barrio.Por la tarde tiene ventas de dulces que sale en compañía de su hijo menor llamado Carlos con venta de tortas caseras hecha por Doña Teodora.
Ella es una señora muy sufrida que tiene un dia a dia muy pesado  por que viene al abasto a hacer sus compras a las cuatro de la madrugada con su hijo de doce años y al llegar a su casa prepara sus empanadas , tortillas , croquetas para el desayuno de unos albañiles a quienes le prepara para sus desayunos.  
Tiene una casita  pequeña hecha de materiales precarias como pedazos de maderas y chapas.De esta manera ella ayuda a su pareja con los gastos de la casa y de sus hijos.
En una de sus entrevistas y reuniones semanales, ella nos cuenta que ,”Agradezco a la Fundacion Paraguaya por ayudarme a mi y a mi familia a progresar y  tambien a mi comunidad”termina diciendo.


Nombre y Apellido	Actividad
Rosa Maria B. 	Costurera
Pabla Lucila P. 	Vta de Frutas y verduras
Teodora G.	Venta de Comestible
Dionisia Cano B.  	Vta de ropas usadas
Beatriz Britez C. 	Vta de detergentes y otros

Irma Modesta P..	Venta de Crochet 
 Aquilina F. 	Vta de remedios yuyos
Cinthia S. 	Venta de lenceria
Jorgelina G. 	Venta de comidas
Andrea Lorena B..
	Peluquera
Rosa V.	Vta de scarpin
Elida C.	Vta de comestibles
Mirian M.	Vta de articulos de ferreteria
Guillermina M.   	Vta de manualidades
Georgina F.  	Vta de cosmeticos 
Verena Leticia B.  	Vta de frutas
Silvia Aranda R. 	 Vta de cosmeticos
Silvia Teodora M.  	Vta de articulos de limpieza
texts.en:
This group is made of members from two previous groups no longer active which were headed by Rosa Maria B. and Teodora G.. . The current group is in its eighth loan cycle. We can tell you about Teodora G.: 40 years old with five children who lives with her older sister from which she goes to sell her food in the hot area of Viñas Cue, near her neighbourhood. In the afternoons she sells sweets with her young son Carlos, such as home-made pies made by Teodora. She is a long-suffering woman who has a hard life: at 4:00 A.M. she goes to the wholesale food market to make her purchases with her 12-year-old son and returns home to prepare empanadas [meat patties], tortillas, croquettes for breakfast for some construction workers whom she prepares breakfast for. She has a small little house made of unstable materials such as bits of wood and plywood. In this way she helps her partner with the household expenses and the expenses for her children. In one of her interviews and at weekly meetings she has told us: "I am grateful to Fundacion Paraguaya for their help for myself and my family as well as my community". Name and Activity Rosa Maria B. - dressmaker Pabla Lucila P. - sells fruits and vegetables Teodora G. - sells food Dionisia Cano B. - sells used clothing Beatriz Britez C. - sells cleaning products etc. Irma Modesta P.. - sells crochet Aquilina F. - sells herbal remedies Cinthia S. - sells lingerie Jorgelina G. - sells food Andrea Lorena B.. - hairstylist Rosa V. - sells socks Elida C. - sells foodstuffs Mirian M. - sells hardware Guillermina M. - sells handicrafts Georgina F. - sells cosmetics Verena Leticia B. - sells fruit Silvia Aranda R. - sells cosmetics Silvia Teodora M. - sells cleaning products

Translated from Spanish by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Seamstress made-to-measure clothing and sheets to retail. Cleaning products such as detergents, shampoo, cream rinse.

loans.name: Harold Enrique

texts.es: El Señor Harold Enrique Z. Berríos tiene la edad de 39 años, su estado civil es casado. La actividad económica de Don Harold es el servicio de taxi. Hace más de 14 años que se dedica a este negocio. El comenzó este negocio a la edad de 20 años ya que su Padre le enseño a manejar y mas tarde logro comprar un automóvil  y dedicarse a este negocio. Los propósitos de Don Harold  es salir adelante con su negocio. El financiamiento es para capital de trabajo ya que lo solicita para la compra de repuestos para su taxi. Sus deseos son de conseguir otro taxi y así proporcionarle a su familia esta fuente de ingresos. La cantidad que solicita es de C$15.000 córdobas.
texts.en:
Harold Enrique Z. Berríos is 39 years old and married. He's worked as a taxi driver for more than 14 years. His father taught him to drive, and he was eventually able to buy a car and begin working. Don Harold's goal is to have his business grow. The loan is for business capital, which he is requesting in order to buy parts for his taxi. He would like to acquire another taxi and be able to offer his family that source of income. He is requesting a sum of C$15.000 córdobas.

Translated from Spanish by Andrea Rosenberg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Business capital

loans.name: Nyamjav

texts.en:
Nyamjav M. is 54, married and the father of four. One child is a university student and the others are attending elementary school. His family lives in a "ger" (a nomadic Mongolian tent) district in Arhangay, one of Mongolia's central provinces.

Nyamjav is a professional carpenter and runs his own carpentry business. In 1990 he started making furniture and "ger" components such as roof poles and latticed walls. When he began his business 19 years ago, his working capital was very small at around 3,000 tugrugs. ($1.00 USD=250 MNT in 1990) Now it has increased to 400,000 MNT.

From his profit, Nyamjav has bought two pick-up trucks. To expand his business, he is planning to build a woodshop on the plot of land he owns. Nyamjav is a humble and hard-working person. He dreams that his children will become well educated and have a happy life when they grow up. He requests a loan to purchase wood to increase his business inventory.

loans.use: to purchase wood

loans.name: Florence

texts.en: Florence A. is thirty-nine years old. She is married with five children who are currently in school. Her husband works with a sanitation agency called Zoom lion waste management. She is a food vendor and has served food like rice and stew for eight years now. Because of the tasty meals she prepares, she has attracted lots of customers who buy from her stand, so the demand is very high. Therefore she asks for loan support to buy more bags of rice, vegetable oil, meats and other ingredients to increase her food production and flavor. She believes this will help expand her business and raise more income to help her husband support the family and to finance her children’s education. Florence belongs to the village bank called Nkwagyedom which means 'savior of the many'.

loans.use: To buy palm nuts, rice, vegetables, meat and firewood, etc.

loans.name: Mareli

texts.es: Mareli es una mujer con mucha simpatía, característica que la acompaña desde que formó su hogar junto a su esposo y sus 4 hijos, cuyo bienestar es su prioridad. Está dedicada a la confección y costura de ropa, actividad que viene realizando desde hace 12 años, pues aprendió cursos básicos y empezó a realizar diversos pedidos para sus vecinos, con el tiempo, su eficiencia y experiencia fue muy valorada por sus clientes, quienes acudían continuamente a ella. Gracias a esta eficiencia, no sólo logró captar clientela en su barrio, sino también que los fabricantes de prendas la contratan para campañas de temporada, y frente a los grandes pedidos por entregar tiene la ayuda de sus hijos mayores. Este es su treceavo crédito con MFP, y sus ganas de trabajar incentivan a que todas sus compañeras tengan los mismos ánimos por el compromiso del progreso de su banco comunal. Los 3000 soles que solicita serán para la compra de otra máquina de coser, ya que sus hijos han aprendido a utilizarla, y con una adicional, Mareli podrá aumentar su producción, gracias al apoyo de sus hijos.
texts.en:
Mareli is a very kind woman, a characteristic that has meant she has created a home together with her husband and their 4 children in which wellbeing is their priority. She has been a tailor and seamstress for 12 years. She learnt from basic courses and started to do various orders for her neighbours. Over time, her efficiency and experience have been greatly valued by her customers who kept on coming to her. Thanks to this efficiency, she not only managed to attract customers from her area but she also has contracts with factories that have seasonal campaigns. In advance of these large delivery orders, she is helped by her eldest children.
