This is her thirteenth loan from MFP, and her income from her work motivates all of her friends to feel the same sense of commitment to the progress of their community bank. The 3,000 soles that she is asking for will be used to buy another sewing machine, now that her children have learnt how to use it. In addition, Mareli will be able to increase her production, thanks to her children’s help.

Translated from Spanish by Lara Francis, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a sewing machine

loans.name: Vet's Group

texts.en:
This is a small group comprised of five borrowers, all of whom live in the province of Siem Reap. Mrs. Vet S., 39, is a staff member for a massage club. In addition, she also sells some groceries from the store in her home to her neighbors. She is a divorced mother who now cares for two children, who are minors enrolled in school. Vet S. is a fantastic and very responsible lady who tries to earn money in order to support both her children, providing clothing, daily food, and medical care. Recently, Vet S. has been lacking money to invest her grocery business more successfully. She is applying for a loan through Kiva to purchase a variety of grocery items to sell. The other borrowers are jointly taking this loan: 
So S. will use the loan to replace her old motor in order to ride to work more quickly.
Sen S. is a massage club staff member, seeking a loan to repair her house.
Ros S. sells beef soup in her home and she requests a loan to use as capital in her business.
Kit L. will be using the loan to accrue her business capital for selling groceries.

loans.use: To purchase a variety of grocery items to sell

loans.name: Aissa Gaye

texts.fr: aissa gaye M. est parent beneficiaire a camberene depuis 1999.elle s'active dans la fripperie et capitalise une certaine experience dans ce domaine.pour repondre ala forte demande de sa clientele elle sollicite ce pret de 100 000frs afin d'etre plus competitive.
texts.en:
Aissa Gaye M. has been a client parent in Camberene since 1999. She is active in used clothing and is capitalizing on some experience in this field. To respond to the strong customer demand, she is requesting this loan of 100,000 francs to be more competitive.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Commerce

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buy more supplies for re-sale

loans.name: Lucia Antonia

texts.es: Doña Lucia ser una persona muy humilde de una comunidad muy lejana del departamento de Totonicapan su actividad principal es el bordado a maquina de coser manual ella viene ejerciendo dicha actividad cuando tenia doce años y hasta la fecha conserva dicho trabajo que lo heredo su querida madrecita, ella narra que sus vecinas de la comunidad le llevan la prendas de vestir para hacerles los delantales, adornos a los cortes, blusas hoy necesita de un credito para la compra de materiales ya que se tiene un pedido para la feria de la comunidad de Totonicapan.
texts.en:
Ms. Lucia P. is a very humble person from a far-off community in the department of Totonicapan. Her main business activity is embroidery by sewing machine. She has been in this business ever since she was 12 years old. Even today, she still works in this craft, which she inherited from her beloved mother. She states that her neighbors take her their garments so that she can make matching aprons, decorate the pieces, and make blouses. She now needs a loan in order to purchase supplies because she has a large order from a market in the community of Totonicapan.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase materials

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase additional stock of animal medicines

loans.name: Guillermina

texts.es: Guillermina tiene 48 años, es casada y tiene tres hijos, con quienes vive en la casa que construyó junto a su pareja hace varios años. Desde muy joven trabajó para fábricas textiles realizando el acabado de las prendas de vestir que el enviaban, las cuales, en su mayoría, son exportadas al extranjero. Es por ello que trata de elaborarlas con suma delicadeza y creatividad, con el fin de mostrar en sus trabajos diversos paisajes de la serranía del país. Sin embargo, cuando la demanda se acrecienta requiere de materiales para agilizar su trabajo y debido al escaso recurso económico pierde algunos contratos con clientes importantes. Es por ello que desea obtener el capital necesario para la implementación de su taller dentro de su casa, donde trabaja todo el día. Sus planes a futuro son de diseñar algunas prendas y conformar una asociación de exportación, pues es muy creativa y emprendedora. La responsabilidad es lo que la caracteriza y lo demostró en los anteriores créditos que solicitó a Microfinanzas PRISMA. Lo que le agrada de su banco comunal, el que conforma hace siete años, es cumplir con las cuotas y los objetivos que se proponen. Los 2000 soles que requiere le permitirán adquirir los materiales necesarios para la elaboración de las prendas para exportación.

loans.use: Compra de materiales textiles

loans.name: Regina

texts.en: Regina sells shoes and bags to make a living in Warri, Delta State, Nigeria. She is 34 years old and single with no children. She requests a loan amount of 140,000 NGN to purchase more shoes and bags to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more shoes and bags to sell

loans.name: Olaide

texts.en: Olaide is a 34-year-old woman living in Lagos state, Nigeria. She is married with 2 children. She sells provisions like noodles, bathing soap, sugar, etc. She hopes for the loan amount of N170,000 to purchase more provisions to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more provisions to sell

loans.name: Michael

texts.en: Michael sells secondhand electronics to make a living. He is 60 years old and married with six children. He lives in Benin City, Edo State, Nigeria. He hopes for a loan of 40,000 nairas to purchase more secondhand electronics to sell. He says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more secondhand electronics to sell

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn is engaged in a retailing business in her village. She plants different vegetables in her backyard for additional vegetables to sell. When she has no produce yet, she buys vegetables at the market of Cauayan City and retails them in her village. She hopes to have additional funds to buy fertilizers for her vegetable garden and additional capital to buy fresh vegetables from the market. She is requesting a loan amount of PHP 4,000 and she hopes that it will be granted.

Jocelyn is a patient businesswoman who never loses hope, no matter how hard life is. She is always ready to work for the welfare of her children, who are still studying. She is thankful to her husband because he plows and cultivates their vegetable garden with her on their farm. Their family is happily residing in the village of Cabaruan, Naguilian, Isabela.

loans.use: to buy more fresh vegetables and fertilizer.

loans.name: Melinda

texts.en:
Melinda is 43 years old and lives in  Barangay Marobbob Amulung, Cagayan. She is married and while she doesn't have any children, she is generously supporting her niece who is getting her masters degree.

Melinda owns a village store. She sells snacks called pansit (a type of noodles).  Before she was able to put up her small store, she sold her goods around the village. With her store ready, she can now offer more commodities to meet the demands of her customers. She wants to further develop her business, so she is asking for a loan from KIVA lenders to provide business capital, amounting to PHP 23,000. She wants to buy more goods to sell in her store to increase her profits.

Melinda hopes that her business will further expand so that she will be able to cover her own expenses and finance the schooling of her niece.

loans.use: Capital to buy more goods to sell in her general store

loans.name: Liza

texts.en:
Liza M. is from the village of Seti, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is 43 years old, is married, and has six school-aged children. Liza owns and operates a business planting and harvesting bananas for sale in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 900 PHP a month. In 2008, Liza joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from GDMPC. Liza is requesting a new loan of 4,000 PHP which will be used to purchase general farm supplies and equipment. This loan will be her third from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family's income. About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase general farm supplies and equipment

loans.name: Christine Awino

texts.en:
Christine Awino O. is a 53-year-old woman, a mother of six children and the sole proprietor of a cereals business. She mainly deals in maize, and occasionally wheat. She initially was a baker at the local market of Malanga, Busia district.

Christine requires a loan of 20,000 KES, which she says will go toward expanding her cereals business by buying more stock in bulk. Some will go to pay school fees for her children.

Her future plan and dream is to make sure her children attend school to the highest level, something she keeps insisting she should have not missed.

loans.use: Expand stock and pay school fees

loans.name: Rosalia

texts.es:
La señora Rosalía R. y su esposa el señor Alfredo H. son padres de tres pequeños hijos a quines les quieren dar lo mejor. 
Actualmente están vivienda en una casa que le prestaron, pero les acaban de informar que tiene que desocupar la vivienda, pero ellos desea mejor tener su propia patrimonio. Es por eso que están aplicando para adquirir una vivienda por medio de un crédito gubernamental, pero les está haciendo falta una diferencia para que le puedan entregar a tiempo.
Es por eso que solicitan el préstamo y así pagar la diferencia y les puedan entregar su vivienda, para que sus tres niños puedan recibir el mejor regalo esta navidad que es su propia casa.
texts.en:
Rosalía Rodríguez and her husband, Alfredo H., are the parents of three small children. They love their children and want to give them the best. They are currently living in a house that was lent to them. But, they were just informed that they need to vacate the house. They wish to have their own home. That is why they are applying to get their own home through a government loan. However, they are lacking the difference to be able to get it on time. That is why they are asking for the loan to pay the difference and be able to get their home. They want this so that they three children can receive the best present this Christmas, which is their own home.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Pay the difference for their home through a loan from Infonavit

loans.name: Yarha Group

texts.es:
El grupo Yarha está integrado por tres mujeres trabajadoras, esforzadas y fuertes que aun cuando les ha tocado vivir momentos muy difíciles han buscado el modo de salir adelante. Una de ellas Karla Patricia G. M. quien tiene una mini pulpería. 

Rosa Argentina M. A. quien desde hace 28 años vende ropa, helados, cervezas, hielo y  comida con lo cual saco adelante a sus hijos. Ella comento que en negocio toda va bien pero en lo familiar a ella le agobiaba  el hecho de que su hijo no viera a su nieta quien le pregunta mucho por él. Pero gracias a Dios en esta navidad logro que estos se encontraran y empezaran a tener una mejor relación.

Carolina L. hace y vende tortillas y nacatamales los fines de semana con lo cual ha ido creciendo y mejorando su calidad de vida. Ella es mujer muy fuerte que a sufrido por el hecho de no tener a su hija mayor a su cargo ya que cuando la tuvo era muy joven y sus padres decidieron dársela a un pariente.  Actualmente ella está luchando por la custodia de su hija a la que ve muy pocas veces.
texts.en:
The Yarha group is made up of three, hard-working, strong and tenacious women who, despite having to surpass very difficult moments in life, have sought a way to continue to get ahead. One of them is Karla Patricia G. M., who has a small grocery store. Rosa Argentina M. A. has sold clothing, frozen treats, beer, ice and prepared meals for the last 28 years; this has allowed her to raise her children successfully. She tells us that her business does well but, on a personal front, she was weighed down by the fact that her son did not have any contact with his daughter, who asked about him a lot. However, thanks to God, she managed to reunite them this Christmas and they have begun to have a better relationship with each other. Carolina L. makes and sells tortillas and nacatamales (steamed maize dumpling with savory filling, wrapped in a banana leaf) on weekends, an activity that has gradually been growing and improving her quality of life. She is a strong woman who has suffered much by the fact that she has never been able to care for her oldest daughter because, having had her when she was very young, her parents decided to give the child to a relative to raise. Currently, she is fighting to regain custocy of her daughter, whom she sees very rarely.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy stock items for her store.

loans.name: Santiago

texts.es: Santiago H. G. de 67 años de edad, reside en Ilopango, ubicado en el departamento de San Salvador. Vive junto a su esposa quien se dedica a los quehaceres del hogar y le ayuda a Santiago con el negocio. Él posee una tienda en la cual comercializa productos perecederos  y de primera necesidad, la cual ha tratado de mantener siempre con lo esencial para mantener sus ventas. Desde hace 20 años que el posee su negocio, el cual le permitió sacar adelante a sus hijos y poderles brindar una vida digna, por esta misma razón Santiago es una persona muy conocida en el lugar por cotar con muchos años de experiencia, así mismo por brindar precios muy justos y razonables a las personas. Él solicita un préstamo a través del cual pueda comprar todos los productos necesarios, para poder brindar siempre lo que las personas buscan, productos como arroz, frijoles, azúcar, sal, pan y otros más los cuales son muy necesarios en el hogar. Santiago desea poder mejorar su negocio, ya que esta es la única fuente de ingresos con la que tanto él como su esposa poseen.
texts.en:
Santiago H. G., who is 67 years old, resides in Ilopango, located in the Department of San Salvador. He lives with his wife, who is a homemaker and helps Santiago with the business. He has a store in which he sells perishable goods and basic needs products. He tries to always stock essential goods in order to keep up his sales. He has owned his business for 20 years, and it has allowed him to improve his children's situation and offer them a respectable life. Santiago is well known in the area for having many years of experience and for offering fair and reasonable prices to his customers. He is requesting a loan, through which he will be able to purchase the products he needs to always have in stock what his customers are looking for: products such as rice, beans, sugar, salt, bread and other necessary household items. Santiago hopes to be able to improve his business, since it is the only source of income that he and his wife possess.

Translated from Spanish by Marni Siegal, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase perishable goods

loans.name: Anita

texts.en:
Anita T., 39, is making sure that her family of four children has enough food for their daily needs by adding to her husband's income; she manages her variety store while doing direct selling of popular brand clothing and cosmetics.

Anita has been a regular member of Center for Community Transformation* (CCT) for more than a year, regularly attending their weekly fellowship meetings and paying her weekly dues consistently. Because of her good repayment performance, she was able to borrow six times in CCT’s Cooperative. She uses the money she borrows to expand and improve her business. Now, with your help, she would like to apply for a PHP 17,000 loan to replenish her variety store’s inventory.

She dreams that her business will continue to grow so that she can provide for her family’s everyday needs.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: buying groceries to replenish her variety store’s inventory.

loans.name: Madiha Soraya Group

texts.en:
Torpeki is a member of the Madiha Soraya group. She lives in the 1st district in Kabul, Afghanistan. She is 30 years old. She is single and lives with four family members: her mother, her father and two sisters, who are students. She is a responsible girl and works as a tailor to support her family members. 

She learned the skill of tailoring during the Taliban regime. At that time, she was a student and as the Taliban forced all girls to be confined at home, she had no choice but to learn tailoring. 

Now she has lots of clients who like her way of work. She needs the loan to purchase a new machine with the other things such as cloth, thread and so on. She hopes to grow her business and to send her two sisters to the best private schools to have bright futures.

loans.use: She wants to buy a new machine for her business

loans.name: Gonzalo Jacobo

texts.es:
Gonzalo Jacobo S., quien  Labora como Higienista en el Mercado Israel Lewites de Managua, el tiene un hijo a su cargo,  y  este se encuentra en edad escolar, es casado, ha trabajado trece  crédito con CEPRODEL durante nueve  años, en este periodo de tiempo ha invertido los crédito en la mejoramiento de la vivienda en la que habita, gracias al financiamiento otorgados por CEPRDEL.  
El crédito solicitado es para la compra de materiales de electricidad por lo que cambiara todo el sistema eléctrico de su casa de habitación.
 Todo esto con el objetivo de Brindarles mayor seguridad y  una mejor condición de vida a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Gonzalo Jacobo S. works as a janitor in the Israel Lewites Market in Managua. He has a son in his care who is school-aged. He is married, and has taken 13 loans with CEPRODEL over the last 9 years. Over this time he is used the loans to improve the home that he lives in, thanks to the financings provided by CEPRODEL. The loan requested will be used to buy electrical supplies to change the entire electrical system in his home. He does this to increase security and to provide better living conditions for his children.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: home improvement

loans.name: Mostafa

texts.en:
Mostafa is a 55-year-old married man and the father of four school-age children. He started working repairing car bodies and painting cars 47 years ago when he was too young. In 2000, he became economically able to open his own car repair shop and to make his own profit. 

Today, Mostafa is requesting a loan of $1,200 to buy a specialized machine for repairing cars. This machine will help him a lot in developing his business and presenting a new service for his customers.

loans.use: To buy a specialized machine for repairing cars

loans.name: Mineros De Bolivia Group

texts.es:
Susana C. integrante de la Asociación Comunal Mineros de Bolivia que a su vez pertenece al Centro Focal Santiago II, tiene el negocio de venta de comida hace 5 años aproximadamente, con el cuál ha podido sacar adelante a su familia, en esta oportunidad necesita el préstamo para comprar insumos como el arroz y fideo al por mayor.

Las demás integrantes de este grupo también tienen diversos negocios como la atención de una tienda de barrio, venta de ropa, confección de faldas y venta de chompas.

Todas requieren del préstamo para fortalecer y mejorar sus negocios.
texts.en:
Susana C. is a member of the Asociación Comunal Mineros de Bolivia (Community Miner's Association of Bolivia), that, in turn, belongs to the Centro Focal Santiago II (Santiago community bank regional office II). She has had a business selling food for approximately five years, with which she has been able to get her family ahead. For this opportunity, she needs the loan to buy consumables such as rice and pasta, wholesale.

The rest of the members of this group also have different businesses, such as a neighborhood store, selling clothing, making skirts, and selling sweaters. They all require the loan to strengthen and improve their businesses.

Translated from Spanish by Amy McGinty, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy consumables

loans.name: Angelica Maria

texts.es:
Angélica de 37 años, vive en una zona urbana en el Suburbio de Guayaquil. Esta separa pero tiene un hijo de 15 años. Angélica tiene una tienda de abarrotes, vende arroz, azúcar y todo tipos de granos llamados garbanzo, fréjol, lenteja, achote, maíz, (Todos estos granos se los utiliza para la comida tipica del Ecuador)

Tiene la tienda de abarrotes desde hace mucho tiempo para mantener a su hijo. Trabaja desde las 06h30 hasta las 14h00pm todos los días. Siempre ha trabajado sola aunque la ausencia de su esposo le afecta ella continua trabajando por su hijo. 

Con el préstamo quiere comprar cemento, bloques y cerámica para remodelar su casa y darle un mejor vivir a su hijo. En el futuro quiere terminar de construir su casa, y poder surtir mejor su negocio de abarrotes.
texts.en:
Angelica is a 37-year-old woman who lives in an urban zone in the Suburbio de Guayaquil. She is separated and has a 15-year-old son. Angelica owns a general store in which she sells rice, sugar, corn, annatto, and all types of legumes like chickpeas, beans, and lentils (all used in traditional Ecuadorian dishes).

She has owned this store for a long time in order to support her son. She works from 6:30 in the morning until 2:00 in the afternoon. She has always worked on her own. Even though her husband's absence affects her, she continues to work for her son's sake.

With this loan, she would like to purchase cement, cinder blocks, and tile to remodel her house, providing her son with a better dwelling. In the future, she would like to finish building her house and be able to better stock her general store.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase cement, cinder blocks, and tile

loans.name: Rodolfo

texts.en:
Rodolfo A. Jr. is from the village of Consuelo, Magsaysay, Misamis Oriental. He is 38 years old and single. Rodolfo has a business providing transport services to local community members using his motor vehicle. Rodolfo has been engaged in his business for over three years and earns approximately 2,000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Rodolfo joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. He has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI and is requesting a new loan of 8000 PHP which will be used to purchase materials needed to provide better service. This loan will be the third loan taken out by Rodolfo from HSPFI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement his family's income. 

About HSPFI: HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase materials needed to provide  better service

loans.name: Teodora

texts.es:
La señora Teodora D. 42 años D. edad es comerciante, se dedica a la venta D. calzados para damas  caballeros y niños su puesto D. ventas se encuentra en el mercado municipal D. la ciudad D. Villarrica desD. hace mas D. 20 años, le ayuda su conyuge el señor Eustacio O. D. 55 años D. edad.

Comenta que empezó con poca mercadería y con el trabajo y el esfuerzo D. ellos pudieron salir adelante y ampliar su negocio, mediante el ingreso del negocio pueden cubrir todos los gastos familiares en cuanto a educacion y alimentación principalmente. 

Solicita el préstamo a Fundación Paraguaya para la  compra D. más mercaderías D. la temporada como calzados para damas, caballeros y niños ademas desaen comprar para ampliar su negocio medias, buzos, camperas.
texts.en:
Mrs. Teodora is 42 years old and is a businesswoman; she sells footwear for women, men, and children. Her sales stall has been in the Villarrica municipal market for over 20 years. Her 55-year-old husband, Mr. Eustacio O., helps her with her business. She tells us that she began with few products, but with the work and effort she and her husband put into the business, they were able to come out ahead and grow. Through the income that they maD. from the daily sales of footwear, they were able to cover all of their family’s basic expenses. Teodora is applying for a loan from the Fundación Paraguaya to buy more goods for this season, such as different types of footwear, sweaters, socks and stockings, sweatshirts, and jackets to satisfy her customers’ demand.

Translated from Spanish by Mairead Harris, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of shoes, athletic footwear, socks, etc. for the winter season

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This Kiva borrower is a 34 year old single man from Lebanon. He lives with his mother and he is taking care of her. He owns a spare parts shop.

He wants to take out a loan of $1,000 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a l. to buy more spare parts and enlarge his shop to meet the requirement of his clients and make a good income. He plans to use the loan to invest in new car speciality equipment because his shop is located in a car plant area and all the car mechanics shop with him to acquire their work needs.

This will be his second Kiva loan. He was a consistent client with on-time repayments for his last loan of $600.

loans.use: Buy more spare parts

loans.name: Francisca Alicia

texts.es: Francisca Alicia M. D. H. D. 40 años D. edad, resiD. en Tonacatepeque, ubicado en el departamento D. San Salvador, en donD. resiD. junto a su compañero D.  vida quien se dedica a trabajar, y junto a una hija. Francisca trabaja muy duro D. lunes a domingo elaborando tortillas, las cuales son un alimento muy típico el cual forma parte D. la alimentación básica D. las personas, ya que los salvadoreños las consumen a diario hasta tres veces al día, por lo que es un negocio bastante estable, en el cual se cuenta con muchos clientes a pesar D. poseer diferente competencia. Francisca y su familia depenD. en gran manera D. las ganancias D. este negocio por lo que es D. mucha importancia poder mejorar sus ventas, es por ello que solicita un préstamo a Integral con el deseo D. comprar maíz por mayor, así mismo comprar tambos D. gas propano, esto lo hace con el deseo D. contar con la materia prima D. su negocio y así obtener mayores ganancias, las cuales sean D. mucho beneficio para su familia.
texts.en:
Francisca Alicia M. D. H. is 40 years old and resides in Tonacatepeque, which is located in the Department of San Salvador. She lives with her daughter and her husband who is dedicated to his work. From Monday to Sunday, Francisca works hard preparing tortillas since they are a basic staple of the Salvadoran diet that can be consumed up to three times a day. Even though she has plenty of competition, her business is quite stable and attracts many customers. Francisca and her family depend heavily on the income generated from her business, so it is very important that she improve her sales.

For this reason, she is requesting a loan from Apoyo Integral. She plans to buy corn in bulk as well as tanks of propane gas. Francisca hopes to have the supplies needed in her business to generate more revenue, which will be of great benefit to her family.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase corn & tanks of propane gas

loans.name: Emilia

texts.es: Emilia, de 43 años de edad, convive con su pareja y tiene dos hijos en su haber. Juntos residen en la localidad de Santa Rosa, ubicada en la selva tropical ayacuchana, donde tienen su propia casa. Posee una tienda, en donde le esta yendo de la mejor manera, desde luego que esta percibiendo buenas ganancias económicas y no se arrepiente por nada del mundo por haber incursionado en este rubro, incluso cuenta con clientes fieles que siempre acuden a su establecimiento. Por lo general recibe ayuda de sus hijos, pero normalmente trabaja por cuenta propia y su rutina diaria lo realiza desde las 6:00 de la mañana hasta las 10:00 de la noche. Su punto de venta lo realiza frente al parque principal su localidad, sin embargo, ella está pensando ampliar su tienda con la finalidad de que pueda vender al por mayor, y así generar un buen margen de rentabilidad. Este es su decimocuarto crédito con MFP, por el cual se compromete a seguir pagando durante las fechas establecidas, además se siente contento con su grupo comunal, por la responsabilidad y puntualidad en sus pagos que realizan. Con el crédito que solicita comprará mercadería de toda variedad, con la finalidad de que pueda abastecer su tienda para no tener ningún contratiempo con sus clientes.
texts.en:
Emilia is 43 years old. She has a live-in partner and two children. Together they live in their own house in the town of Santa Rosa, located in the tropical jungle of the Ayacucho area. She owns a store, which is going very well for her. She is receiving good economic returns, and she does not regret going into this field for anything in the world. She even has loyal customers who always shop in her store. She receives help from her children in general, but normally she works on her own; her daily routine starts at 6:00 a.m and continues until 10:00 at night. Her shop is located in front of the main park in her town. However, she is thinking of expanding her store so that she can sell wholesale and thus generate a good profit margin. This is her fourteenth loan with MFP, and she is committed to continue paying throughout the established time period. She also feels very happy with the members of her communal bank, thanks to the responsibility and punctuality they demonstrate in their payments. With the loan she is requesting, she will buy a broad variety of merchandise, with the aim of stocking her store so that she will have no setbacks with her customers.

Translated from Spanish by Patricia Linderman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying a variety of products to stock her store

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy more lappas (a traditional dress for woman), milk, and sugar

loans.name: Maria

texts.es: María tiene 64 años, es una madre de familia muy trabajadora, es viuda, vive en compañía de su hijo en su casa propia. Hace más de 8 años, se dedica en la venta de ropa para niñas y niños, siendo estas vendidas de casa en casa y a crédito, puesto que previamente son pedidos de algún cliente. Es entonces que atiende a su clientela en cualquier hora del día, a quienes ya les conoce, ya que mientras va cobrando va ofreciendo las exclusividades de la mercadería que posee. Paralelamente a esta actividad, se dedica a coser edredones, sabanas y almohadas en su casa, en sociedad con su hermana, por lo que también tiene muchos pedidos que cumplir. Pero lo que más le gusta es el negocio y el contacto con la gente; ya que así se distrae. Su mayor anhelo es tener su taller de costuras con maquinas industriales que realicen acabados impecables y pueda confeccionar en  cantidad prendas, para así ampliar su negocio. Es su 21avo crédito con MFP, y se compromete en pagar todas sus cuotas a tiempo, como hasta ahora lo ha hecho. Además le gusta trabajar con sus compañeras, por que son muy responsables. Con el crédito que solicita, es para la compra de más prendas, así como telas, de ese modo incrementar su capital de trabajo.
texts.en:
María, 64, is a very hard working mother. She’s a widow and lives with her son in her own house. For over 8 years she has sold children’s clothes on credit door-to-door. They are previously ordered by customers. She tends to customers at all hours of the day, then, at least those who are already known to her. As she goes about collecting payment she offers the unique items she has in stock. In addition to this activity, she also makes comforters, sheets and pillows at home with her sister. She also has many pending orders for these items. But what she likes best about her business is the contact she has with people because this distracts her. Her greatest wish is to have a sewing workshop equipped with industrial sewing machines that produce impeccable finishings so that she can make items in quantity thus expanding her business. This is her 21st loan with MFP and she pledges to repay all her installments on time like she’s been doing to date. Besides, she enjoys working with her fellow group members because they are very responsible. She will use the requested loan to buy more articles of clothing as well as fabric thereby increasing her working capital.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy more articles of clothing.

loans.name: Tserennadmid

texts.en: Tserennadmid J. is a 45 year old married woman with four children. She lives with her husband and four children in Huvsgul province of Mongolia, in their own ger, a traditional nomadic housing tent. Her oldest two children, aged 20 and 22, are students while her youngest two children, 12 and 16, attend a local school. Her husband works as a private businessman. Tserennadmid operates an electric appliances retail business in her town. She has been engaged this business since 2000, selling a variety of small household electrical goods in a rented stall at a local market. In the future, she hopes to have her own stall. She is a very modest and hardworking businesswoman and is requesting an 1,000,000 MNT loan in order to increase her working capital for her household electric appliances trading business.

loans.use: To buy more electrical goods.

loans.name: Angelita

texts.en:
Angelita D. is a married woman who lives in Hda. Bungyod, Brgy. Matab-ang, Talisay City, Negros Occidental. She earns her living by operating a general store and a ready-to-wear clothes business. Her husband Jimmy, who is 54 years old, works as a carpenter and also helps in his wife's business activities. They have eight children between nine and 23 years old. 

Angelita joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2008 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past four loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Angelita has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 5,000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 8,000, thus raising the family's standard of living.  For her fifth cycle loan, she is borrowing PHP 10,000 to buy more inventory for her general store so that she can continue to save up for the future education of her children. Angelita D. is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path towards the achievement of her dreams. 

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon — a title of esteem bestowed on a member of a community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.  Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: Increase her stock

loans.name: Se

texts.en: Se K., 59, is married and resides with her husband and two children in Kandal Province, Cambodia, an area known for fertile farmland for growing vegetables. K. grows bananas to sell, earning an income of about USD 3 per day. Her husband refills lighters’ gas, earning an income of about USD 2 per day. The family has to spend USD 40 on food, USD 8 on electricity and water supplies, and USD 10 on other necessary expenses every month.  K. is requesting a loan of USD 1,000 to purchase fertilizer to grow bananas and gas to refill the lighters. In the future, she would like to use any additional profit to repair her house. This is her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia. K.'s husband appears in the photograph because K. is not available.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer to grow bananas

loans.name: Bich's Group

texts.en:
Nine people make up this village loan. Mrs. Bich H., 50 years old, is the village bank president, having been selected by the members of this village loan, located in Preaek Bak village in Kandal province. The members of this village loan hope that the loan will increase their income to improve their families' living conditions.

H. and her husband, Mr. Kong Ith, are farmers who own a plot of land that they use to cultivate vegetables, peanuts, and corn for a living. Aside from farming, her husband also earns some profit through fishing. In order to support her husband's business, H. decided to ask for a loan to buy a fishing boat. This couple has eight children: one is a laborer, one is a farmer, and one is a fisherman. The others are attending the local school and also help with their parents' businesses.

loans.use: To buy a fishing boat

loans.name: Voek

texts.en:
Voek V., 28, is married with two young children living at home in Takeo province. She works in a garment factory, typically making US $3.50 each day and her husband works in construction. Her husband typically makes about US $4 each day.

Voek V. learned how to do make up and hair, so now she would like a loan of US $500 to open a hairdressing shop. She will resign from her current work and start a new business very soon.

loans.use: To open a hairdressing shop.

loans.name: Imelda

texts.en:
Imelda L. is from the village of Dalirig, Manolo Fortich, Bukidnon. She is 56 years old. Imelda is married and has 7 adult children. To make a living, Imelda owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector running a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. The main source of income for the business comes primarily from buying and selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap, toothpaste, canned goods & junk foods in the local community. Imelda has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 10000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Imelda joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Imelda is requesting a  loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to buy and sell. This loan will be the 1st loan taken out by Imelda from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to buy and sell

loans.name: Momela Group

texts.en:
Mwajuba J. is in her late thirties and is married with four children. Majuba has been running a small fish restaurant for the past 20 years. The shop is open between 11:00 am and 04:00 pm daily and earns Mwajuba a low monthly profit. 

This will be Mwajuba's fourth loan with Tujijenge Tanzania. Mwajuba used her previous loans to buy land and started to build a new house for herself. These loans have since been successfully repaid. Mwajuba will use her fourth loan to increase basic supplies for the shop, such as plates, buckets, cutlery and cups. Mwajuba's dream is to one day finish her house.

Mwajuba will share this loan with her loan group Momela, which totals 19 members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for repaying the loans. 

In the picture, Mwajuba can be seen wearing a green dress in the front row.

loans.use: To increase her stock of plates and cutlery at her fish restaurant.

loans.name: Nuvy Grace

texts.en:
Nuvy Grace V. is a 25-year old married woman who supports her family through her general store business. She lives in Brgy. San Juan, San Carlos City, Negros Occidental. She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2007 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her general store  business, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of 8,000 PHP. Nuvy Grace is borrowing 12,000 PHP so that she can continue to purchase more stocks of goods to sell. This will be her 7th loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of 10,000 PHP, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey toward economic freedom. Nuvy Grace aspires to elevate her family's living conditions and ensure their future well-being by following the Dungganon way. 

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: To purchase more stocks of goods to sell

loans.name: Aigul

texts.en:
Aigul M. is 49, married and has three grown children. She was born in the south of the country, but in order to find better conditions to live in for her children, her family decided to move to Ozernoe village, in the suburb of the capital city Bishkek. 

There, in 2000, they bought a house and started their business in land cultivating. Aigul and her husband worked hard and managed to cultivate a sort of potatoes that came into great demand at the local markets. 

In 2007, Aigul decided to move to Besh-Terek village, where cattle breeding is successfully developed. Aigul left her house and business in land cultivating to her elder son, Ulan, and to his family.
  
Now Aigul and her husband are engaged in cattle breeding and they maintain a farm with three milk cows and two bull calves. She started this business with the initial capital of 10,000 KGS and manages to earn 9,000 KGS in a month. 

Now Aigul wants to develop her farm and for this reason, she applies for a loan of 80,000 KGS. With the revenues, she plans to renovate her house. 

Bai-Tushum and Partners is one of the leading microfinance institutions in Kyrgyzstan. As a reliable financial partner, Bai-Tushum contributes to the economic development of the Kyrgyz Republic through the delivery of microfinance services in rural and urban areas that lead to increased employment and meet the interests of its clients and investors. Bai-Tushum and Partners uses Kiva funding to target the especially vulnerable population.

loans.use: To purchase cattle

loans.name: Vidal

texts.es: Vidal casado, su esposa le apoya en la venta de sus productos, planes mejorar la infraestructura de la vivienda. Agricultor desde muy joven inicio a trabajar la tierra de su finca y por medio de la reforma agraria inicio las primeras cosechas, se le presenta dificultades en los siembros como es el robo del producto.  Realizar conservación de suelo es necesario ya que será de un gran beneficio para el productor. El préstamo será invertido en la compra de insumos realizando mayores cantidades de productos y compra de fertilizantes para abonar a las plantas obteniendo mejor calidad.
texts.en: Vidal is married and his wife helps him sell their products and with their plans to improve their home's structure. He has been an agriculturist since he was very young, working the land and he managed his first harvests. He sees some challenges in the cultivations, such as the theft of the harvest. It would be a great benefit to the producer to protect the harvest as a necessary step. The loan will be invested in the purchase of materials to increase production and to purchase fertilizers to fertilize the plants to stimulate a greater yield.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers and materials.

loans.name: Margret

texts.en:
Margret is a single woman with two children, both  of whom attend school. She lives in a rental house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

She has operated a food selling stall, operating from home where neighbours are her potential customers. Margret faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. She hopes to open another business in the future.

With the Kshs 20,000 she wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, sugar and vegetable oil. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase bundles of wheat flour, sugar and vegetable oil.

loans.name: Ma. Gina

texts.en:
Ma. Gina is a married woman who lives in San Carlos City, Negros Occidental. She earns her living by operating a buy and sell of ginger and vegetables business.  Her husband Jose Ariel, who is 34 years old, works as a vendor to earn his living and helps in his wife's business activities.  They have two children who are 6 and 9 years old.  Ma. Gina joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2009 because she aspired for something better for her family.  With the help of her past three loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Ma. Gina has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow.  Her previous loan of PHP 8,000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 10,000, thus uplifting the family's standard of living.  This time, for her fourth loan, she is borrowing PHP 10,000 to use as funds for her business operations so that she can continue to save up for the future of her children's education.  Ma. Gina is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams. The picture was taken at the back of her house where she stores the ginger that is to be delivered to her buyers.  

About NWTF:  In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.  Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by joining the NWTF Kiva lending team at http://www.kiva.org.

loans.use: To funds her business operations

loans.name: Julio Antonio

texts.es:
Don Julio de 47 años de edad, vive con su esposa y un hijo, residen en Jiquilisco departamento de Usulután, él es agricultor dedicado a la siembra de maíz, pipián, pepinos y ejotes, tiene 15 años de estar dedicado a la agricultura y aprendió el oficio de su padre.
Él solicita un préstamo para la compra de puertas para su vivienda, ya que está terminando de construirla y no alcanza a terminar con las puertas. Este préstamo será de mucha ayuda ya que hará posible la finalización de la vivienda, teniéndola más segura para vivir con su familia.
Las aspiraciones es ver totalmente construida la vivienda, seguir cultivando la tierra y a través de su trabajo cada día ofrecer una mejor condición económica a su familia.
texts.en:
Julio is 47 years old and he lives with his wife and son. They live in Jiquilisco in the department of Usulutan. He is a dedicated agriculturist who plants corn, gourds, cucumbers, and green beans. He has dedicated the past 15 years to agriculture and he learned the business from his father.

He requests a loan to purchase doors for his house. He is finishing to build it and he doesn't have enough funds to purchase the doors. This loan will be a great help because he will be able to complete the house, making it more safe to live for his family. 

His dream is to see his house completed, to keep cultivating his land, and through his day to day work to support his family with improved finances.

loans.use: to purchase doors for his house

loans.name: Rosalie

texts.fr:
Madame ROSALIE D. est une femme de 60 ans. Elle est veuve et mère de trois enfants qui sont autonomes. Mais elle a la charge de ses deux petits fils. Elle est la présidente du Banc Villageois de WANGO depuis 1996, date de sa création. 

Elle fait du petit commerce avec la vente de tissus déjà confectionné. Elle a une bonne expérience dans ce domaine pour y avoir excellé depuis plus de dix ans. 

Avec son nouveau crédit de 500.000 francs CFA elle va au moins acheter une vingtaine de pièces pour revendre dans son quartier soit au comptant soit à crédit.

Avec les bénéfices qu'elle réalise elle prend en charge ses besoins personnels, ceux de ses petits fils et elle restaure sa maison.
texts.en:
Ms. Rosalie D. is a 60-year-old woman, a widow, and the mother of three children, who are independent. But she supports her two grandsons. She has been the president of the Banc Villageois of WANGO since 1996, the time it was established.

Rosalie has a small-scale business selling already-made cloth. She has good experience in this domain because she has excelled at it for over ten years.

With her new loan of 500,000 francs CFA, she is going to buy at least 20 lengths of cloth for resale in her district, either for cash or on credit.

With the profits she makes, Rosalie will take care of her personal needs and those of her grandsons. And she is renovating her house.

loans.use: to buy fabrics to sell

loans.name: Nelsa Leticia

texts.es:
la sra. Nelsa Leticia P. tiene 45 años de edad, vive en la colonia Luis Andres Zuniga de la ciudad de Tegucigalpa y se dedica a la venta de productos de uso personal y joyas, sus dias de operación son de lunes a domingo, tiene un alto movimiento en la venta de joyas, especialmente anillos de mujer.
el credito lo utilizara para la compra de joyas de plata, enchape de oro y plata, chancletas, ropa de verano, shampoo, lociones, perfumes, aceite para piel, acondicionador para pelo, gel para pelo, crema para la cara.
en estos dias las ventas son buenas ya que se aproxima la semana santa y las personas que viajan compran muchos de estos productos.
su meta es hacer crecer su negocio y asi tener buenas ganancias, las cuales las necesita para cubrir los gastos del hogar.
texts.en:
Mrs. Nelsa Leticia P. is 45 and lives in the Luis Andres Zuniga housing development. She sells jewelry and products for personal use Mondays to Sundays. She has a high sales volume of jewelry, especially women's rings.
She will use this loan for the purchase of silver jewelry, gold and silver veneer, flip flops, summer clothing, shampoo, lotions, perfumes, body oil, hair conditioner, body gel, and face cream.
These days, her sales are good since we are approaching Holy Week and those who travel buy many of her products.
Her goal is to make her business grow in order to make a good income, which she needs to cover her household costs.

loans.use: to purchase silver jewellry, gold and silver veneer, flip flops, summer clothing, lotions, perfumes, body oil, hair conditioner, body gel, and face cream

loans.name: Glenda Marisol

texts.es:
Glenda de 25 años, es una mujer emprendedora en su negocio que un día decidió escoger esa actividad de servicio por la falta de empleo ya que tuvo el poyo de sus padres.

Ella trabaja todos lo días en su negocio. Su  local lo ubico en su propio domicilio para que su hermano lo ayude también la ayuda en la papelería. Con el préstamo quiere comprar más mercadería para su negocio como camaras, cables, computaodras y como útiles escolares y así mejorar su capital de trabajo. 

En un futuro desea acondicionar  y mejorar su local y dale lo mejor a sus clientelas.
texts.en:
Glenda, 25, is an enterprising woman in her business, who one day decided to choose this service activity because she didn't have a job and was living with the support of her parents. 

She works every day in her business. Her store is located in her house so that her brother can also help her in the stationary store. With the loan she will buy more merchandise for her business like cameras, cables, computers and school supplies, and thereby increase her business capital. 

In the future she wants to add air conditioning and improve her store and give her customers the very best.

loans.use: to buy cameras, cables, computers and school supplies.

loans.name: Israel

texts.es:
Israel, reside en Corinto departamento de Morazán, él es viudo, vive únicamente con su hija Vicky de 14 años de edad, Israel se dedica al cultivo de maíz y frijol, aprendió por su padre el proceso agrícola  desde hace 35 años.
Él sembrara una manzana de terreno de maíz y frijol, para lo que solicita un préstamo y poder comprar abono y fertilizantes, será una gran ayuda para él, pues contara con una nueva cosecha, se asegura de la alimentación de su familia y el excedente lo venderá, para sacar mejor provecho de la producción. 
Su objetivo es siempre estar dispuesto a trabajar, cubriendo todas las necesidades de su familia y sobre todo de su hija.
texts.en:
Israel lives in Corinto, in the department of Morazán. He is a widower and lives with his daughter, Vicky, 14 years old. Israel grows corn and beans. He learned agriculture from his father 35 years ago. 

He cultivates a manzana [unit of measurement, slightly less than a hectare] of land with corn and beans. He is requesting a loan to buy fertilizers. It would be a big help for him because he would have a new harvest. He will be able to feed his family and will sell the remainder to take advantage of the production. 

His goal is to always be able to work and to provide for his family’s needs, especially for his daughter.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer.

loans.name: Twisungane No22 Group

texts.fr: Gratien est client d’ACB depuis 2011, il est membre du groupe Twisungane no 22, il est né au Rwanda, son éducation est primaire, il est marié, il a 5 enfants entre 13 et 9 ans, 4 de ses enfants vont à l’école. C’est son premier cycle de prêt, Gratien va utiliser le prêt pour l’agriculture de riz, en achetant les insecticides et paiement de main d’œuvre. Sa stratégie est d’augmenter la surface à cultiver et l’utilisation des felitilisants pour augmenter la production agricole. Dans l’avenir, il veut être capable de s’autofinancer et éduquer ses enfants  jusqu'à l’université et avoir l’électricité dans sa maison. Gratien est aussi éleveur des petits bétails.
texts.en: Gratien is a client from ACB since 2011. He is a member of Twisungane #22 group. He was born in Rwanda and has primary education. He is married, with five children from 13 to 9 years of age, four of whom are in school. This is his first loan cycle. Gratien will use his loan for rice farming: buying insecticides and paying for manual labor. His strategy is to increase his cultivated land and to use fertilizers to increase his agricultural production. In the future, he would like to be able to finance his business and provide for his children’s education through university level, and also to have electricity in his house. Gratien also raises  small farm animals.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and pay for manual labor

loans.name: Magaaju Twimukye Women's Group

texts.en: Forty-six-year-old Alice has been engaged in the farming business for over 20 years in Ntungamo, Western Uganda. Alice is happily married with 4 children. She is able to make a weekly profit of 30,000 UGX. She plans to use this loan to purchase young goats that she will eventually resell.

loans.use: to purchase goats.

loans.name: Sivat

texts.en:
Sivat, 56, resides in Kampong Chnang province, Cambodia, an area known for palm products. Sivat is a housewife while her husband is a rice field farmer, earning an income of $1.8 per day to help cover the family expenses. The family is also assisted by her three children, who are employed at the garment factory, earning an income of $3 each per day. 

Each month, the family has to spend $60 on food and $15 on the other necessary expenses. 

Sivat is requesting a loan of $1,000 to purchase a motorbike for the children to commute to work. This will be her third loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner.

loans.use: to buy a new motorbike.

loans.name: Prudencienne

texts.en:
Prudencienne is 53 years old and she has five children who are ages 4-24 years old.  Three of her children have completed primary school and stopped going to school, the other one is too young and she is not yet school age while the other one is in primary school.  Her husband is a farmer. 

Prudancienne sells food stuffs and she has done this business for the past 14 years.  This business has enabled her meet the needs of her family.  She needs a loan to buy more food stuffs such as beans in order to make more profits

loans.use: Buying food stuffs for sale.

loans.name: Winangun Sari Group

texts.en:
The Winangun Sari group is made up of seven men who are neighbors in the same village in Baturiti, central Bali. The group is seeking a loan of 14,000,000 IDR, and each member will receive 2,000,000 IDR. The group was formed out of these men’s common interest in raising rabbits to support their families, and out of their interest in education on best practices for rabbit raising. This is their first loan with Kiva partner, MUK.
I Nengah, aged 50, is the head of the Winangun Sari group. He is married and has two children, aged 25 and 13. His younger son is in school and his older son is already married. He plans to use his share of the loan to purchase a pair of large rabbits, which he will breed. Over the six-month loan period, he hopes to have three litters of bunnies. He will sell some of the rabbits as pets after 20 days, and others as food after a few months. With his income, he hopes to be able to improve his economic life.

loans.use: to purchase a pair of large rabbits.

loans.name: Amante

texts.en:
Amante is an industrious father. He is married and blessed with four children. Everyday, he goes in the field to make sure that his business is in good hands. He has been engaged in this kind of business for almost 20 years now. He usually earns a revenue of PHP 25,000 at every harvest. 

He saves some of his profit as initial capital for the next planting season and most of it is used for his family expenditures and his children's studies. He is requesting a loan of PHP 20,000 to purchase seeds to sow and fertilizers to maintain the crop growth to acquire more yield to sell at the next harvest. He is so patient and industrious in his farming because he wants to sustain the needs of his family and for his family to experience an average level of living.

loans.use: to purchase seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Saumu

texts.en:
Saumu is a married woman with one child.  They live in their own house which has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past three years, she has been operating a kindergarten school, teaching children from the neighboring community. She faces a major challenge in delayed payments by parents with children attending the school. She dreams of establishing her school to incorporate other classes in the future.

With the loan for Kshs 20,000, Saumu wants to purchase stationery books for the school. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: buy stationery books for her school

loans.name: Ban

texts.en:
Mrs. Ban is 29 years old and her husband is 28 years old. This sweet couple regularly thinks about how to make more income. Currently, both of them are farmers. They have been in the farming business for five years. 

The couple has one child, who is dependent on them. To earn a living in good situation, Mrs. Ban and her husband would to request some funding through HKL's partnership with Kiva to purchase seeds, fertilizers and other materials supporting her farming business. This is her first loan cycle with HKL's partner Kiva. In the future, Mrs. Ban will send her child to study for a high degree like the rich family in her community.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, fertilizers and other materials.

loans.name: Maryana

texts.ru:
Марьяна живет в городе Виноградове. Она имеет свой бизнес, которым занимается на протяжении 5 лет.

Марьяна имеет торговую точку в центре универмага.  Продает она детскую и подростковую одежду.  Стабильность - это слово характеризует работу Марьяны. Она трудолюбивая и целеустремленная. Марьяна всегда готова помочь клиенту сделать правильный выбор.  Бизнес цель Марьяны: открыть вторую торговую точку.

Марьяна просит предоставить ей кредит в сумме  15,000 гривен на приобретение 20 подростковых костюмов (штаны и майки). Увеличивши ассортимент, Марьяна сможет увеличить доход.
texts.en:
Maryana lives in Vinogradov. She's devoted herself to her business for the past five years. Maryana owns a sales point in the center of a mall where she deals in children's and teen clothing. 

Her work very stable. Maryana is dedicated, diligent and always ready to assist a client. Her business goal is to open a second sales point. Maryana is asking for a loan of 15,000 grivna in order to purchase twenty teen suits (pants and shirt). By diversifying her goods, she can increase profits.

loans.use: to purchase twenty suits for teens.

loans.name: Emilia

texts.es: Emilia tiene 43 años, es natural de la ciudad de Santa Rosa, es casada y madre de 02 hijos, quienes son el motivo para seguir trabajando arduamente. Juntos habitan en su casa que es propia. Durante más de 20 años ha continuado con la agricultura, actividad que su familia ha ejercido por años. Sin embargo no le era suficiente para sostener su hogar, por ello se vio obligada a montar una tienda, gracias a unos ahorros que tuvo. Desde entonces abre las puertas de su tienda a primera hora del día, ofreciendo variedad de productos de primera necesidad. La amabilidad con que atiende a su clientela le ha dado mucha ventaja en sus ventas. Tiene 10 años en esta actividad y  menciona que continuará trabajando con ahínco para consolidar su negocio. Considera además que gracias a las ganancias, ha logrado comprar más terreno agrícolas y del que ahora su esposo trabaja en ella. Con el tiempo, espera poder ampliar su vivienda y su tienda. Por tal motivo pide su 15avo crédito en MFP y esta muy contenta de saber que contara una vez más con el apoyo de todos ustedes. Con el dinero que solicita, comprará productos, como: sacos de arroz, azúcar, aceites, detergentes.
texts.en: Emilia is 43 years old, originally from the city of Santa Rosa, married, and the mother of two children who are her motivation to continue working diligently. Together they live their own house. For more than 20 years she has been working in agriculture, a business her family had engaged in for years. Without a doubt, it is not enough to support the household. For this reason she had to open a store using the savings she had. Since then she opens the doors to her store first thing in the morning, offering a variety of essential products. The friendliness with which she greets her customers has been a great boon to her sales. She has been in this business for 10 years and she says that she will continue working hard to build up her business. Furthermore she says that, thanks to her income, she has been able to buy more farm land and that now her husband works with her. In time, she hopes to be able to expand her home and her business. For that reason she asks for her 15th loan with MFP and she is very happy to know that she can once again count on your help. With the money she asks for, she will buy products like: bags of rice, sugar, oils, and detergents.

loans.use: to buy bags of rice, sugar, oil, and detergent

loans.name: Yesenia

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “KANCHARY”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco,  y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Yesenia; ella tiene 32 años de edad y es conviviente y tiene 2 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de salón de belleza, ella realiza trabajos en cortes de pelo, teñidos y ondulaciones, la socia trabaja desde las 9:00 a.m hasta las 7:00 p.m, por medio de este negocio la socia saca adelante a sus hijos, la socia quiere ampliar y mejorar el negocio de salón de belleza. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar materiales para el salón de belleza como ruleros, tijeras, tintes y shampus.

 La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en: Yesenia, 32, is a member of the “Kanchary” communal bank that’s located in Cusco District belonging to Cusco Province and Department.  She has a spouse and two children.  She alternates her daily chores with running a beauty salon.  She does haircuts, hair coloring and hair waving.  She works from 9am until 7pm.  She is able to support her children with this business and she wants to expand and improve it.  She’s asking for a loan to buy supplies like rollers, scissors, hair dye and shampoo for the beauty salon.  She is happy with the loan and commits to make her payments.

loans.use: to buy supplies for her beauty salon.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is a farmer in Kitale, Western Kenya.  She is 39 years old, and married, with 5 children between 6 and 15 years old.  The first four children are already in school.  Mary has been in farming for 5 years and currently employs one farmhand. Her produce of milk, beans and maize is sold to the local market.

Mary has requested a loan of 41,600 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to purchase and insure a dairy cow. She says she will use the income to educate her children as well as boost her butchery business within the local market. She remains hopeful she will be able to add more dairy cows to her farm.

She appreciates Juhudi Kilimo loan services but points out that diseases remain a challenge.

loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Apollo

texts.en:
Apollo is 30 years old and lives in the Mbale region of Uganda. He is married and has one child. For the past four years, Apollo has been working hard to manage his stationery store, which sells office supplies and offers photocopying services. 

To help expand his business, Apollo has requested a loan of 2,500,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more stationery supplies, and will help Apollo to generate greater profits and improve the quality of life for his family. Apollo hopes that in the future he will be able to open another stationery business in town. 

Apollo is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Apollo who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more stationery supplies.

loans.name: Williams Aguistin

texts.es: Williams Agustín tiene 25 años, su actividad es brindar el servicio de taller de refrigeración desde hace mas de 2 años que tiene este negocio. La ubicación es en su vivienda donde asisten la mayoría de sus clientes él está ofreciendo un buen servicio y además los precios son accesibles. Inicio este negocio por su papa que lo apoyo para que William estudiara un técnico y se dedico a realizar este tipo de trabajos. El motivo del crédito es para la compra de dispensadores, vitrinas, condensadores, evaporadores entre otros.
texts.en:
Williams Agustín is 25.  He has had a refrigeration shop for more than two years. It is located in his home, and this where the majority of his customers come. He provides good service, and besides, his prices are affordable. 

He started this business with the help of his father, who supported William in his studies to become a refrigeration technician. Then he began doing this type of work.

The purpose of the loan is to buy ice dispensers, display cases, condensers, evaporators and other equipment.

loans.use: To buy ice dispensers, display cases, condensers, evaporators, and other equipment.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is a 44-year-old divorced woman. She has three children aged between 16 and 22. She describes herself as hardworking. 
Jane operates a clothes retail store. She has been involved in this business for four years. Her business is located in Nairobi central. Jane describes her biggest business challenge to be the low purchasing power of her customers. She will use her loan of 40,000 KES to buy more clothes for resale and to renovate her business stall. Her business goal is to run a boutique within five years.

loans.use: to renovate her store and add to her stock of clothes.

loans.name: Jeanne

texts.en: Jeanne is 41 years old and married with four children between the ages of 5 and 12. All of the children are in school. She sells cassava in a store she has run for 25 years. Jean would like a loan to buy more cassava and new products such as rice, sugar, sorghum, and cooking oil. Any profits will be used to create savings for her family. She hopes to diversify the items in her store in the future.

loans.use: to buy cassava, sugar, rice, and cooking oil for sale.

loans.name: Jesús

texts.es:
Jesús de 54 años, es una mujer buena y amable, es conviviente con su pareja con quien tiene un hijo que ya es mayor e independiente a quien educo y alimento como solo una madre de carácter como el de ella lo puede hacer, vive en su casa junto a su conviviente con quien comparte sus días entre trabajo y momentos de alegría juntos. El trabajo de Jesús consiste en la siembra y cosecha de diversos productos regionales, ella todas las semanas se va vía fluvial a través del río Ucayali a una comunidad muy alejada llamada Cunchuri, ahí es donde tiene una chacra y siembra plátano, maíz, frejol y otros productos que le permite plantar la buena tierra que posee, lleva realizando este trabajo por 10 años y recibe la ayuda de su conviviente.
Cuando empezó a hacer este trabajo le era un poco complicado ya que no tenía los conocimientos necesarios para poder ser una buena agricultora, pero en base a muchas capacitaciones y deseos de superarse pudo lograrlo y ahora su tierra le produce productos de buena calidad y muy solicitados en la ciudad, a parte de tener un buen ingreso también le gusta mucho poder estar entre la naturaleza y ver crecer a sus plantaciones, espera que le siga yendo todo bien y mas adelante poder sembrar en mayor cantidad. Este será el crédito numero 2 con MFP, por tanto espera de su colaboración para continuar con sus objetivos, por otro lado se compromete una vez mas a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas como en el crédito anterior que tuvo, además está muy contenta de pertenecer a su banco comunal ya que todos son responsables y muy solidarios. Con el monto solicitado 2000 soles, comprará semillas para poder sembrar en mayor cantidad, además de guardar algo para poder usar como gastos de movilidad cuando trae sus productos a la ciudad.
texts.en:
Jesús is a friendly 54-year-old woman. She lives with her common-law husband with whom she has a boy who is already grown up and independent.  She fed him and provided for his education as only a mother of good character like her can do.  She spends her days with her common-law husband, working together and sharing moments of joy.

Her work consists of planting and harvesting different types of regional produce.  Every week she travels via the river Ucayali to a community that is very far away called Cunchuri.  This is where she has a pond and plants bananas, corn, beans and other crops on the good land that she has.  She has been doing this work for ten years and receives help in this from her common-law husband.
When she started this work it was a little difficult for her since she did not have the knowledge necessary to become a good farmer.  However, with a lot of training and determination to improve her situation, she was able to learn the necessary skills, and now her land produces crops of good quality that are highly sought-after in the city.

Apart from having a good income, she enjoys very much being able to be out in nature and see her crops grow.  She hopes that everything keeps going well and that further down the road she will be able to plant a larger quantity.

This will be her second loan with MFP, and she hopes that their collaboration will continue to help her meet her objectives.  She has also promised to repay her loans as she did with the first loan.  Further, she is very happy to belong to her communal bank as all the members are very responsible, and they have a lot of solidarity.

With this loan she is seeking 2000 soles, with which she will buy seeds to enable her to plant greater quantities, and to save some of the money for travel expenses when she brings her crops to the city.

loans.use: to buy seeds to plant corn and beans.

loans.name: Aura Cecilia

texts.es: La señora Aura Cecilia trabaja como empleada doméstica realizando aseo y limpieza a casas de familia, debido a que en esta actividad recibe pocos ingresos, se vio en la necesidad de generar una nueva fuente de ingresos que le permita tener los recursos suficientes para su sostenimiento y el de su familia; es así como la señora Aura Cecilia desea comprar un carro para preparar comidas rápidas los fines de semana como hamburguesas y perros calientes. El sueño de la señora Aura Cecilia es mejorar su calidad de vida y poder suplir sus necesidades básicas.
texts.en: Aura Cecilia works as a housekeeper cleaning family homes.  Because this job doesn't earn her much money, she needed to come up with a new source of income so she would have enough income to support her family.  This is why Aura Cecilia wants to buy a car; to prepare fast foods, such as hamburgers and hot dogs, on the weekends.  Aura Cecilia's dream is to improve her quality of life and be able to meet her basic needs.

loans.use: to buy a car to prepare fast foods and to buy ingredients

loans.name: Mary Grace

texts.en:
Mary Grace is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a personal products selling business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 10 years. She earns more income from a sari-sari store.

She has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to buy more perfumes, body lotion, deodorant and other personal products to sell to customers. Mary Grace hopes to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more perfumes, body lotion and other personal products.

loans.name: Marifel

texts.en:
Marifel is 24 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has two children.
 
Marifel has a food shop or sari-sari store that sells canned goods, snacks and beverages. She has had this business for three years. 

She requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

Marifel has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Marifel hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

loans.name: Azarious

texts.en: Azarious is a married man living in Kasese, Uganda. His personal goals are to educate his children and to build a permanent house. He has been a farmer for the last thirty years, and his major hardships are price fluctuations, inflation, and inadequate capital to purchase equipment. However, he has a vision of diversifying his farm and expanding it to new areas. Azarious needs the requested loan to buy seeds for planting.

loans.use: to buy seeds for planting.

loans.name: Joy

texts.en: A 34 years old woman, married with 4 children lives in Benin City, Edo State, Nigeria. She learnt her business for 5 years before she started her business in the year 1992. According to her, the said amount $400 will boost her business if it comes to her.

loans.use: Purchase of more goods for sale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: She would like to pay part of the school fees for her children

loans.name: Identity

texts.en:
This entrepreneur is 29 years old and married with two children. One of them is in school. He has an electric materials shop in the Kirkuk market.

This is his first loan. He wants to get $1000 to buy electric materials from another city and bring them to Kirkuk. He is looking to develop his shop and bring more goods. He is working 10 hours per day without any rest. His brother works with him in the same shop, and he wants to hire two jobless people to work with him.

He said, "I was born into a poor family, and I'm not ready now to return to poverty. I will work and earn money."

Note: This entrepreneur is from a volatile region where the security situation remains unsettled. Personally identifiable attributes of this entrepreneur have been altered to protect him or her (i.e. blacking out portions of the entrepreneur in his/her picture, etc.).

loans.use: Buy electric materials

loans.name: Ana Leticia

texts.en:
Ana Leticia J., 19, who lived in San Felipe, has a tiny food and convenience store where she sells sugar, tamales, fruit, potatoes, and beans.
