texts.en: Phat, 66, resides in Kampong Chnang province, Cambodia, an area known for palm products. Phat produces traditional baskets, earning an income of $1 per day to help cover the family expenses. Each month, the family spends $100 on food and $30 on other necessary expenses. Phat is requesting a loan of $850 to purchase a motorbike for the family's use. This will be her third loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner.

loans.use: to buy a motorbike for the family's use

loans.name: Kotognogontala Iii Group

texts.fr:
Les sept membres du groupe KOTOGNOGONTALA III sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 37ans, 3 enfants et vivant la plupart dans des  familles polygames à  OUELENI FIEBALA, un des villages de la commune de KAI dans la sous préfecture  de LOULOUNI, 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur quatrième prêt avec l’institution, les prêts passés ont été bien remboursés.
La spéculation cultivée est : l’arachide  avec   AFOU 2ème à gauche position debout.
Avec son prêt, elle compte payer les frais de labour, acheter des intrants et la semence pour entretenir : 2hectares. 
La production est vendue au niveau du village, au marché de LOULOUNI et au marché de SIKASSO après la récolte à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 165.500FCFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
The seven members of the group KOTOGNOGONTALA III are married women who average 37 years of age and three children each. They live for the most part in polygamous families in OUELENI FIEBALA, a village in the Commune of KAI, in the sub-prefecture of LOULOUNI, Prefecture of Kadilo (3rd administrative region of the Republic of Mali). The women are collaborating with the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso to carry out their farm work during the off-season. The group members are on their fourth loan with the institution. The past loans have been properly repaid.

The crop grown is: peanuts.  Such is the case with AFOU, who is standing second from the left in the photo. With her loan, she intends to pay for plowing and to buy farm inputs and seeds for maintaining: 2 hectare. After the harvest, the produce is sold in villages, at the LOULOUNI market and the SIKASSO market, to a customer base composed of women and men.

AFOU plans on making an average profit of 165,500 francs CFA per planting. The profits will enable her to repay her loan and also to help her husband with day-to-day expenses.

loans.use: to pay for plowing, farm inputs, and seeds

loans.name: Mosharif

texts.ru: Мошариф жительница района Яван. Ей 44 года. Она замужем. У нее двое детей. Ее сын на заработках в России, а ее муж занимается растениеводством. Сама Мошариф при доме имеет участок земли, где выращивает овощи для продажи. Этим видом деятельности она занимается восемь лет. Кредит берет для повторного посева.
texts.en: Mosharif is a resident of the Yavan region. She is 44 years old. She is married and has two children. Her son is now working in Russia and her husband is in agriculture. Mosharif has a plot of land by her house where she grows vegetables for sale. She has been in this business for eight years. She is taking out the loan for the second sowing.

loans.use: to buy seeds for the second sowing

loans.name: Felicitas

texts.en:
Felecitas is 58 years old and widowed with six children who are all married now. She maintains a pig-raising business to make a living and support her family. She failed to send all her six children to school because of an inadequate source of income to support their schooling in high school and college. They just ended at the elementary level. Her husband was deceased early and then she was the only provider to survive life's challenges. 

She used to sell "malagkit' (native food snack made from glutinous rice) as a source of daily income for her family's immediate needs. She raises pigs to have extra income after four months of raising the livestock. She is asking for a loan of PHP 5,000 to repair her pigpen and to maintain the feed supply for the pigs she raises.

loans.use: to repair her pig pen and to buy feed

loans.name: Peris

texts.en:
Peris is a married woman with two children: one attends school while the other is still too young for school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family. 

Peris has operated a tailoring business for the past 10 years; her potential customers are neighbours and passersby. She faces the major challenge of seasonality in her business. Her big dream is to establish a dressmaking school in the future.

With the Kshs 60,000 she wants to purchase material and an overlocker. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase material and an overlocking machine.

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en:
Cecilia is 56 years old and a married woman with 3 children. She and her husband are both farmers. They manage a rice farm in the town of Sto. Niño, in the province of South Cotabato. Cecilia works hard to improve their business and send her children to school. She has also applied for a loan to fund the farm. She plans to purchase fertilizers and insecticides.

In the future, Cecilia hopes to have a stable business.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and insecticides

loans.name: Elisa

texts.en:
Elisa is 56 years old and is married with five children. Two of her children are in school. For the past ten years, Elisa has been raising pigs in the Philippines. She has borrowed nine previous NWTF loans to sustain  her business. 

Elisa is requesting a 25,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy pig feed and vitamins. In the future, Elisa would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy pig feed and vitamins

loans.name: Achieve Group

texts.en:
Lindiwe lives in Gweru, the Midlands Province of Zimbabwe. She is 28 years old, married and has a child aged 5 who is attending school. 

Lindiwe is a Crossborder trader and she sells clothes at a flea market. She has been in this business for 2 years. The challenges encountered in her business include strict border controls, high duties and increased competition.

She has requested a loan for $400 to buy ladies' clothes, jeans and shoes from South Africa to sell at her flea market in Gweru. With the additional income she will get, Lindiwe plans to buy a car. In the future, she would like to have her own shop.

loans.use: to buy shoes, ladies clothes and jeans for sale

loans.name: Misael

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “KANCHARY”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

El socio es el Sr. Misael; el tiene 27 años de edad y es soltero; El socio alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de confección de ternos y también tiene un negocio de internet, el socio trabaja desde las 7:00 a.m hasta las 9:00 p.m y el negocio de confección de ternos lo realiza en forma independiente, por medio de estos negocios el socio saca adelante a sus hijos, el socio quiere ampliar el negocio de internet y negocio de confección de ternos. El  socio solicita el préstamo para comprar materiales para confeccionar de ternos  como telas y tijeras y para el mantenimiento de sus computadoras.

 El socio está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Misael belongs to the "Kanchary" communal bank, located in Cusco district, which is part of the province and department of Cusco. 

Misael is 27, and single.  Along with his daily activities, he makes suits, and also has an internet business. He works from 7:00am to 9:00pm. He is carrying on the suit-making business on his own. By means of these businesses he is raising his children. He wants to expand his internet business, and his suit-making business. 

He is applying for a loan to buy materials for making suits such as fabric and scissors, and to pay for the maintenance of his computers. He is happy about receiving the loan, and promises to make his instalment payments.

loans.use: To buy materials for making suits, such as fabric and scissors; and to maintain his computers.

loans.name: C7854 Intwari Group

texts.en:
Domitrie is 26 years old and married with one child. She also takes care of three children. She is the president of a group which is called "INTWARI," which means in English "HERO." Domitrie is in the middle of the photo with a raised hand. She sells rice. This business is well organized. She works from 6 am until 6 pm every day except on the weekend. She has eight years of experience and she currently employs four people to help her. 

Domitrie and her team have requested a loan from Kiva lenders to buy more fertilizer for their field. With the resulting profit from their rice business, Domitrie and her team will be able to save for their future and pay their children's school fees.

loans.use: to buy more fertilizer for her rice field.

loans.name: Guadalupe

texts.en: Guadalupe is single, 58 years old, and lives in Panaon, Misamis Occidental. She manages her own garden to make a living to cover everyday needs. She has been in this business for almost a year. Each month, she earns PHP 10,000 doing this type of work. She requested a loan in the amount of PHP 15,000 to purchase more seedlings and fertilizers. Aside from that, a portion of the loan will be used for her personal needs. Guadalupe has been a member of GDMPC for almost a year. Guadalupe's future plan is to help her family and save the profit for her future.

loans.use: to purchase more seedlings and fertilizers

loans.name: Meyling Teresa

texts.es: Meyling Teresa tiene 34 años, ella se dedica a brindar sus servicios a una empresa privada, uno de sus mayores problemas ha sido el dejar a su hijo para trabajar pues tiene que dedicarle tiempo a su trabajo. El motivo del crédito es para la compra de materiales de construcción como zinc, clavos, pega, entre otros. Sueña con mejorar cada día su vivienda para que su hijo tenga  donde vivir el mañana.
texts.en:
Meyling Teresa is 34 years old and provides her services at a private company. One of her major problems is leaving her son when she has to go to work so that she can have time to devote to her job.  

The reason for this loan is so that Meyling will be able to buy construction materials such as zinc, nails, glue, and other items.  She dreams of improving her home each day so that her son will have a better place to live in the future.

loans.use: to buy zinc, nails, glue, and other items.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to have general maintenance work carried out on his motorbike

loans.name: Inès Juliette

texts.fr: Inès Juliette est âgée de 29 ans et vit au Bénin. Inès Juliette est mariée à un enseignant du nom de Martin. Le couple a deux enfants  tous scolarisés et à leur charge. En plus de leurs enfants, le couple a un autre enfant en charge. Les enfants vivent ensemble avec leurs parents. Le couple assure ensemble les diverses charges de la maison. Pour contribuer aux divers besoins de la famille, Inès Julienne exerce depuis six ans le métier de coiffure à son domicile. De façon secondaire, Inès Juliette vend des céréales et de divers articles (savons et charbons) par le système de distribution. Grâce aux revenus que lui génère ces activités, Inès Julienne contribue aux différentes dépenses de sa famille. Pour satisfaire aux besoins de sa clientèle de plus en plus grandissante, Inès Julienne sollicite pour une quatrième fois un crédit auprès de ALIDé. Les trois crédits reçus antérieurement par Inès Julienne ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en:
Inès Juliette is 29 years old and lives in Benin. Inès Juliette is married to a teacher named Martin. The couple has two educated, dependent children. In addition to their own children, the couple also cares for another child. The children live together with their parents. The couple covers the various household expenses together.

To contribute to the various needs of the family, Inès Juliette has been working as a hairdresser out of her own home for six years now. On the side, Inès Juliette sells cereal and various items (soap and coal) by the distribution system. Thanks to the revenue that she generates from this work, Inès Juliette contributes to the family's various expenses.

To meet the needs of her growing customer base, Inès Juliette is asking for a fourth loan through ALIDé. Her three previous loans were all paid back in full.

loans.use: to buy boxes of soap and bags of coal.

loans.name: Marlene

texts.en:
Marlene is 31 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has 6 children. 

Marlene has a retail shop where she makes & sells coconut charcoal by the sack. She has had this business for 8 years. She has requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy coconut shells needed for making coco charcoal.

Marlene is a new member of HSPFI. In the future, Marlene hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy coconut shell needed for making coco charcoal.

loans.name: Lucia

texts.es:
La Señora. Lucia es socia del banco comunal Mi Bankito, vive en la ciudad de Cuenca, esta ciudad es conocida por la belleza de su centro histórico el cual cuenta el pasado de esta bella ciudad, es bañada por 4 ríos los que le dan el nombre de la Santa Ana de los 4 ríos, su gente es amable y mantienen la cultura y tradiciones de sus pueblos.

Doña Lucia tiene 53 años, es madre soltera  un hijo quien es mayor de edad, soltero trabaja y le ayuda  económicamente. La casa en la que vive es de su propiedad.
 
La Señora. Lucia se dedica al negocio de ganado, esta actividad la realiza hace varios años,  también cría otros animales como son cerdos, pollos y cuyes.
 
Se encuentra en su tercer crédito que realiza en el banco comunal y lo va a invertir en la compra de cuyes, pollos y cerdos para así crecer más en esta actividad. 
 
Su meta es tener un criadero más grande de animales.
texts.en:
Sra. Lucia is a member of the Communal Bank “Mi Bankito” (My Little Bank). She lives in the city of Cuenca, which is known for the beauty of its historical center. The city is surrounded by four rivers, thus giving it the nickname “Santa Ana of the Four Rivers”. The people are friendly and have maintained the culture and traditions of their ancestors.

Doña Lucia is 53 years old and a single mother with a grown son. He works alone and helps out financially. Lucia owns the home in which she lives.

She has a business selling cattle, which she has done for many years. Lucia also raises other animals such as pigs, chickens, and guinea pigs. She is receiving her third loan from the Communal Bank and will invest in the purchase of guinea pigs, chickens, and pigs so that she can grow this part of her business even more.

Her goal is to have a large farm full of animals.

loans.use: to buy guinea pigs, chickens, and pigs.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy more chicks and chicken feed.

loans.name: Sorphorn

texts.en:
Sorphorn, 31, is married and resides with her husband and two children in Takeo Province, Cambodia. She has been working in a garment factory for over three years. Her husband has been running a business buying junk materials to sell for over six years and is successful in his career. 

In order to improve her family's living conditions, Sorphorn is requesting a loan of USD 400 to purchase a motorbike for her husband to use to carry junk materials to sell at the junk shop. With a motorcycle, her husband would be able to carry junk materials in larger amounts to sell and generate more profit to support the family. In the future, Sorphorn would like to run a junk shop at home, build a new house, and support her children to study until they get a Bachelor's degree.

loans.use: to purchase a motorbike for her husband to use to carry junk materials to sell at the junk shop.

loans.name: Saidu

texts.en: This is 41-year-old Saidu. He is married, and has three children aged 12, 7, and 4 years. Two are school-going children. He has two additional dependents who live with him to be fostered. Saidu owns a business. He works 7 days a week and 10 hours a day, and he earns about Le 1,500,000 every month from this business. He would like a loan in the amount of Le 5,000,000. Saidu has already received and successfully repaid one loan, and now requires a new loan in order to buy dozens of jeans, shirts, school bags, and skirts. He has almost completed his building and the business is also improving greatly. He is also planning to rent a shop and educate his children. He is ambitious and determined.  He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy dozens of jeans, shirts, school bags, and skirts.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en: Mrs. Josephine U. is 45 years old, with eight (8)children. She has been learning the sale of foodstuff for the past 5 years. She wishes that the above amount would come to her for business expansion.

loans.use: To buy more food items to sell

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en: Cecilia is a hairdresser but has no salon where she can work. She also has no dryers to work with, therefore she is unable to work even though she has the zeal to work. She is seriously in need. She is seeking a loan of $1100.00 from Kiva to enable her to open a salon and buy dryers for her work.

loans.use: working capital

loans.name: Mercedes Araceli

texts.en:
Mercedes is 22, is married and has one child. Previously she raised pigs for a living but her pregnancy was very risky and she had to sell her five animals. Her husband works in a factory in San Cristobal as a night-guard, and so she and her son stay at home by themselves all night. And so, she hopes that raising pigs will develop into a good business and will allow she and her husband to work together. Her goal is to have between 18 and 20 pigs . Mercedes is a member of the group De P. 2.

Translated from Spanish by Kiva Volunteer, Kristin Connor.

MERCEDES TIENE 22 AÑOS, CASADA, TIENE UN HIJO, ANTERIORMENTE SE DEDICABA A LA CRIA DE PUERQUITOS, PERO SU EMBARAZO FUE MUY RIESGOSO Y ELLA TUVO QUE VENDER SUS CINCO ANIMALITOS. SU ESPOSO TRABAJA EN UNA EMPRESA EN SAN CRISTOBAL COMO CUIDADOR NOCTURNO POR LO QUE ELLA Y SU HIJO PERMANECEN SOLOS TODAS LAS NOCHES. ES POR ESO QUE CON LA CRIANZA DE LOS PUERCOS ESPERAN DESARROLLAR UN BUEN NEGOCIO QUE LES PERMITA ESTAR JUNTOS, SU META ES LLEGAR A TENER DE 18 A 20 PUERCOS. MERCEDES PERTENECE AL GRUPO DE P. 2.

loans.use: Raising pigs.

loans.name: Angelina

texts.en:
Angelina C. R., 52, owns and operates a shoe store called "Zapatería Dama Ris". She has been in the shoe business for 33 years. Currently she specializes in traditional sandals. She has been separated from her husband for many years and has three children.

Angelina will use her loan to purchase inventory for her store. Before using loans from Friendship Bridge, she sometimes accessed credit from a bank, but the interest rate was much too high. Now with interest at a more reasonable level she can net a bit more profit to ensure that her youngest child, a 12-year-old, can continue with a full education.

Written by Nancy Lewis, Kiva Fellow

loans.use: Purchase shoe inventory for the store

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase tailoring cloth materials

loans.name: Uliya

texts.en:
Uliya has a small business selling a colorful variety of delicious candies and sweets from a little stand at the Central market in Ordzhonikidze, Ukraine. In business for four years, Uliya has developed a profitable venture selling products that are always in good demand and that keep her sales rate high. Uliya is married and has two children. With monthly earnings of around $400, Uliya’s business is a valuable source of income for her family.

Uliya has requested a loan of $600 to help her purchase a new supply of candy and sweets. Using credit helps her increase profits by allowing her to purchase additional inventory to keep up with a rapid turnover rate. We are grateful for this new opportunity to support Uliya as she works to provide for her family.

loans.use: Purchase inventory

loans.name: Ena

texts.es:
Ena Rosa is a 52-year-old widow who currently lives alone now that all of her children have left home to settle down in different cities with families of their own. She is proud that her children have stayed out of trouble using good sense and use all the lessons and values she taught each of them while they lived with her. For a long time, she has dedicated her self to the art of textile and making suits, linens, costumes, etc. Losing her husband was very painful for her and she had to find refuge and solace in this work and used it to provide for herself. Because of her skill in the textile field, she works in a very well-known store in the area, but this results in neglect of her house. She has opened her own textile shop in her sister’s house and is using this opportunity to its fullest potential since she already has good clientele. For her, the only way to live without worries is working and for this reason she hopes to establish her own textile company and for this she needs an investment which will allow her to buy the necessary tools to start up her project. Let’s help this strong, talented mother continue working to progress.

Translated from Spanish by Sofia, Princeton University Language Project volunteer.

Ena Rosa de 52 años de edad es viuda, en la actualidad vive sola ya que todos sus hijos dejaron el seno de su hogar para establecerse en diferentes ciudades con sus propias familias y el más grande orgullo para ella es saber que sus hijos se desempeñan con mucha cordura y ponen en práctica cada uno de las enseñanzas y valores que ha inculcado en cada uno de ellos durante su permanencia en casa.Desde hace mucho tiempo se dedicaba al arte textil y a la confección de trajes, lencerías, disfraces, etc. Para ella fue muy doloroso perder a su esposo y tuvo que encontrar refugio y consuelo en esta ocupación a fin de sustentar sus necesidades con satisfacción. Gracias a su destreza y habilidades en este campo textil trabajó en una tienda muy conocida en la zona, pero eso causaba el descuido de su vivienda, ahora abrió su propia textilería en casa de su hermana y esta aprovechando al máximo esta oportunidad ya que tiene una buena clientela.Para ella la única forma de vivir tranquila sin preocupaciones es trabajando y por esa razón anhela establecer su propia empresa textil y para ello necesita de un capital de dinero que le permita adquirir las herramientas necesarias para poner en marcha su proyecto.Apoyemos a esta madre que con talento y esfuerzo sigue trabajando arduamente para progresar.

loans.use: Purchase of materials for manufacture (Lace, cloth, buttons, clasps, etc)

loans.name: Thi Thuynh

texts.vi:
Ms Thuynh is 50 years old, she has 2 children who are working. She makes and sells all kind of cakes: "bánh chưng" square glutinous rice cake filled with green bean paste and fat pork, "bánh tẻ" rice cake filled with browned onion, "bánh bao" bbq bun ...etc. She needs capital to buy the ingredients to make these cakes. She also cultivates and raises pigs. This is the first time that she applies for a loan. She has chosen Binh Minh fund (SEDA) because she feels comfortable about the weekly payment arrangement.

Translated from Vietnamese by Khang Ho-Si, Kiva volunteer.

Cô Thuynh năm nay 50 tuổi, có hai con đều đã đi làm. Cô mong muốn vay vốn để mua nguyên liệu làm các loại bánh như bánh tẻ, bánh chưng..., bao gồm: gạo, đỗ , thịt, mộc nhĩ, hành... Ngoài công việc làm bánh, cô còn trồng lúa, rau củ quả các loại và chăn nuôi lợn. Đây là lần đầu tiên cô vay vốn, và cô lựa chọn chương trình tài chính vi mô Binh Minh cdc vì thích hình thức trả góp hàng tuần.

loans.use: To buy ingredients to make cakes

loans.name: Solo Fa Group

texts.en:
The leader of this small group is Betty Eitoto. She owns a salon and is requesting a loan to buy more salon equipment. Betty is 22 years old and is single. She has one child aged 7 who goes to school. Each week, Betty makes approximately UGX 50000 in profits and with the extra profits from her loan she hopes to be able to pay house rent and pay school fees for her daughter. Betty has taken a loan from BRAC Uganda before in the amount of UGX 200000 in order to invest in her business and the loan was paid back on time.

Betty is joined in her group by Sharon A. and Lumala A.. Sharon A. sells fresh fruits and wants to expand her business. Lumala A. sells new shoes and wants a loan to add to her stock.

loans.use: To expand salon business.

loans.name: Thai Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs Thái Thị Hạ is 47, she lives in Hưng Nguyên, Nghệ An. She is a 4th year member of TYM. She has 8 children, 2 of them are attending vocational education. Like most other villagers she raises pigs and cows to increase her income. Every time she sells a pig, she uses the money to buy basic things for her house. 2 of her children are working and they really help her with the weekly payments of the loan. Mrs Hạ wishes to remain a TYM member for a long time even after her children become adults. This time she requests a loan of 450 USD.

Translated from Vietnamese by Khang Ho-Si, Kiva volunteer.

Chị Thái Thị Hạ, 47 tuổi, sống tại Hưng Nguyên, Nghệ An là thành viên năm thứ 4 của Quỹ Tình thương. Trong 8 người con của chị có 2 người còn đang học phổ thông. Cũng như phần lớn các gia đình nông dân trong thôn chị Hạ chăn nuôi lợn và bò để tăng thêm thu nhập. Mỗi lần bán lợn chị Hạ lại có một món tiền mua sắm thêm vật dụng trong nhà. 2 trong số những người con lớn đã đi làm là nguồn hỗ trợ đắc lực cho mẹ trong việc trả tiền tuần. Chị Hạ mong muốn được tiếp tục vay vốn để phát triển kinh tế ngay cả khi các con đã trưởng thành. Mức vốn đề nghị của chị vòng này là 450USD

loans.use: Buy pigs

loans.name: Moises

texts.es:
Moisés is 49 years old and his wife, Luisa, is 45. They are the parents of two school aged children.

Moisés started out as a builder working for five years in the hydroelectric plant in Itaipú. Later he worked for three more years in the country’s other hydroelectric plant called Yacyreta.

After that he returned to his hometown to establish his life there and to work. He invested some of his savings to open a butcher shop where he worked for three years but then had to close it due to health reasons.

Moisés later purchased a van that he now uses to transport schoolchildren. His wife, a retired teacher, stays home to take care of their children. Even though he got sick, his entrepreneurial spirit has helped him maintain a lucrative, independent job.

This loan will be used to repair his van that he needs for work in order to provide for his family.

Translated from Spanish by Hugh Yarbrough, Kiva Volunteer.

El señor Moisés tiene 49 años de edad, y su esposa la señora Luisa 45y son padres de dos hijos que aún están en edad escolar. Moisés se inició como constructor, trabajando en la Hidroeléctrica de Itaipú durante 5 años, luego trabajo en la otra Hidroeléctrica del país llamada Yacyreta en donde trabajo otros tres años más. Luego de ello, volvió a su ciudad natal para establecerse y trabajar. Primeramente invirtió unos ahorros y abrió una carnicería en la que trabajo durante tres años, la cual tuvo que cerrar por motivos de salud. Actualmente su esposa es docente jubilada y por ahora se queda en la casa a cuidar de sus hijos, mientras que su marido compró un vehículo que lo utiliza de trasporte escolar, a pesar de haberse enfermado, su espíritu emprendedor no se apago por lo que mantiene un trabajo independiente y lucrativo.

El préstamo lo utilizará para reparar su vehículo que es su medio de trabajo y el que constituye el ingreso de la familia.

loans.use: Repair a van used for work.

loans.name: Amra

texts.en: Amra is 25 years old and she is married. She is from Đurđevik, a small suburb of the town of Živinice. Her husband works in a coal-mine and his monthly salary is 600 KM (about US$ 480).  This is her second loan at MCO WWI and Amra will use it to start up a chicken-fattening business  and to buy thread for crochet in order to fill her free time and at the same time generate additional income for her family  by selling chickens and eggs.

loans.use: To buy chickens and crochet thread

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary A.'s determination is evident as she uses one grinding machine to care for herself and to support her husband and her home. She is 56 years old, and she has seven children. She grinds peppers, tomatoes and beans. Mary needs a loan of $350 to buy another grinding machine so that she can meet the increasing demands of her numerous customers. She thanks you.

loans.use: To buy one grinding machine

loans.name: Trinh Thi

texts.vi:
Ms. B. is 27 years old. Even though she is young, Ms. B. is accustomed to doing business for a period of time. As of today she has a family with 2 small children. Ms. B. has been a member since 2003. Her first loan was 1.000.000, in which she had invested into the chicken business to help her financially. After 5 years, the used of her initial loan and business experiences, had expanded her business from the initial investment to 60-70.000.000d to operate. As the business is growing every day, the money that is needed to run the business has also risen. She hopes to borrow 19.000.000d to invest into her business, buying more livestock to cater to the locals in her community. Her income is 8.000.000d/month.

Translated from Vietnamese by Lynn Nguyen, Kiva Volunteer.

Chị Bắc năm nay 27 tuổi. Tuy còn trẻ nhưng chị Bắc đã làm quen với công việc kinh doanh được một thời gian dài. Hiện nay gia đình chị có 2 con còn nhỏ. Chị tham gia vào Quỹ Tình thương năm 2003. Vòng vốn đầu chị vay 1.000.000 đ để đầu tư thêm vào công việc kinh doanh gà giống của gia đình cho thu nhập ổn định. Đến nay qua 5 năm sử dụng vốn với kinh nghiệm nhiều năm buôn bán con giống hiện nay mô hình kinh doanh của gia đình chị đã phát triển mạnh với số vốn đầu tư lên đến 60 đến 70 triệu đồng. Với mô hình kinh doanh ngày càng phát triển vì thế nhu cầu vầ vốn ngày càng tăng cao. Để đầu tư thêm vốn cho công việc kinh doanh chị mong muốn được vay 19.000.000đ để mua thêm các loại con giống phục vụ nhu cầu của người dân địa phương. Thu nhập bình quân 8.000.000đ/ tháng

loans.use: Business

loans.name: Francis

texts.en: Francis M., a businessman who owns a butchery in the Kigamboni area,  purchases his meat wholesale and then retails his products to food venders, cafés and households. Although the business is only three years old, demand now exceeds Francis’ ability to supply, so he is requesting a loan of $550 to expand the operation. This expansion will also enhance the living conditions of his family, as Francis is their sole provider.

loans.use: To expand his business

loans.name: Suon

texts.en:
Suon U., 56, is married and lives in Kampong Cham, Cambodia. She works as a rice farmer and makes $1.50 per day. Her husband is a palm tree climber, collecting palm juice. Every morning he goes to collect the palm juice and boil it into palm sugar to earn approximately $2.50 profit per day. Mrs. Suon lives with two of her nine children, and normally she is aided by two of her children who work as garment workers. Mrs. Suon would like a loan from Kiva via Credit, a local partner, of $800 to purchase fertilizer, insecticide, and rice seed to grow for the next season. The price of rice is good in the market so if she can collect more profit, her family’s standard of living will improve.

CREDIT MFI is an independent Cambodian faith-based organization. It aims to empower the economically active poor and small entrepreneurs by providing inclusive financial services.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer, insecticide, and rice seed to grow for the next season

loans.name: Kong

texts.en: Mrs. Kong N. is a villager in Khvet Village in Kampong Chhnang Province. She is 23 years old and the mother of two children who are too young to work or attend school because they are aged two and four. She is a vegetable seller and would like to expand her business as it is doing well. Thus, she is requesting a loan to buy more vegetables to re-sell to her customers. Her husband, Mr. Chhin Boren, is a motorbike taxi driver who makes a modest income to help support their family. Her husband is pictured on the right in the photo.

loans.use: To buy more vegetable to re-sell to her customers.

loans.name: Parveen's Group

texts.en:
Parveen baji, the wife of M. A., lives in Chichawatni, Pakistan. She owns a two-room brick house where she has been living for the past 15 years. She completed her education through the 5th standard grade. She is the mother of two sons. Her eldest son sells fruits and vegetables. Her younger son has a juice corner. 

Parveen baji’s husband has a livestock business. He raises cattle and sells them in the market. Parveen baji is a housewife who prefers to do household work and take care of her family. 

Parveen baji successfully repaid her first loan from Asasah, a microfinance institute in Pakistan. Now she is applying for a loan to buy cattle (sheep and goats) to resell. 

She is joined in her loan group by four more members. Zahida baji wants a loan to buy material (lentils, cooking oil and spices) for her food business. Qubra baji wants a loan to buy seasonal fruits for her fruit-selling business. Zakia baji wants a loan to buy groceries for her grocery shop. Nasira baji wants a loan to buy wood to resell.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

Note: Baji, which means 'older sister,' is a term of respect for women in Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy cattle to resell

loans.name: Botir

texts.en:
S. Botir is 41 years old.  He is married and, together with his wife, has 5 children.  Botir has the specialty of engineering.  However, for several years now he has been selling clothing together with his wife, who is pictured in the photo.  They are selling socks for men and children, and also national women's slippers in the central local market.  

The income from the business Botir is spending on educating his children as he and his wife are dreaming that their children shall have higher education. 

Botir has been provided with the loans by IMON already in the past 2 years.  For this entire period of time, he has shown himself to be an accurate client.  Today, he requests 2600 Somoni ($775 USD) for purchasing new goods for selling.  Botir promises to repay the loan in 12 months and sincerely thanks all for supporting him.

loans.use: Purchasing of new goods for selling in order to increase the range of goods.

loans.name: Bakilaleb

texts.fr:
Monsieur K. est un jeune homme de 23 ans qui a un petit magasin ou il vend des produits d’alimentation générale.  Actuellement, son stock est baissé et il a besoin de le reconstituer pour les fêtes de la fin d’année.  Il sollicite ce premier crédit pour acheter 4 sacs de riz, 2 bidons d’huile, et 9 cartons d’eau Voltic.  Avec ces nouveaux produits il peut mieux servir ses clients et gagner un profit.
Monsieur K. est né à Lomé, la capitale du Togo ou il a commencé ce commerce depuis 2007.  Il est marié avec une revendeuse, et ils ont un enfant.
texts.en:
Mr. K. is a young man, aged 23, who has a small store where he sells general food products. Currently, his stock is low and he needs to reconstitute it for the festivals at the end of the year. He is asking for this first loan to buy 4 bags of rice, 2 cans of oil, and 9 cartons of Voltic water. With these new products, he can better serve his clients and earn a profit. Mr. K. was born in Lomé, the capital of Togo, where he began his business in 2007. He is married to a retailer, and they have one child.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy general food products

loans.name: Le Thi

texts.vi: Chị Lê Thị Viên, 45 tuổi, gia đình chị có 3 con và đã lớn. Năm 2005 chị tham gia Quỹ tình thương và vay vốn để đầu tư vào chăn nuôi và bán hàng ăn sáng. Hiện tại ngoài thu nhập từ buôn bán, chăn nuôi gia đình chị còn có thêm nguồn thu từ lương làm công an của chồng và con trai đã đi làm nên kinh tế rất ổn định.  Vòng vốn tới chị muốn vay 9000.000 để phát triển kinh tế gia đình.
texts.en:
Mrs. Le Thi V., 45 years old, has three grown-up children. In 2005, she joined TYM Fund (Kiva Partner in Vietnam) and borrowed funds to invest in animal breeding and her breakfast store. Currently, besides her store and farm, her family source of income also comes from wages of her husband, who is a police officer, and her oldest son. Thus, Mrs. V.'s family finance has become more stable. This time she would like to borrow 9,000,000 VND (or 525 USD) to improve her family income.

Translated from Vietnamese by Phuong Nguyen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Raising

loans.name: Séraphine

texts.fr:
La signification d’ALIDé en langue locale du Bénin, le Fon, est « un chemin existe toujours pour les plus pauvres ». Le Bénin est un petit pays de l’Afrique d’Ouest à coté du Nigeria où le PIB par habitant est à $1,500. ALIDé offre les prêts spéciaux a 0% d’intérêt aux gens très vulnérables et il est dans un groupe qui lancent bientôt un programme de la microassurance santé. 
 
C. Séraphine s’est marie avec BOTIN Prosper et ils ont quatre enfants qui s’appellent Ken, Morelle, Junior, et Adjoui. Tous sont scolarises. Elle vend la nourriture comme le riz, et le macaroni depuis 10 ans. Séraphine s’approvisionne a Dantokpa, le marche central en Afrique d’Ouest, et ses derniers crédits l’ont aidés dans les frais du foyer. Dans l’avenir, elle voudrait commencer par vendre les boissons fraiches.
texts.en:
The meaning of Alidé in the local Fon language of Benin is, "there is always a path for the poorest of people." Benin is a small country in Western Africa, bordering with Nigeria, where GDP per capita is $1,500. Alidé (Kiva Field Partner) offers special loans with 0% interest to highly vulnerable people, and belongs to a group that is soon to launch a micro health insurance program. Séraphine C. is married to Prosper Botin and they have four children called Ken, Morelle, Junior and Adjoui, all of whom have attended school. Séraphine has sold food such as rice and macaroni for ten years. She stocks up at Western Africa’s central market, Dantokpa. Her previous loans have helped her out with household expenses. In the future she would like to start selling cold drinks.

Translated from French by Alison Dent, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy rice, macaroni and drinks

loans.name: Hannah

texts.en:
Hannah K. is forty–one years old. She is married with three children- two boys and a girl. One child is currently in junior high school, the other two are in primary school. Hannah’s husband is a pastor at a church in their community. She lives with her family in a rented apartment in a town called Dormaa Ahenkro in the Brong Ahafo region of Ghana. Dormaa is an agricultural dominated town. It is about forty – five minutes drive from Sunyani, the regional capital. 

Hannah trades crates of eggs to make some income to support her husband financially.  She procures eggs from poultry farms in her community. Hannah sells at the local market square and also treks to other markets to do business. Besides the egg business, Hannah also deals in ready-made textiles.  She has been in business for nine years. She wants a loan to increase her working capital to procure more goods. She hopes to help her husband improve upon their standard of living and give all their children the best education they can afford.

loans.use: To procure more goods

loans.name: Leolinda

texts.en:
Leolinda is a resident of Sulipat Calamba, Misamis Occidental. She is 45 years old, married and blessed with seven children. Two of her children are in school and one is already married. Her husband works in farming and she operates a small Sari-Sari Store at their residence. She started her business with some small capital. 

She heard from a friend about Paglaum; she was convinced to join and immediately applied for membership. She was recognized last Aug. 27, 2008, and used the credit services for additional capital of her existing Sari-Sari Store. She is applying for Php 5,000 to purchase additional inventories such as canned goods and bottled items.


She is thankful that Paglaum became her financing partner. She added that it is a big help for the family to have additional capital for the business. For now Mrs. F. continues doing her daily activities and struggling against poverty. She hopes that someday her business will expand for her family.

loans.use: To purchase additonal grocery items for Sari-Sari Store

loans.name: Alaimalo

texts.en: Alaimalo S., 48, is married with four children.  She has three years of experience in the plantation business.  She sells to the village people and general public, two days per week.  She has no previous loans with SPBD.  She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 400 Tala (~140 USD).  SPBD loans are Alaimalo’s only access to capital because she has never been able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks.  She will use her loan to buy tools and other items for her business.

loans.use: To purchase a shovel, rake, bush knife and chemicals to kill insects

loans.name: Epifania

texts.es: Epifania tiene 41 años, vive con su esposo y sus hijos en la casa que con mucho esfuerzo construyó en el distrito D. Ventanilla. Se dedica a la venta D. verduras en el mercado 12 D. mayo, uno D. los más concurridos D. la Zona D. Mi Perú, que es como se llama su localidad. Epifania se ha dedicado a este negocio durante ya 15 años, tiempo en el cual ha ganado experiencia para desarrollar con mucha eficiencia su trabajo, ya que lo que más le gusta es la interacción con la gente, siendo una persona muy amable con el trato al cliente. Trabajar desD. las 7 D. la mañana hasta las 6 D. la tarD. le resulta muy cansado, en épocas D. verano el calor es insoportable y en épocas D. invierno el frió no la deja desempeñarse como quisiera, felizmente ha sabido lidiar con estos contratiempos, siendo una mujer muy fuerte y empeñosa, ahora quiere expandir su puesto, comprando mayor cantidad D. vegetales y adecuarlo para hacerlo más atractivo a la vista D. sus clientes. Epifanía es una cliente antigua y muy fiel a Microfinanzas PRISMA, siendo este su primer préstamo individual, ya que estuvo antes en bancos comunales. Con el dinero que solicita quiere abastecer su puesto D. mayor cantidad D. verduras, también contratará a un albañil para que arregle su puesto para se pueda ver mucho mejor y estar más cómoda cuando venda.
texts.en:
Epifania is 41 years old and lives with her husband and children in the house that, with a great deal of effort, she built in the district of Ventanilla. She sells vegetables in the May 12 market, which is one of the busiest in the zone of Mi Perú, where she lives. Epifania has been working in this business for 15 years, during which time she has gained a lot of experience with which she can conduct her work with a lot of efficiency. What she likes most about her work is the interaction she has with people, because she is very kind in her dealings with her clients. Because she works from 7 in the morning until 6 in the evening, she gets very tired. In the summer, the heat is unbearable and in the winter, the cold doesn’t allow her to conduct her business as she would like to. Happily, she has learned to fight against these setbacks, because she is a very strong and hard-working woman. Now she wants to expand her stand, by buying more vegetables and renovate it to make it more attractive to her clients. Epifania is an old and very faithful client of Microfinanzas PRISMA, and this is her first individual loan, since before, she was involved in community banks. With the money that she requests, she wants to supply her stand with more vegetables. She will also hire a builder so that she can fix her stand so that it will look better and so that she will be more comfortable when she sells.

Translated from Spanish by Avni Shah, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase her merchandise

loans.name: Lucila Konturnina

texts.es:
La señora Lucila  es socia del Banco Comunal “Aswancaris II” en la  provincia de Azangaro, departamento de Puno, tiene 39 años de edad, es conviviente con 03 hijos a su cargo, vive en el Jr. Leoncio Prado  Nº 465 Barrio Vilca Apaza.

Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela R. casi 03 años, la actividad a la que se dedica es la compra y venta de abarrotes, su primer préstamo fue de S/ 500.00 nuevos soles.

Actualmente ella desea un préstamo de S/ 2500.00 nuevos soles, el mismo que pagara en 06 cuotas; el préstamo le servirá para poder adquirir mas productos y aumentar su negocio, y le gustaría poner una tienda grande bien surtida.

A ella le gusta mucho el cumplimiento de las socias y los ahorros y las charlas que les da Manuela R..
texts.en:
Lucila is a member of the “Aswancaris II” Communal Bank in Azangaro province, department of Puno. She is 39 years old, and lives at Nº 465 Leoncio Prado St. in the Vilca Apaza neighborhood with her 3 children. Lucila has worked with the Manuela R. organization for almost 3 years. She makes a living buying and selling groceries. Her first loan from Manuela R. was for 500.00 soles. Lucila is currently seeking a loan of 2500.00 soles, which she will repay in 6 installments. She will use the loan to purchase more products and increase her business. She would like to have a large, well-stocked store. Lucila really likes the Manuela R. organization because of the financial success of its members, the savings, and the lectures that it provides.

Translated from Spanish by Christopher Knutson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing rice, sugar, canned foods, soft drinks, eggs, and milk.

loans.name: Analyn

texts.en:
Analyn D. is from the village of Senor, Sinacaban, Misamis Occidental. She is 30 years old. Analyn is married and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Analyn owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from planting & selling crops for sale such as corn, cassava, banana, etc. Analyn has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 1,500.00 Philippine Pesos (about US $32) a month for these activities.

In 2005, Analyn joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Analyn has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000.00 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase fertilizers such as manure. Analyn is requesting a new loan of 2,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional seeds, seedlings & young crops to raise. This loan will be the 7th loan taken out by Analyn from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: For seeds and seedlings

loans.name: Rocio Del Pilar

texts.es:
Roció es socia del Bancomunal Mujeres Progresando.
Roció es casada tienen 34 años, tiene 3 hijos de 14, 11 y 4 años, que están estudiando en la escuela estatal. 
Roció estudio educación inicial, pero no lo ejerció y  por que el negocio daba mas dinero y se caso aprendió hacer tamales con su tía, todos sus familiares se dedican hacer tamales, ella vende reparte  tamales  a restaurantes sábado y domingo   semanal hace 3000 tamales.
Desde que Roció esta en Finca aprendió ahorrar y ha podido ampliar su negocio, aprendió a organizarse.
Roció necesita un préstamo de  1000 soles para la compra de tamales, maíz, hoja de plátano, canastas de paja, para salir a vender.
El sueño de Roció es tener un restaurante grande de comida.
texts.en:
Roció is a member of the Mujeres Progresando Community Bank. Rosa is 34 and married. She has three children ages 14, 11, and 4; they attend a state school. She studied early education. She did not work in that field because her business gave her more money. She got married and learned to make tamales from her aunt. All of her family members make tamales. She sells and delivers tamales to restaurants on Saturdays and Sundays. She makes 3,000 tamales a week. Since Roció has been in Finca she has learned to save. She has been able to expand her business, and she learned how to be organized. Roció needs a loan of 1,000 PEN to buy tamales, corn, banana leaves, and straw baskets for when she goes out to sell. Roció’s dream is to have a large restaurant.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy tamales, corn, and banana leaves

loans.name: Sles

texts.en: Sles S. is 33 years old and the mother of three children who are single. One of them earns about $2 a day as a fish currying worker. Sles S. and her husband have used the river for fishing since their kids were very young. Recently, some of family’s fishing equipment has cracked, affecting their ability to fish effectively and frequently. Therefore, Sles S. has decided to seek a loan to buy new fishing equipment to replace the old broken ones.

loans.use: To buy fishing tools

loans.name: Marivic

texts.en:
Marivic B. is from the village of Calaca-an. She is 50 years old. Marivic is married and has two adult children. To make a living, Marivic owns & operates a business providing power-sawing services to local community members. Marivic has been engaged in her business for over 35 years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2002, Marivic joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Marivic has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase materials needed to provide service. Marivic is requesting a new loan of 10000 PHP, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the 13th loan taken out by Marivic from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

In the photo, Marivic is shown supervising one of her workers operating a power-saw. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To expand the business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase additional stock in bulk for her soda shop

loans.name: Marianita

texts.en:
Mrs. Marianita S., 28 years of age, is married and is a resident of P5 Sumirap, Tangub City. She has been an active Barangay (district) Health Worker for almost ten years in that community. She is blessed with three children who are all now in school. Her husband is a motorcycle driver and sometimes does some labor/masonry work in construction.

Presently, Marianita is engaged in sari-sari (general) store business with an average net income of not less than P3,000 a month. Another source of income comes from her honorarium and amounts to P3,000 a month.

Marianita joined Paglaum MPC in July 2009 because she is very interested in our products and services, especially in our savings and education programs. As a new member in our cooperative, she is given the privilege to apply for her first loan loan of P5,000. She hopes that someday her business will become a mini-grocery store and she will be able to send her children to a better school.

loans.use: To use as additional capital for her sari-sari store

location.town: Tangub-P5 Sumirap, Tangub City, Mis. Occ.

loans.name: Odile

texts.fr: K. Odile Réside dans la commune d'Adjarra. Odile  n’a pas encore d’enfant. Odile est coiffeuse de formation. Pour équiper son salon de matériels nécessaire pour la coiffure, Odile a besoin de moyens financiers. Alors pour satisfaire les exigences de sa clientèle, Odile sollicite l’appui financier d’ALIDé.
texts.en:
Odile K. lives in the village of Adjarra. Odile has no children yet. Odile is a trained hair stylist. In order to send better equip her salon with the necessary hair styling tools, Odile requires financial support. Odile requests financial support from Alide (Kiva Field Partner) so that she will be able to meet her clients' demands.


Translated from French by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase a hair dryer and hair styling products.

loans.name: God Mercy Group

texts.en:
'God Mercy' is a group of 5 borrowers led by David G., 43 years old, married with 5 children aged 6-23 years old. Their educational levels are 4th grade-12th grade. He also cares for a sibling.

David is a college drop-out due to poverty. He decided to sell used clothing in the Waterside market, downtown Monrovia, Liberia. He has been running this business for 20 years. He started with Ld$1,000 but with hard work and good management, he has come this far.

David always sells his customers good products and treats them well to encourage them to always patronize his business. David dreams of growing his business to a higher level so that he will be able to order goods from containers from abroad and become successful so that he can educate his children and have access to health facilities.

He needs this loan to purchase more goods in order to promote his business.

loans.use: to purchase more goods in order to promote his business

loans.name: Sandra

texts.en:
Sandra is 31 years old and happily married with five children. She lives in Benin City, Edo State, Nigeria.

Sandra sells foodstuffs like garri (roasted cassava), beans, rice and dried fish and has been in this business for 5 years. She hopes for the loan of N50,000 to purchase more foodstuffs to sell. She says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs to sell

loans.name: Marceline

texts.en:
Marceline M. is 33 years old and is married with four children aged 4 through 11. She and her family live in the Nyamagabe district of the Gikongoro province of Rwanda where her business of selling general vegetables and fruits is located.

Marceline has been a successful businesswoman for the past eight years and her shop is well regarded by the locals. Her shop is open from 6 a.m. to 6 p.m. every day.

Marceline is requesting her second loan from Vision Finance Company and Kiva lenders in order to expand her business. She plans to purchase greater quantities and varieties of foods for sale which she believes her customers will want to buy. Through accessing this loan, she plans to increase her monthly profits, which will help her to pay school fees for her four young children.

loans.use: To buy more fruit, produce and general foods to sell

loans.name: Luciana

texts.en:
Luciana B. is from the village of Grace Village, Sto. Nino, Talakag, Bukidnon. She is 61 years old. Luciana is married and has 9 adult children. Luciana raises livestock to make her living. Her business involves buying and raising pigs for sale. Luciana has been engaged in her business for over 7 years and earns approximately 4,500 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Luciana joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and to engage in business activities. Luciana is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase baby livestock to raise & sell in future. This will be the 1st loan taken out by Luciana from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement income of the family. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase baby livestock to raise & sell in future.

loans.name: Rosa Amelia

texts.es: Rosa Amelia G. B. de 51 años de edad, vive en Ciudad Arce junto a su esposo, el cual trabaja como conductor de un pick up. Rosa posee un comedor en el cual elabora comida típica salvadoreña como así también desayunos y almuerzos. Ela solicita un préstamo ya que desea poder comprar, carne, pollo, maíz y bebidas para su negocio, debido a que su clientela ha crecido ella espera poderles brindas un menú más amplio y así poder atenderlos mejor. Rosa es muy responsable y dedicada a su trabajo, la cual se esfuerza mucho por mejorar su condición económica.
texts.en:
Rosa Amelia G. B. is 51 years old. She lives in the city of Arce with her husband, who works as a pick-up truck driver. Rosa has a restaurant where she serves typical Salvadorean food, including breakfast and lunch. She is asking for a loan because she wants to be able to buy meat, chicken, corn, and drinks for her business since her clientele has increased. She hopes to be able to offer them a more extensive menu and therefore serve them better. Rosa is very responsible and dedicated to her work. She works hard to improve her economic situation.

Translated from Spanish by Lydia Brantley, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying perishable items

location.town: Ciudad Arce en el departamento de La Libertad

loans.name: Beauty

texts.en:
Beauty is 38 years old and is married with six children. Her children are excelling in school.

Beauty owns a grocery stall where she sells drinks and groceries to make a living. She has been in this business since 2001 and makes more sales from her drinks business. She sells for long hours to enable her meet the demands of her customers. She hopes to own a supermarket in the future.

Beauty is requesting a loan of NGN 100,000 to purchase more drinks and groceries to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

Beauty is a LAPO (Lift Above Poverty Organization) client. LAPO is committed to improving lives in Nigeria and elsewhere in Africa.

loans.use: To purchase more drinks and groceries to sell

loans.name: Mrs. Korng Neang Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Korng N. is the group leader of a group of four members who all live in Speu village in Takeo province. She is a widow with a child who is employed in a garment factory.

Mrs. Korng N. is a cow breeder. Since her business is going well, she wants to expand it by purchasing another cow.

loans.use: To buy a cow for breeding.

loans.name: Roatha

texts.en: Mrs. Roatha A. is 29 years old and she lives in Prey Khla Khang Cheung village, Takeo province. She is a farmer who owns 3-hectare field of land to cultivate rice. In order to support her field she has decided to ask for a loan. With the funds, she will buy a water machine, fertilizers, and pesticides. Aside from farming, she is a grocer. She sells the groceries in the local market. Her husband, Mr. Somoeun Thou, is a teacher in the local village. He earns a salary to support the family members. Mrs. Roatha A. is mother of a child who is too young to study or work.

loans.use: To buy a water machine, fertilizers, and pesticides.

loans.name: Maria Faviola

texts.es:
El banco comunal 12 de Abril está formado por 15 socias activas, se caracterizan por ser mujeres activas, trabajadoras y emprendedoras que buscan tener y ofrecer una mejor calidad de vida  a sus familias,  todas las socias del banco comunal tiene su negocio de venta de comida o venta de frutas y verduras.

 Este banco está ubicado en la ciudad de Cuenca, siendo la tercera ciudad más importante del Ecuador, es reconocida por sus escritores y artistas, su belleza arquitectónica, los 4 ríos que bañan la urbe, las hábiles manos de sus artesanos y su suculenta gastronomía, así como por la calidez de su gente siempre amable acogiendo al turista nacional y extranjero.

La señora  María Fabiola O. es socia de éste banco hace cuatro años, vive en el sector de Totoracocha en la ciudadela Pedro Carbo en la Ciudad de Cuenca, tiene 38 años de edad y se encuentra casada, fruto de su matrimonio procreó tres  hijos que se encuentran de 18, 16, 10 años de edad, su esposo es empleado privado trabaja en la fábrica Domador,  aún no tienen casa propia y viven arrendando.

Fabiola vende comidas en su puesto en el mercado 12 de Abril, su horario de trabajo es de 10 a.m. a 6 p.m. de lunes a viernes, lleva unos siete  años realizando esta actividad  y el fin de semana se dedica a su familia. 

Con los créditos obtenidos  ha comprado  enseres y menaje  para su negocio y con el  con el nuevo préstamo solicitado va a adquirir   colas, arroz, azúcar, papas, aceite  y más productos para la elaboración de sus platos y para pagar unas deudas que tiene pendientes son unos proveedores de gaseosas y arroz, además  una parte lo  utilizará en el estudio de sus hijos y su gran sueño es comprar un terreno para construir su casa propia.
texts.en:
The “12 de Abril” comunal bank is made up of 15 members, characterized as being active, hard working and enterprising women looking for a better quality of life for themselves and their families. They each have their own businesses selling prepared food or fruits and vegetables. This bank is located in the city of Cuenca, being the third most important city in Ecuador, is well known for its artists and writers; its architectural beauty; the four rivers that bathe the city; the able hands of its artisans and their delicious food; and for its warm friendly people, always friendly to visitors and tourists. Maria Fabiola has been a member of this bank for four years. She lives in the Totoracocha section of the Pedro Carbo area of the city of Cuenca. She is 38 years old and is married with three children, ages 18, 16, and 10. Her husband works in the Domador factory. They do not own their own home and live in a rental. Fabiola sells food from her stall at the “12 de Abril” marketplace. She works from 10:00 am to 6:00 pm, Monday through Friday and spends the weekends with her family. She has been doing this for seven years. She has used the money from her loans to buy supplies and equipment for her business and she will use some of the money from this loan to buy colas, rice, sugar, potatoes, cooking oil, and other ingredients to prepare her dishes. She will another part to pay for some previous purchases of rice and soft drinks and will use the rest to pay for her children’s education expenses. She hopes to one day be able to buy a piece of land on which to build a home.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Ingredients for preparing food

loans.name: Sorn

texts.en: C. Sorn, 30, has a business selling brooms at the local market of Takeo province. On average, she makes around US$3 each day. Her husband, pictured here, stays at home helping her making brooms to sell. This couple has been making and selling brooms since 2002. Broom is made from some kinds of long grasses, which grow in the forest. This couple together has three children living at home to support. C. Sorn told our loan officer that her expenses are around US$45 on food and US$5 on utilities every month. C. Sorn is asking for a loan of US$600 to purchase a motorbike to transport the brooms to sell at the market. This will help reduce the transportation expenses.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike.

loans.name: Kob

texts.en:
Mrs. Kob L. is a villager in Tonle village in Takeo province. She is a farmer who owns small piece of land on which she cultivates rice to earn a living. Her husband, Mr. Muong Leang, is a village chief who is able to make a small salary to support the family. Her husband is shown on the right in the photo.

Although they try to work hard, they still earn less than needed to support the family. In order to improve their living conditions, Mrs. Kob L. decided to ask for a loan to buy two cows for breeding.

Mrs. Kob L. is the mother of four children, three of whom are employed in a garment factory while the other is attending the local school.

loans.use: To buy two cows for breeding

loans.name: Sokhoerun

texts.en: Mr. Sokhoerun K. lives in Phum Thum village in Kandal province and he was born in 1972. He is a farmer who owns a plot of land to grow vegetables to support his family. He is a widower who lives with two members of his household. He wants to grow cucumbers, but he did not have enough money to grow them. Thus, in order to improve productive cucumber, Mr. Sokhoerun K. decided to request a loan to buy bamboo, fertilizer, and fuel. With the rest of the loan, he would like to hire farm laborers to plow his field.

loans.use: To buy bamboo, fertilizer, and fuel

loans.name: Ana Luisa

texts.es:
La señora Ana Luisa L. P., tiene 52 años de edad vive en el barrio de La ceiba, es casada y su esposo es agricultor, ellos tienen 3 hijos mayores de edad, los cuales sobreviven de manera independiente, desde hace 9 años cultivan frutos, rubro que ha sido el sustento de alimenticio diario.

Dentro de las principales necesidades que tienen para sus  vidas, esta al reparación de la infraestructura de su hogar, para esto desean invertir en su negocio y de esta manera a futuro que su trabajo les provea bendiciones económico-sociales, que ayuden al porvenir de la familia, ellos solicitan de un préstamo para la compra de materiales agrícolas en la compra de fertilizantes, fungicidas, e insumos vegetativos para la diversificación de sus cultivos. Esta inversión atacara la afectación de plagas que tienen actualmente en sus tierras.
texts.en:
Ana Luisa L. P., 52, lives in the La Ceiba neighborhood; she’s married and her husband’s a farmer. They have three adult children who are now self-supporting. For the last 9 years they have farmed fruit, an activity that has provided them with daily nourishment. Among the main needs they have is improving the infrastructure of their home. To accomplish this, they need to invest in their business so that they will have future socio-economic benefits that will improve the family’s future. They are asking for funds to buy farming supplies, fertilizers and fungicides so that they can diversify their crops. This investment will attack the pest infestation that currently is affecting their farmlands.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fertilizer, fungicide and farm supplies.

loans.name: Celsa

texts.es:
Celsa pertenece al banco comunal “SAYHUA” de la Asociación Arariwa, tiene 44 años, es natural de la ciudad Urubamba y tiene tres hijos. Ya es un año y medio que participa en el banco comunal.

Su principal actividad económica es vender pollos y pescado en el mercado central, Celsa vende desde las seis de la mañana hasta las tres de la tarde de lunes a viernes.  Su actividad económica complementaria es vender al por mayor verduras en el mercado de tito los días sábados. Ya son quince años que se dedica al negocio y le va muy bien. Ella requiere el crédito para comprar abono, insecticida y semillas para sembrar en su chacra.  El anhelo de la socia es sacar profesional a su hijo que está estudiando la carrera profesional de Ingeniería de agronomía. 

Celsa se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Celsa belongs to “SAYHUA” communal bank of the Arariwa Association. She is 44 years old, from Urubamba city and has three children. She has participated in the communal bank for one and a half years now. Her main economic activity is to sell chicken and fish in the central market. Celsa sells from six in the morning until three in the afternoon, Monday to Friday. Her other economic activity is to sell mainly vegetables in the Tito market on Saturdays. She has done this business for fifteen years and it is going very well. She needs the loan to buy fertilizer, insecticide and seeds to sow on her small farm. Her wish is to get her son, who is studying Agronomic Engineering, to be a professional. Celsa is grateful for the opportunity given in this means and she commits to the payments corresponding to the payment schedule.

Translated from Spanish by Flavia Garcia, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Celsa needs the loan to buy fertilizer, insecticide, and seeds.

loans.name: Juana Paula

texts.es:
La señora Juana Paula Gaitán V. tiene la edad de 56 años, es madre soltera de 3 hijos mayores de edad, totalmente independientes que apoyan a su madre en los gastos del hogar, la señora es agricultora de café desde hace 14 años y sus días en la cosecha se iniciaron gracias a la reforma agraria de los años 90’s.

Las plaga de insectos han afectado a sus cultivos, y la baja de la producción le ha provocado una disminución en sus ingresos, es por esta razón que la señora solicita  un préstamo para la compra de insumos vegetativos, fungicidas y fertilizantes, que le permitan ofrecerle  a sus tierras mejores condiciones y a futuro la venta a un buen precio de toda la cosecha, permitiéndole recuperar la inversión y brindándole el capital necesario para nuevos proyectos, que vengan a beneficiar la sostenibilidad de su economía domestica.
texts.en:
Mrs. Juana Paula Gaitán V., 56, is a single mother of three adult, completely independent children who help her with household expenses. She has been a coffee grower for 14 years and her life in farming began thanks to agrarian reform in the 90s. Her crops have been affected by pest infestations and the drop in production has led to a decrease in her income. She is asking for funds to buy farm supplies, fungicides and fertilizers that will allow her to improve the condition of her soil so that the future sale price of her harvested crops will be higher thus recuperating her investment and providing capital for future projects that will be of benefit for the sustainability of her domestic economy.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fungicides, fertilizers and farm supplies.

loans.name: Dung

texts.en:
Dung T. D. was born in 1987. She lives in Ha Lam village. She has a shop where she sells wood furniture. Her husband is a carpenter. She has two children (a son and a daughter) who are still young. 

Dung T. D. has a monthly income of about 5,000,000 VND. She has participated in SEDA since 2007 and repaid punctually. In this loan cycle, she wants to borrow 7,630,000 VND to expand her shop.

loans.use: To expand her furniture shop

loans.name: Clara Liliana

texts.es:
Clara Liliana A. R. tiene 24 años de edad, es soltera y vive con sus padres, en el cantón de San Miguel en la provincia de Bolívar.

Clara es un miembro de la ventanilla rural Santiagopamba, que se encuentra en San Pablo, a media hora del pueblo de San Miguel. La ventanilla esta compuesta por personas que en su mayoría se dedica a la agricultura, como fuente de ingresos de su familia.

Clara se dedica a la crianza y engordo de especies menores (cuyes, chanchos, etc…). Hace las compras en la parroquia de San Pablo y las ventas en la plaza central y en el mercado de San Pablo. 

Solicita el préstamo para el mejoramiento de galpones y compra de especies menores como cuyes, chanchos y pollos. 

Piensa que este crédito le ayudará a ampliar galpones y comprar nuevas especies. Su meta es ampliar su negocio y pagar sus deudas. Enfrenta desafíos como competencia, pero solo por un bajo porcentaje. 

Le gustan las fiestas populares en su sector, como el carnaval y las fiestas cívicas y religiosas.
texts.en:
Clara Liliana is 24 years old, single and lives with her parents in San Miguel canton, Bolivar province. She is a member of the Ventanilla Rural (Rural Bank) Santiagopamba, located in San Pablo, half an hour from the town of San Miguel. The bank is composed of persons who in their majority are dedicated to agriculture as a source of family income. Clara raises and fattens small animals (guinea pigs, pigs, etc.). She buys them in San Pablo parish and sells them in the central plaza and in San Pablo market. Clara requests a loan for improving and expanding her sheds and to buy more pigs, guinea pigs, and chickens. She believes this loan will help her expand her facilities and obtain new species. Her goal is to expand her business and pay her debts. She confronts challenges such as competition, but only by a modest percent. Clara likes the popular fairs in her region, including carnival, and the civic and religious fiestas.

Translated from Spanish by Harold Sims, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: IMPROVING HER SHEDS AND BUYING SPECIES SUCH AS PIGS, GUINEA PIGS, AND CHICKENS

loans.name: Sapa Group

texts.en:
Pictured here are members of the “Sapa” group from Waterloo, a small town in Western Sierra Leone. They are petty-business women who have come to SMT, a Kiva partner, in order to seek a loan of SLL 1,000,000 each. With this loan, they will be able to add more goods to their businesses, attract more customers, make more sales and profits, and consequently improve their living conditions.

Also included in the photo is loan officer Kadiatu Bah, pictured on the left, handing over the loan.

The leader of this group of entrepreneurs is  Hawanatu T.. She was born about twenty-five years ago in Lunsar, a small town in northern Sierra Leone. She is married with one child.

Hawanatu has been selling cooking ingredients – onions, salt, palm-oil (the country’s favorite cooking oil), pepper, tomatoes, etc., for eight years now. With this loan, she will buy more bags of the above mentioned items to sell.

loans.use: To buy bags of onions, salt, palm-oil, pepper, tomatoes, etc. to sell

loans.name: Purita

texts.en:
Purita M. is a 49-year old married woman who supports her family by operating 2 business ventures:  A General Store and a Rice Retailer businesses. She lives in Purok Casoy, Tabugon, Kabankalan City, Negros Occidental.
 
She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2006 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her General Store and Rice Retailer businesses, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average income of P8,000 monthly. 

Purita is now borrowing PHP P29,500 so that she could use it as an additional working capital and to purchase a water buffalo.  This will be her 10TH loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of P22,000, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey towards economic freedom.  Purita aspires to elevate her family's living conditions and ensure their future well being by following the  Dungganon way. 

About NWTF:
In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking  the link to the  NWTF Kiva lending team  on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: Additional working capital

loans.name: Jerryline

texts.en:
Jerryline A. is from the village of San Miguel, Gingoog City. She is 20 years old, widowed and has 3 very young children. Jerryline owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) shop. She sells both food and daily use products and also makes and sells home-made sausages or chorizo in the local community. Jerryline has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month from it.

In 2010, Jerryline joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Jerryline is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the 1st loan taken out by Jerryline from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

location.town: San Miguel, Gingoog City, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Maria Eugenia De La Cruz

texts.es: María Eugenia V.  desde que cumplió su mayoría de edad, (18 años en Colombia), está trabajando; su abuela le enseño el arte de confeccionar ropa, tradición familiar, y ella empezó a ayudarla pues trabajaba este oficio desde su casa; justamente fue con ella que María Eugenia  hizo sus primeros intentos de confección  y esta experiencia la llevó a ser empleada de un taller y finalmente de una empresa en  la Zona Franca de Barranquilla, donde funcionan Fabricas de confecciones que producen, transforman o ensambla bienes para su venta en los mercados externos prioritariamente, logrando allí perfeccionar su arte durante 6 años, para luego implementar su taller con sus ahorros y un crédito, con el que logró comprar su primera máquina y algunas herramientas básicas para montaje de su confección . María Eugenia siempre está en la búsqueda de innovar y de aumentar la calidad de sus prendas de vestir, por eso últimamente se ha propuesto comprar una máquina plana, que le ayude en el perfeccionamiento de la prenda y a aumentar el volumen de compras de sus materias primas, para confeccionar nuevos diseños y esto es justamente a lo que ella aspira mediante su credikiva.
