Este es su primer crédito con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo y desea con sus financiamientos futuros, lograr su   meta de ampliar su negocio y mejorar la infraestructura para crear fuentes de empleo, que ayuden a resolver necesidades de ingresos de muchas familias.
texts.en:
María Eugenia V. has been working since she came of age (18 in Colombia). Her grandmother taught her how to make clothing, and she began to help her with this work from her home. That is just when María Eugenia began her first attempts at dressmaking. This experience pushed her to work in a shop, and finally in a company in the Industrial Zone of Barranquilla where clothing factories (toll manufacturers) mainly produce, alter, and assemble goods for sale abroad. She succeeded in perfecting her art during those 6 years, and then opened her own shop with her savings and a loan. She was able to buy her first sewing machine and some basic tools for the dressmaking. María Eugenia always is looking to innovate and improve the quality of her clothing. For this she has been able to purchase a machine that helps her in the perfecting of the garments and to increase the volume of her purchases of the basics that she needs to make new designs. And this is just what she plans to do with the Kiva loan. This is her first loan with the Mario Santo Domingo Foundation and she would like to have further loans in the future. She wants to enlarge her business and improve the infrastructure to create more employment and help solve the need for income for many families.

Translated from Spanish by Miriam Palacio, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a sewing machine  and basic materials to make new designs.

loans.name: Zolonides

texts.es: Zolonides, de 53 años, vive en su casa que es propia, en compañía de su joven hija Mónica de 20 años, juntos habitan en una modesta morada, ubicada en un barrio populoso al norte de la ciudad. Cada día es una lucha constante por salir adelante para este trabajador hombre que se dedica desde hace 10 años a prestar el servicio de taxi, que realiza  por diferentes calles de la ciudad. Dice que la labor es tranquila, pues se entretiene bastante conversando con sus casuales pasajeros, aunque prefiere trabajar durante el horario de día pues  sabe que taxear en las noches resulta algo peligroso, además a él le gusta dormir sus horas. Hace algunos años  se separó de su pareja y desde entonces trabaja junto a su hija en busca del progreso. Además asegura que su trabajo le genera ganancias regulares debido a que ya tiene pasajeros fijos que lo llaman con frecuencia para que los movilice. Como es un hombre bastante emprendedor para mas adelante tiene planeado comprar otro auto para brindarlo en alquiler y así generarse mejores ganancias. Es el primer crédito con MFP, y promete pagar puntualmente sus cuotas ya que no quiere defraudar la confianza que depositaron en él las personas que hicieron posible el dinero que le permitirá progresar. Zolonides tiene planeado invertir el crédito solicitado en cambiarle algunas piezas a su vehiculo ya que requiere algo de mantenimiento, además destinará una parte en la refacción a una pieza de su casa, de esta manera espera mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Zolonides, 53, lives in his own home with his young daughter, Mónica, 20. They live together in a modest home located in a crowded neighborhood in the north part of the city. Every day is a constant struggle to get ahead for this hard working man who has been a taxi driver for the last 10 years providing transportation services throughout the city. He says the work is easygoing because he distracts himself quite a bit chatting with his fares although he prefers to work during the daytime because being a taxi driver at night can be dangerous. Besides, he likes to sleep at his regular times. A few years ago he was separated and since then he and his daughter work together seeking progress. He assures us that his work generates steady income because he already has regular customers that call him frequently when they need transportation. Because he is quite an enterprising man he plans to buy another car in the future and lease it out to generate better profits. This is his first loan with MFP and he pledges to repay punctually because he doesn’t want to disappoint those who placed their trust in him and made funds available for him to continue progressing. Zolonides plans to use the requested funds to change a few parts on his car that need maintenance. He will use part of the funds to refurbish one of the rooms in his house thus improving his quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy replacement parts for his car.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To expand her business

loans.name: Myrna

texts.en:
Myrna A., age 45, is from the village of Nilabo, Rizal. She and her husband have three school-aged children. To make a living, Myrna runs a grocery. Myrna has been engaged in her business for over 15 years and earns approximately 1,500 PHP a month.

In 2007, Myrna joined PMPC to gain access to financial services. She hoped to help improve her living situation and increase her ability to engage in business activities. Myrna has successfully repaid a previous loan of 3,000 PHP from PMPC. Myrna is requesting a new loan of 3,000 PHP which will be used as additional capital for the business. This loan will be the fourth loan taken out by Myrna from PMPC. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: Additional capital for the business

loans.name: Genie

texts.en:
Genie B. is from the city of Cataggaman Viejo, Tuguegarao City. She is 47 years old. Genie is married and has three adult-aged children. To make a living, Genie owns & operates a business selling special ice cream to the local community. Genie is just starting this business.

In 2005, Genie joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Genie has successfully repaid a previous loan of 20,000 PHP from ASKI. Genie is requesting a new loan of 25,000 PHP, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the sixth loan taken out by Genie from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Blanca Arely

texts.es: Blanca Arely L. de 21 años de edad, es una joven muy responsable, la cual posee un gran deseo de salir adelante junto a su familia. Ella vive junto a su madre la cual trabaja como comerciante y así mismo junto a dos hermanos menores de edad. Debido a que la madre de Blanca es madre soltera, Blanca trabaja desde hace cuatro años atrás, vendiendo productos plásticos como cumbos, barriles, depósitos para alimentos  y otros más, todo con el fin de poder ayudar a su madre a sostener el hogar y brindarles todo lo necesario a sus hermanos. El negocio esta ubicado en el mercado de Lourdes Colón, ubicado en el departamento de La Libertad, lugar en el cual vive junto a su familia, y  en donde posee su puesto en el que comercializa sus productos. Con el enorme deseo de poder mejorar su negocio y de esta forma sus ganancias, Blanca solicita un préstamo a Integral y así de esta forma contar con el dinero necesario para comprar productos plásticos por mayor.
texts.en:
Blanca Arely L., 21, is a responsible young lady who very much wants to get ahead with her family.  She lives with her mother, who is a merchant, and with two minor brothers.  Because Blanca’s mother is a single mother, Blanca has worked for the last four years selling plastic items like, jugs, barrels, food containers, and others in order to help her mother support the home and provide everything for her brothers.

The business is located in the market in Lourdes Colón, La Libertad department, which is where she lives with her family and where she has her sales stand.

With the enormous wish to improve her business and thus her profits, Blanca is asking Integral for a loan so that she can have the money she needs to buy plastic items at wholesale.

loans.use: To buy plastic items.

loans.name: Cherlinda

texts.en:
Cherlinda D. is from the village of Balide Aurora Zamboanga Del Sur. She is 42 years old. Cherlinda is married and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Cherlinda owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising livestock. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from raising pigs for sale. Cherlinda has been engaged in her business for over 4 years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2007, Cherlinda joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Cherlinda has successfully repaid a previous loan of 20,000 PHP from GDMPC. Cherlinda is requesting a new loan of 20,000 PHP, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the fifth loan taken out by Cherlinda from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business.

loans.name: Richard

texts.en: Richard is a forty seven year old hardworking man.  He is married with five children  and lives in  his own house in Fort Portal, Uganda.  He has a desire to educate his children to attain bachelors degrees. For ten years he has been farming and with this business he has been able to buy land.  However he is faced with a challenge of price fluctuations of his produce which limits his profits. Richard needs the loan to buy spraying chemicals for his tea plantation.

loans.use: To buy chemicals to spray his tea plantation.

loans.name: Santos Elida

texts.en:
Santos is thirty-eight years old.  She lives in the district of Tambogrande in the province of Piura in northern Peru.  It is a semi-tropical zone which is very productive in fruits and feed for animals.  Many residents have small fruit plantations or raise animals near their homes.  Santos lives in her family’s home, along with her parents, her husband and their young child.

Santos raises sheep and goats in the yard behind their home.  She currently has eleven sheep and fourteen goats.  She raises these animals on local farm products or by-products from local rice and corn mills.  She cares for the animals until they reach the appropriate size to be sold in local markets or to neighbors.  Her husband works as a farm laborer on local properties.  Santos’s father owns a small property on which he raises crops.

This will be Santo’s first loan with Edpyme Alternativa.  She plans to use the funds to purchase additional feed and expand her herd.  She hopes that the increased capital will allow her to continue to grow her business and improve the income prospects of her family.  She dreams of making various improvements to the family home and providing her child with the opportunity to attend school.

loans.use: To purchase additional feed and expand her herd.

loans.name: Julieta

texts.en:
Julieta D. is a 45-year-old married woman who supports her family by operating 2 ventures: a general store and a food vending business. She lives in Brgy. Malis, Brooke's Point, Palawan. She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2004 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her two businesses, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of PHP 12,000. Julieta is borrowing PHP 29,500 in order to purchase more stock for her general store. This will be her 16th loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of PHP 29,500, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey toward economic freedom. Julieta hopes to elevate her family's living conditions and ensure their future well-being by following the Dungganon way.

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: to purchase stock for her general store

loans.name: Celia Monserrate

texts.es:
En la parroquia crucita del cantón Portoviejo, se reúnen las socias del Banco Comunal Crucita, esta localidad se la conoce por sus hermosas playas que rodean este lindo lugar y que son muy visitadas por turistas nacionales y extranjeros, se la conoce con el nombre de  “Crucita la Bella”.

En este lugar encontramos a la señora Celia, tiene 51 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene cinco  hijos  mayores de edad,  dos de ellos viven con ella. El marido es pescador.

Ella es una ama de casa que para ayudar  a su esposo realiza los créditos para el trabajo o negocio del esposo el cual se dedica a la pesca y venta de los frutos que el mar les da, ella por su parte asiste a las reuniones del banco porque su esposo la mayor parte del tiempo se pasa ocupado en las faenas de la pesca, trabaja todos los días, su esposo y sus hijos que lo acompañan se van a la mar desde la tarde y regresan al otro dia por la mañana para entregar sus productos a comerciantes que llegan  hasta sus pangas para llevarlos a los mercados de otras ciudades.
 
Este crédito es para comprar combustibles, redes y otros materiales necesarios para la pesca. Hace 5 años es socia del Banco Comunal y le gusta por la ayuda que recibe con los créditos. Sus sueños son tener un barco más grande ya que el que tienen es pequeño.
texts.en:
The members of the Crucita Community Bank meet in the Crucita parish in the Portoviejo canton. This area is known for its lovely beaches that surround it and that are highly trafficked by local and international tourists. This area is known as "Crucita the Beautiful".

Here we meet Mrs Celia. She is 51 and in a common-law marriage from which she has five grown children, two of whom live with her. Her husband is a fisherman.

She is a housewife who takes out loans for her husband's work or business (fishing and selling seafood) in order to help him. She attends the community bank meetings because her husband spends the majority of his time fishing. He works every day. Her husband and the children who accompany him go to the sea in the afternoon and return the next morning in order to offer their products to the merchants who come to their boats in order to take the products to markets in other cities.

This loan is for fuel, nets and other necessary materials for fishing. Celia has been a member of the Community Bank for five years, and she likes it because of the help that she receives with the loans. Her dream is to have a larger boat, since the one that they have is small.

loans.use: to purchase fuel, nets, and more materials for fishing.

loans.name: Johana Estefany

texts.es:
Johana, es una joven que reside en Santa Elena departamento de Usulután, tiene 29 años de edad, vive con su madre y un hermano de 17 años, Johana administra una foto estudio y venta de mercería desde hace 3 años, lo tiene ubicado en el Mercado Municipal y su horario de atención es de 8:00am a 5:00pm.
Actualmente está solicitando un préstamo para la compra de artículos para los negocios como: Rollos Fotográficos, cuadros, memorias, collares, pulseras y aretes,  esta inversión será de mucha ayuda para fortalecer el negocio, 
Johana espera realizar una buena inversión y que le resulten los planes para que su foto estudio sea más rentable y le genere lo necesario para salir adelante.
texts.en:
Johana is a young woman who lives in Santa Elena in the Usulutan department. She is 29 years old and she lives with her mother and her 17-year old brother. Johana has had a photo studio and craft store for the past 3 years. Her business is located in the municipal market and her business hours are from 8am to 5pm. 

She requests a loan to purchase merchandise for her business, including: film, frames, souvenirs, necklaces, bracelets, and earrings. This investment will be a great help in strengthening the business. 

Johana expects to make a good investment and to see her plans to make her photo studio more profitable come through and to earn enough to get ahead.

loans.use: To purchase necklaces, bracelets, earrings, film, frames, and souvenirs.

loans.name: Francis Gichia

texts.en:
Francis has practised farming in Ndunyu Njeru town for the past eight years. He is 24 years old and is married to Esther Nyambura. They have one child.

He was introduced to KADET LTD by a friend. This will be his second loan. He paid his first loan of Kshs 10,000 well and in good time. He plans to use the loan to buy a heifer.

In the future, Francis hopes to increase the number of his dairy cows and to practise dairy farming on a large scale.

loans.use: To buy a heifer.

loans.name: Elias

texts.es: El Sr. ELIAS nacido en Diciembre de 1987, en Villa Barrientos a 5 km de Santa Rita, ahora vive en la localidad de Pacay de la Ciudad de Santa Cruz tiene su propia parcela en la cual trabaja en la agricultura sembrando distintos productos, el es soltero siembra maíz, yuca, maní, frijol y Papa. día se dedica a la agricultura y de noche estudia en la ciudad de Santa Cruz en la universidad estatal donde cursa lo ultimo de su carrera de ingeniería comercial, tiene sus padres que le apoyan con su trabajo. Con el dinero del crédito comprara mas semillas para la siembra de Papa ya que es temporada de siembra, después de cosecharlo lo comercializa en el mercado de la zona y así poder incrementar su capital de trabajo, uno de sus deseos es el de terminar sus estudios y así poder mejorar su calidad de vida, es un joven responsable y trabajador con ganas de superación, esta muy agradecido con Emprender y Kiva por la Confianza Brindada en la otorgación del crédito.
texts.en:
Elias was born in December, 1987, in Villa Barrientos, 5 kilometers from Santa Rita.  He now lives in Santa Cruz’s Pacay section and has his own parcel of land on which he farms various products like corn, manioc, peanuts, beans and potatoes.  He’s single.

During the day he farms and in the evening he’s going to the state university in the city of Santa Cruz where he’s finishing up his Commercial Engineering degree.  His parents support his efforts.

He will use the money to increase his working capital from the loan to buy more potato seeds since this is planting season; once harvested he sells it in the local market.  

One of his wishes is to finish his schooling to improve his quality of life.  He’s a responsible, hard working young man with a drive to self improvement.  He is very grateful to Emprender and Kiva for the trust placed in him by granting the loan.

loans.use: For his potato crops.

loans.name: Margarita

texts.es: Margarita R. Martínez vive en el barrio Simón Bolívar, donde la música, el folclor y la educación de su gente, es lo más significativo  de las familias que trabajan principalmente en una actividad independiente, generando ingresos importantes para apoyar el sostenimiento del hogar. Desde este ambiente Margarita tiene un negocio donde comercializa con artículos variados, que traen de la ciudad de Medellín, especialmente ropa. Actividad que inició debido al carácter independiente de Margarita, el cual aplicó a su emprendimiento microempresarial generador  de ingresos, que finalmente destinó a su familia. Ella inició vendiendo de todo un poco: ropa, calzado, perfume, entre vecinos y amigos, posteriormente por recomendaciones logró ingresar al mercado de empleados de empresas, los cuales son sus principales clientes, algunos de ellos han surgido por recomendación de su esposo, quien trabaja en una empresa y la apoya en sus ideales. Ahora Margarita vende de todo lo que le solicitan, así ella toma el pedido y hace esfuerzos por ser muy oportuna, pues con esto compite en el mercado con mucha fuerza. Este es su financiamiento número 11 con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo y es también su primer credikiva con el cual comprará ropa de Medellín,  a un buen precio y con ello obtendría un aumento en sus utilidades. Con los financiamientos anteriores ha logrado fortalecer su independencia y apoyar con sus ingresos a su familia, pues con su esposo están de acuerdo con el sueño de tener un almacén bien posicionado que continúe generando bienestar a todos.
texts.en: Margarita R. M. lives in the community of Simon Bolivar, location where music, folklore and education for the people is the most important thing for families. They primarily have independent businesses to generate income for the support of their home. In this environment Margarita has a small business from where she sells various articles that are brought from the city of Mendellin, especially clothing. The business was started given Margarita's independent nature, which she applied to her income generating activity. It was for the ultimate benefit of her family. She started out slowly, selling clothing, shoes, and perfumes to her neighbors and friends. Later, with the help of recommendations, she managed to join the market of company employees, who today are her main clients. Some of her clients have succeeded with her husband’s recommendation. He works in a company and he supports her in her ideas. Margarita now sells everything that has been requested. She takes an order and she makes a very opportune effort.  This makes her a very strong competitor in the market. This is her eleventh loan with Fundacion Mario Santo Domingo (Kiva Field Partner) and it is her first with Kiva, with which she will invest in the purchase of clothing in Mendellin at a good price. She will see an increase in her earnings. With the previous loans she has managed to strengthen her independence and to support her family with her income. She and her husband share the same dream of having a well-located grocery store that will continue to support the well-being of them all.

loans.use: to purchase clothing for resale

loans.name: Ester

texts.en:
Ester E. is from the village of Bonbon, Sagay, Misamis Oriental. She is 27 years old. Ester is married and has 5 school-aged children. To make a living, Ester owns and operates a business venture in the retail sector operating a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from buying and selling seafood products including fish such as milk fish and sardines in the local community. Ester has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month.

In 2010, Ester joined Kiva's partner, HSPFI, to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Ester has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. Ester is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP which will be used to purchase more fish such as mackerel and sardines for sale. This loan will be the 2nd loan taken out by Ester from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional fish for sale

loans.name: Marco Antonio

texts.es:
el sr. Marco Antonio C. tiene 47 años de edad, vive en el Barrio Tololo de la ciudad de Choluteca y se dedica a la venta de calzado en la plaza central de El Triunfo Choluteca.
Marco es padre de 3 hijos los cuales los tiene estudiando en la escuela publica de su comunidad.
juntos con su esposa trabajan duro para sacar adelante a sus hijos.
el credito lo utilizara para la compra de calzado ya que se aproxima semana santa y muchas personas que estan de vacaciones visitan dicha plaza y es buen momento para ofrecerles variedad de calzado.
Marco y su familia en sus tiempos libres visitan la iglesia.
texts.en:
Sr. Marco Antonio C. is 47 years old. He lives in the Tololo neighborhood of the city of Choluteca. He is engaged in selling footwear in the central plaza of Triunfo, Choluteca.

Marco is the father of 3 children who are studying in his community’s public school. He and his wife work hard so that their children can get ahead.

The loan will be used to purchase footwear. Since holy week is approaching and many people who are on vacation visit the plaza this is a good time to offer a variety of footwear. In their spare time Marco and his family attend church.

loans.use: to purchase sandals, slippers, shoes, and sneakers.

loans.name: Fayossey

texts.fr: Agé de 26ans, Mr Fayossey est  couturier de profession. Sa femme est revendeuse de produits de premières nécessités (lait, sucre, riz..) et est père de 01 enfant.  Il a crée son atelier  depuis 2002 et a plusieurs clients.  Il  fait de la broderie et sollicite ce prêt pour acheter  de la machine de broderie pour satisfaire ses clients nombreux afin de d’avoir plus d’argent pour  assurer  l’avenir de ses enfants, sa femme et son propre avenir. Il a une ambition : devenir un couturier de renom.
texts.en: At 26 years old, Mr. Fayossey is a dressmaker by profession.  His wife is a reseller of high necessity products (milk, sugar, rice, etc.) and he is the father of one child.  He created his workshop in 2002 and has several clients.  He embroiders and is requesting this loan to buy an embroidery machine to meet the needs of his numerous clients in order to have more money to ensure the future of his children, his wife and himself.  He has one ambition: to become a renowned dressmaker.

loans.use: to purchase a machine for embroidering.

loans.name: Santos Alejandro

texts.es: Santos Alejandro tiene 45 años, su actividad es la venta y compra de ganado. Hace más de 16 años que se dedica a este negocio, por lo que  El trabajo al que se dedica es muy pesado pero le gusta, en un principio y hace mucho tiempo empezó esta actividad como aprendiz y con el tiempo aprendió. La pasión que le pone a su trabajo lo ha convertido en un buen  hombre y por ello se ha ganado los reconocimientos de todos los que lo conocen. El siempre está viendo la manera de mejorar su trabajo, por tal motivo solicita este crédito para comprar vacas, chivos, y toros. Pues siempre ha soñado con ampliar su negocio y mejorar las condiciones de su familia.
texts.en: Santos Alejandro is 45 years old and he buys and sells cattle. He has been in the business for more than 16 years. His business is very difficult but he likes it. In the beginning, a long time ago, he started out as an apprentice and with time he learned. The passion he expends in his work has converted him into a good man and this has won him the recommendation of all those who know him. He is always looking for a way to improve his work. For this reason he requests a loan, to purchase cows, goats, and bulls. He has always dreamt of expanding his business and to improve his family's living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase cows, goats, and bulls.

loans.name: Mwanasha

texts.en:
Mwanasha is a single woman with three children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For the past three months, she has operated a natural juice making business. She sells at home to her neighbors and passersby. In addition, she also sells palm leaves for roof thatching, which contributes to her other source of income. Mwanasha faces the major challenge of the high cost of transporting palm leaves from the rural area to her place of operation. She dreams of establishing a boutique shop in the future.

With the KSHS 20,000 loan, she wants to purchase an ice cooler box and start another business selling cloth material. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase an ice cooler and start another business selling cloth material

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en:
Mercy  was born in 1975, got married to Mr. Timti Emmanuel, and is blessed with eight children, five of whom are  below the age of 15. They all occupy a five-room apartment  in Elemighong quarter in Belo sub Division of Cameroon. The search for business capital encouraged her to became a GHAPE member in  2010. This same year she obtained her first loan of 50,000 F CFA which she repaid with no difficulties.

Mercy is now requesting a second loan from GHAPE. She plans to invest this loan in her needing workshop and also in buying and selling Irish potatoes. She plans to buy needing thread for 20,000 F CFA and 80,000 F CFA will be used for the purchase of Irish potatoes. She knows her business will succeed because she has been doing this trade for a very long time now and her community will serve as a ready market for her goods. She prefers to obtain a loan from GHAPE because their interest rate is low and encouraging and also GHAPE provides her with training on how to manage her business.

About GHAPE 

The Grounded and Holistic Approach to People's Empowerment (GHAPE) is a non-profit NGO based in Bamenda, Cameroon.  GHAPE works towards the empowerment of the poor and poverty alleviation through a highly multi-faceted approach.  Every client is trained in business management, basic health, life skills, financial management, profits and losses, and family values.  Clients are also required to contribute a small amount into a personal savings account; most clients save much more than the minimum requirement.  GHAPE instils a sense of family and community within its clients and staff and has developed a strong bond of trust between the organization and its clients.

loans.use: to buy thread and Irish potatoes for sale.

loans.name: Arceli

texts.en:
Arceli sells mud crabs. She is a hardworking entrepreneur in the Philippines who has been in this business for five years. Arceli earns additional income from raising hogs.

Arceli has been maintaining her business through her own efforts along with the help of loans from NWTF. She is now borrowing 17,000 PHP through NWTF to buy additional mud crabs to sell.

Arceli dreams of saving enough money to provide herself with a secure future.

loans.use: to buy additional mud crabs to sell.

loans.name: Kimutai

texts.en:
Kimutai is a resident and farmer in Litein, Rift Valley Provice, Kenya. He is 22, single, and has been farming for eight years. He produces milk, which he sells to the local Kokiche Dairies, and tea, which goes to the local market.

Kimutai has requested a loan of 46,800 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to buy and insure a dairy cow. He says he believes farming will build a good foundation for his family and enable him provide for their daily needs. His goal is to have at least three dairy cows and to be able to construct a modern dairy unit for them.

Kimutai says the fluctuation in milk prices is his greatest challenge. He is grateful to Juhudi for the support it gives to small-scale farmers.

loans.use: to buy and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita is 46 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is separated with 2 children. Teresita has a retail shop that sells vegetables like tomatoes and bell peppers. She has had this business for 5 years. 

She requested a loan of 5,000 PHP to buy vegetables to sell. Teresita is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en:
Mohammad is a 56-year-old retired man. He lives in Al Karak with his wife and 14-year-old daughter.

Recently, Mohammad has opened an accessories store in Al Karak but did not include a lot of items in the beginning until he studied what is suitable and affordable for those in his area. Now Mohammad has applied for a loan to expand his business and add more items such as make-up and perfumes.

loans.use: To buy more items such as make-up and perfumes.

loans.name: Francisco Gerardo

texts.es:
El señor Francisco es casado, vive en la ciudad de Pilar, su esposa es comerciante, se dedica a hacer trabajos de crochet, artesanía en encaje yu.
Tiene casa propia, con las comodidades mínimas dentro del bienestar familiar. Él se dedica a la compra y venta de artículos electrónicos. Realiza sus ventas por toda la ciudad, recorriendo todos los barrios. Comenta que su trabajo es muy duro, ya que todos los días debe salir a tempranas horas para empezar a vender sus mercaderías. Dice que todo lo que realiza es por el bienestar de su familia, ya que desea darles un mejor estilo de vida.
El Solicita el crédito para la compra de aparatos electrónicos como ser mixteras, cafeteras y demás para la posterior venta. Está muy agradecido a la Fundación por la oportunidad que le brinda.
texts.en:
Sr. Francisco is married and lives in the city of Pilar. His wife is a merchant who makes crocheted items and lace crafts. He has his own home with basic amenities to ensure his family’s welfare. Francisco buys and sells electrical goods. He conducts his sales throughout the city by visiting all neighborhoods. Francisco says that his job is very hard because he works every day and has to leave in the early hours of the morning to start selling his merchandise. He says all of his efforts are geared toward providing for his family's well-being, since he wants to give them a better lifestyle.

The loan he is requesting will be used to buy electrical appliances such as mixers, coffee makers, and other items for eventual resale. Francisco is very grateful to Fundación Paraguaya for the opportunity that has been provided.

loans.use: to buy electrical appliances such as mixers, coffee makers, and other items.

loans.name: Mila

texts.en:
Mila is 56 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 3 children. 
Mila has a shop that sells used clothing & bedding like t-shirts, bed sheets and comforters. She has had this business for 5 years. She requested a loan of PHP 8,000 to buy stock of used clothing.
Mila has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Mila hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy stock of used clothing

loans.name: Jemson

texts.en:
Jemson is 47 years old and lives in Aurora, Zamboanga Del Sur, Philippines. He is married with 5 school-aged children. The family is living together in the said place.

Jemson has been engaged in a motorcycle transport business to make a living. He has been driving around his usual routes for over 10 years and maintains his interest in pursuing the job. His wife also works as a designer and earns a quite just amount to suffice daily needs, and for their children's' education. Their total earnings have reached  PHP 12,800 a month. But, a problem with motorcycle parts has been detected that pushes him to request a loan of PHP 18,000 at GDMPC to purchase motorcycle accessories. The money is a big help to fix and resume business operations.

Jemson has been a member of GDMPC since 2008. He did repay all previous loans drawn out from the cooperative. The current loan is his 3rd cycle of loan. In the future, Jemson hopes to push through his business immediately. He plans to expand and improve the business to sustain their daily needs.

loans.use: To purchase motorcycle accessories.

loans.name: Odalia Alexandra

texts.es:
Odalia Alexandra  tiene 23 años, Es soltera vive con los padres y el hijo de 10 meses de edad.

Los miembros de la V.R.C. SAN JOSE DE LOS AMARILLOS se dedican a labores agrícolas de ciclo corto siembra de maíz y arroz.

Odalia se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz y arroz. 

Solicita el crédito para sembrar maíz, arroz y fréjol gandúl y poder comprar  semillas, insumos y fertilizantes, urea, abonos agrícolas para los cultivos.   Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. 
Enfrentar desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades y la variedad del clima. Su sueño es ampliar la casa.

En los tiempos libres le gusta ver la televisión.
texts.en:
Odalia Alexandra is 23, a single mother, who lives with her parents and her 10 month-old son.

The members of San Jose de los Amarillos communal bank are short cycle corn and rice farmers.

Odalia farms corn and rice.

She is requesting this loan to plant corn, rice and pigeon peas and to buy seeds, agricultural supplies, fertilizer, urea and compost for her plants. Support from the loan would help her to meet her economic needs. She confronts challenges such as pest infestations, diseases and weather changes. Her dream is to enlarge her house.

In her free time, she enjoys watching television.

loans.use: to plant corn, rice, pigeon peas and to buy seeds, agricultural supplies and fertilizer, urea and compost for her plants.

loans.name: Felicitas

texts.en:
Felicitas aims to have a better quality of life someday. To make a living, her spouse provides motorcycle services to the people in their village. They earn a daily income of 200 pesos. According to Felicitas, it is just enough to cover their expenses for meals and allowances of her two children attending school.

The couple had insufficient funds to pay for franchise renewal and paint for the motorcycle; that is why Felicitas is asking for a loan of 12,000 pesos. She wants her spouse to be able to continue providing the services.

In the future, she wants to keep earning a good income to save for the college education of her children. She wants them to earn a degree to seek good employment someday.

loans.use: to pay for franchise renewal and paint for the motorcycle

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter is a 68-year-old farmer. He practices pig farming for a living. He also rears goats for additional income. His region has a good climate that is conducive to farming. 

Previously, he was involved in dairy farming. He has improved his farming through the financial support of Faulu Kenya.

Peter hopes to farm on a large scale in five years. He has requested 40,000 KES to buy pigs.

loans.use: To buy pigs.

loans.name: Vicenta

texts.en:
Vicenta is 51 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 2 children. 
Vicenta has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks & vegetables like tomatoes. She has had this business for 4 years. She has requested a loan for PHP 8,000 to buy canned goods, snacks & vegetables.
Vicenta has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Vicenta hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks & vegetables

loans.name: Freddy Leonel

texts.es: Freddy Leonel tiene 39 años, él se dedica a brindar el servicio de contratista. Desde hace más de 11 años que tiene este medio de vida,  él siempre está pensando en el bienestar de su familia pues quiere seguir progresando diariamente. El motivo del crédito es para la compra de camión pues es necesario para llevar todas las herramientas necesarias. Sueña con seguir creciendo con su negocio.
texts.en: Freddy Leonel is 39 years old and works as a contractor.  He’s had this line of work for over 11 years.  He is always thinking of ways to improve his family’s wellbeing  because he wants to continue making progress daily.  The reason for the loan is to buy a truck that he needs to carry all the necessary tools.  He dreams with continuing to grow in his business.

loans.use: to buy a truck.

loans.name: Mario Pedro

texts.es: La señor Mario  es cliente antiguo de la institución desde el año 2004 empezó en el grupo solidario Raza de Bronce  quien ha trabajado con responsabilidad y puntualidad en sus cuotas. Actualmente vive en la ciudad del Alto  tiene casa propia, el solo mantiene su hogar,  se dedica a la venta de repuestos usados para movilidades, se dedica a esta actividad hace ya bastantes años,  el préstamo lo  invertirá en la compra de repuestos para movilidad, ya que desea surtir su tienda y así ofrecer variedad de repuestos a sus clientes, se siente muy feliz y agradecido con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en: Señor Mario is a long-standing member of the institution since 2004. He started with the solidarity group Raza de Bronce and made his repayments responsibly and punctually. He currently lives in the city of Alto. He owns his own house and only takes care of himself. He sells used spare parts for cars. He has been doing this work for a long time. He will invest the loan to purchase spare parts for cars as he wants to stock his store and thus offer a variety of spare parts to his customers. He is very happy with and grateful to the institution for the support given.

loans.use: to buy spare parts to stock his store.

loans.name: Ekua

texts.en: Ekua  sells fish and "kenkey" (fermented maize dumplings) at Besease near Elmina. She is married and has six children. Her husband is a farmer.  Ekua has been selling "kenkey" and fish for seven years. She uses her income to assist her husband to provide for the family. She will use her loan to buy bulk fish and maize. She hopes to use the new profits to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy bulk fish and maize.

loans.name: Elvina

texts.en:
Elvina is 32 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has 2 children. 

Elvina has a rice field and sells rice grains during harvest time. She has had this business for 5 years. She requested a loan for PHP 10,000 to buy fertilizer for her rice field.

Elvina has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: buy fertilizer

loans.name: Shirley

texts.en:
Shirley is 44 years old and married. She has one child.

Shirley works hard to provide for her family. She runs a business of buying and selling spices in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 25,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional spices to sell.

Shirley has borrowed and repaid 19 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the buy and sell spices business for 5 years and also earns an income from farming sugarcane and operating her sari-sari store.

Shirley aspires to save money in order to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional spices to sell.

loans.name: Kulnar

texts.ru:
Кульнар 58 лет, замужем, имеет четверых взрослых детей. 
Кульнар родилась в простой семье фермера и с детства помогала родителям по хозяйству. Так получилось, что Кульнар вышла замуж рано в 15 лет. Школу окончила в родном селе, но продолжить учебу у нее не получилось, так как она родила старшего сына. В течении следующих 10 лет Кульнар стала матерью еще троих детей. В поисках дохода для своей семьи, в 1980 году, Кульнар устроилась на работу в Каиндинский мясокомбинат в должности бойца (работник, который производит забой скота). Работа была очень тяжелая, но Кульнар сильная женщина, и проработала на мясокомбинате до выхода на пенсию в 2008 году. 
Супруг Кульнар работал пастухом в колхозе имени Панфилова, но после развала Советского Союза колхоз развалился, после чего супруг начал заниматься выпасом скота местного населения. На совместно заработанные деньги Кульнар с супругом обзавелись хозяйством, на доходы от продажи скота выучили детей. В настоящее время, старший сын проживает совместно, и Кульнар заботится о двух внуках. Благодаря упорству и трудолюбию Кульнар, на сегодняшний день в ее хозяйстве одна дойная корова и одна лошадь.  В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Кульнар обратилась в компанию «Бай – Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS) на покупку породистых лошадей. Приплод Кульнар планирует продавать.

Доходы от бизнес – деятельности Кульнар планирует вложить в дальнейшее разведение породистых лошадей.
texts.en: Kulnar is 58 years old, married and has four adult children.  She was born into a simple family of a farmer and had helped her parents with the household since childhood.  It just so happened that Kulnar got married early, at the age of 15.  She finished school in her native village, but could not continue her education because she gave birth to her oldest son.  During the next ten years, Kulnar became a mother to three more children.  In search of a source of income for her family, Kulnar got a job as a butcher (worker who butchers livestock) at the Kaindinskiy meat processing plant in 1980.  This work was very hard, but Kulnar is a strong woman and worked at the plant until she retired in 2008.  Kulnar's husband worked as a shepherd at the collective farm, named after Panfilov, but got involved in taking livestock to a pasture for local residents when the collective farm feel apart after the breakup of the Soviet Union.  Kulnar and her husband used their jointly earned money to create a farm business and provided education for their children with earnings from selling livestock.  At the present time, their oldest son lives with them, and Kulnar takes care of two grandchildren.  Thanks to her persistence and love of hard work, Kulnar's business currently has one dairy cow and one horse.  In order to further develop her business, she requested a loan in the sum of 100,000 som (KGS) from the "Bai-Tushum and Partners" company to purchase thoroughbred horses.  She plans to sell the offsprings.  Kulnar plans to invest the earning from the business into continued breeding of thoroughbred horses.

loans.use: to purchase thoroughbred horses

loans.name: Nzadze

texts.en:
Nzadze is a widowed woman with two children, one of whom attends school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Nzadze's greatest monthly expense is school fees. 

For the past four years, Nzadze has operated a grocery business, selling at the market to her neighbors and passersby. Her major challenge is price fluctuation of goods in the market. She decided to join Yehu to expand her business. 

Nzadze plans to use this KES 15,000 loan to purchase sacks of green vegetables, tomatoes and onions for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of green vegetables, tomatoes and onions for resale.

loans.name: Hanan

texts.en: Hanan is a 34 year old married woman who has 4 family members from Al Nasser Amman Jordan. She is requesting a loan of 400 JD to pay for cosmetics products to sell, she wants to increase her income. In the future she would like to open a shop and she hopes for her son's to continue their education.

loans.use: to pay for cosmetics products to sell

loans.name: Buenaventura's Group

texts.en: Buenaventura, his cousin Cirilo and Marcelo live in a small community called El Paraíso in Santa María Tiltepec, Oaxaca. They each provide for a family of six and work in the field cultivating corn. Everyday they must travel  to their workplace, more than an hour away walking distance, where they have a small field house where they take care of their crops. Buenaventura and his eldest son stay over to sleep at this house in the field, where they have no electricity supply. They rely on candles and have no place to charge their cell-phone, their only means of communication for emergencies and to stay in touch with their families during that days they are working. With your loan they will be able to have reliable LED lighting through a solar home system and charge their cell-phones to be able to communicate with their families.

loans.use: Buenaventura and his group buy a solar home system to have reliable light.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Nelly would like to buy a dairy cow.

loans.name: Afi

texts.en: Afi is mainly in the sale of local drinks in her community. She has no money to pay her supplers therefore not recieving supply anymore. She is seeking a kiva loan of $650.00 to enable her pay and take more drinks.

loans.use: working capital

loans.name: Ángel

texts.en:
Ángel has a well-located bakery in the main street, where he sells bread, drinks, cakes, and dairy.

In beginning he only only sold bread and pastries. Now he sells cakes and dairy products to his community. He started his business because he had the opportunity to buy a bread oven and learned to make pastries in a previous job.

He will use the loan to invest in the purchase of raw materials and to buy a showcase so his products are displayed more attractively and he can give a better service to his customers.

He is confident that with this new product, his business will grow and it will bring financial stability. Ángel is married. He is 41 years old and has 2 children of which one is studying. It will give him financial security and it will allow him to save money.

Translated from Spanish by Ramón F. Kolb, Kiva Volunteer.

Ángel tiene una Panadería muy bien ubicada en calle principal donde vende panes, bebidas ,tortas y lácteos.

Al principio solo vendía panes y dulces. Ahora vende tortas y lácteos en su comunidad. Empezó su negocio comprando un horno panificador de oportunidad y aprendió de pastelería de un anterior trabajo.

El usara el préstamo para invertir en compra de materia prima y una vitrina para que sus productos tengan mejor presentación y darle mejor servicio a sus clientes.

El tiene la fe que con este nuevo producto su negocio crecerá y tendrá estabilidad económica. Ángel esta casado. Tiene 41años, dos hijos; uno de ellos estudia. Le dará seguridad y le permitirá ahorrar para el futuro.

loans.use: Invest in supplies and in another showcase

loans.name: Catarina

texts.en:
Catarina O. P., 45, supports herself by weaving huipiles, the traditional blouse worn by Mayan women. She will use the proceeds of this credit to buy more material. It can take a full month of full time work to make one huipil, and the material normally costs about 75 quetzals, or US$10, but she can sell the finished huipil for about 500 quetzales, or US$65.  She sells her work in the street, and also sells to tourists in a nearby town. She also sells small bags of a nut called “aba” for 1 quetzal each (about US$0.08)  and helps in her sister’s  tortilla business. Catarina is separated from her husband, who drank and beat her. She has a total of 7 children ranging in age from 7 to 25. The four younger children live with her. While she is building her own home, they are all  living with a  friend. The house is almost complete, but needs windows and a few other finish items before they move in. 
It has been a long struggle for Catarina but she is persistent. She never had any schooling and speaks only the Cakchiquel language.  Her long-term dream is to be able to open a fruit stand and sell bananas, papaya, apples, pineapples, oranges, and other local fruits. Before receiving micro credits Catarina  had no way to support herself, but now she is on her sixth loan in three years, and she has successfully paid off all previous loans. She says that before receiving the credits she had absolutely no cash and no way to support her family, but as her business has developed she’s very proud of her ability to take care of her children. Perhaps as she is able to continue her success the sadness she feels concerning her family situation and estranged husband will diminish over time.

loans.use: She will use the proceeds of this credit to buy more material

loans.name: Senia Ruth

texts.es:
Senia is the young mother of a 7 year-old girl. Her desire to improve her daughter’s quality of life has led her to do a variety of jobs. Three years ago she began a small grocery store in her house, taking advantage of the huge demand of her neighbors for basic goods. With the income that this small store generates, she is able to meet her family’s basic needs and also educate her daughter.

Due to the fact that her customers are always requesting a larger number and variety of products, Senia finds herself in the situation of needing to increase her stock so that she can provide good service to her customers. In order to do this, Senia is requesting a loan of S/. 600.00, which she is committed to repaying over a period of 6 months. Senia hopes you will be able to help her so that she can begin her project.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer.

Senia, es una joven luchadora madre de una niña de 7 años. Los deseos de mejorar la calidad de vida de su hija la han llevado a desempeñarse en diferentes oficios. Hace 3 años inauguró una pequeña tienda de abarrotes en su localidad aprovechando la masiva demanda de sus vecinos por los artículos de primera necesidad.Con el ingreso que genera a diario esta pequeña bodega, puede solventar las necesidades más urgentes de su familia y otorgarle una adecuada educación a su pequeña.Debido a que sus clientes cada vez exigen mayor cantidad y variedad es que Senia se ve en la necesidad de ampliar su stock con el deseo de brindarles un adecuado servicio a sus clientes. Por esta razón solicita un préstamos de 600 soles que se compromete a retornarlos en un período de 6 meses para poder ingresar mayor cantidad de artículos a su bodega. Senia espera tu pronta ayuda para iniciar su proyecto.

loans.use: To buy a greater stock of products for her grocery store, so that it can become one of the most popular in the neighborhood

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase additional inventory for her grocery store.

loans.name: Silveria

texts.es:
Silveria, 59 years old, is a hard-working and cheerful mother. Since she formed her family with Francisco, her loyal husband, she has always strived to move ahead, working in a diverse array of activities looking to obtain a better future along with her three minor children. This hard-working family had hoped to open a large wholesale store distributing wool, and to realize this plan, they had some money saved up. Unfortunately, they were victims of theft by unscrupulous individuals, leaving the entire family in a very bad economic state.

This situation, however, did not cause Silveria to give up. With the strength and commitment that are characteristic of her, she decided to open a small grocery store which she now intends to expand and increase the variety of its products. To make this happen, she is requesting a loan which she plans to repay in 6 months. Let’s support the progress of this entrepreneurial family.

Translated from Spanish by Evelyn Garcia, Kiva Volunteer.

Doña Silveria, es una laboriosa y alegre madre D. 51 años D. edad, desD. que formó su familia junto a Francisco, su fiel esposo, siempre luchó por salir adelante, desempeñándose en diversas actividades para buscar obtener un mejor porvenir junto a sus tres hijos menores.Esta trabajadora familia pretendía poner una gran tienda D. distribución D. lana al por mayor y para concretar sus planes tenían ahorrado un dinerito, pero desafortunadamente sufrió un robo por inescrupulosas personas, dejando a toda su familia en una situación económica muy mala.Sin embargo esta situación no fue motivo para que doña Silveria se rindiera, con la fuerza y empeño que la caracteriza decidió abrir su bodeguita D. abarrotes, negocio que pretenD. ampliar y aumentar la variedad D. sus productos, para concretar sus planes solicita un préstamo a fin D. reembolsarles en un lapso D. seis meses.Apoyemos a esta emprendedora familia a progresar.

loans.use: Purchase a larger quantity and wider variety of provisions.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: he needs the loan to purchase goods

loans.name: Marach B(Iii) Group

texts.en:
The group leader of this small group is Shalima Nakamya. She owns a drug shop and is requesting a loan to purchase more drus for sale. Shalima is 23 years old and is married with a husband who is a business man. Each week, Shalima makes approximately UGX 300000 in profits and with the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to construct a house. Shalima has taken a loan from BRAC Uganda before in the amount of UGX 600000 in order to invest in her business and the loan was paid back on time.

Shalima is joined in her small group by Beatrice N., Isha W. and Ali Z.. Beatrice N. sells new clothes and wants to add in clothe business. Isha W. is currently operating a business in charcoal sales and wants a loan to expand and become a wholesaler. Ali Z. operates a business of used clothing and wants to increase stock of clothes.

loans.use: To buy more drugs for sale thus expand business

loans.name: Kimombasa South D Group

texts.en:
The group leader of this small group is Florence K.. She is currently in the business of produce sales and is requesting a loan to boost business. Florence is 35 years old and is married with a husband who buys and sells produce for work. She has 5 children ranging from age 3 to 10 and her children go to school. Each week, Florence makes approximately UGX 25000 in profits and with the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to buy a house. Florence has taken a loan from BRAC Uganda before in the amount of UGX 200000 in order to invest in her business and the loan was paid back on time.

Florence is joined in her small group by Nulu Kauma, Milisa K., Nasimu K., and Ayubu K.. Nulu Kauma has a business running a restaurant and wants to add furniture. Milisa K. is currently operating a business running a restaurant and wants a loan to purchase more utensils. Nasimu K. operates a business selling produce and wants to add capital. Ayubu K. is currently in the business of clothing sales and is requesting a loan to purchase more clothes to sell.

loans.use: To buy and sell large quantities of produce

loans.name: Loep

texts.en: Mrs. Loep K. C., 55, is a farmer who earns $5 per day. A widow, she has five children and lives in the Muoy Village, Phnom Penh City. Two children work in Malaysia, and a third works in the garment industry in Phnom Penh. Mrs. C. now requests a loan of $800 to increase her working capital for her farming business. She hopes this loan will improve her family’s financial stability.

loans.use: To increase her working capital for her farming business

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes is 35 years old and is a married woman with 3 children, ages 18, 12 and 3 years old. Agnes sells cassava, vegetable and bananas. She started in 1986. Every day, she works from 4am to 3pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $30 from her sales.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more cassava, bananas and vegetables for her business.

loans.use: To buy more cassava, bananas and vegetables for her business.

loans.name: Benjamin

texts.en:
Benjamin is 46 years old and originally from Matutuine district in the Maputo Province. Benjamin is married and the father of five children: the oldest with 24 years old and the youngest with 5 years old. Besides his children, Benjamin also supports two nephews from a deceased brother.

Benjamin studied until 3rd grade and stopped due to his family’s difficult financial situation. At the age of 15 years he started fishing with his father, but soon stopped to join the obligatory military service. In 1988 Benjamin was involved in an ambush and lost both legs. Benjamin decided to move to Maputo rather than returning to Matutuine due to the civil war that was intense in the countryside. Benjamin started to repair shoes and only in 1998 started to receive a pension from the government.

In 2004 Benjamin decided to go back to Bela Vista in Matutuine with plans to work in an agricultural field, but the lack of rain didn’t allow him to proceed with his plans. He then went back to repairing shoes and also started to sell used clothes, blankets and duvets in a small stand. Benjamin’s wife goes to South Africa to sell pans and buys the blankets and duvets that are then sold in Mozambique. During wintertime the sale of blankets and duvets intensifies. Benjamin’s wife buys them for MTn 350 and he sells them for MTn 800 each.

Benjamim is an old client of Hluvuku. His last loan was used to buy some consumer goods such as a fridge and a radio and his second to last loan was used to pay his son’s medical expenses, as he stayed three months in the hospital with cancer.

In the future Benjamin would like to go back to fishing. He dreams about buying a boat and once again making a living out of the business.

loans.use: To buy used clothes and shoes to sell.

loans.name: Sary

texts.en:
Mrs. Sary S., 51, and her husband, Mr. Hel Phan, 54, live along national road number one about eighteen kilometers from Phnom Penh. They were married in 1979 and have three children, one son and two daughters. One of their children is married and lives outside the family home. One daughter is a tailor and the youngest one is in a local school.   

Mrs. Sary has been selling grocery items for seven years. She buys the items from Kor Ky market for resale at her shop in the front of her house. Mr. Hel is in the army. The couple is in the process of repairing their house, and Sary is requesting a loan of $1000 for this purpose.

loans.use: House repair

loans.name: Enisa

texts.en: Enisa, a young woman from the town of Doboj, is married with one child, and her husband is currently employed.  The family receives a small pension through Enisa's mother-in-law as well.  This will be Enisa's first loan from Zene za Zene, which she is requesting in the amount of $800 to buy seeds to grow tomatoes and peppers in her greenhouse.  She may also spend part of the money on fertilizer and pesticides. Enisa will be busy in the early fall planting these seeds after the weather has cooled down and growing conditions are optimal.

loans.use: To buy seeds & supplies for farming

loans.name: Yan

texts.en: Yan D., who is 60 years old and widowed, makes mats. She has been making mats since 2001, earning approximately US $1 per day. She lives with one daughter in Lvea Commune in the Siem Reap Province. Her daughter, who is 21 years old, is a hairdresser near the house. Because of increasing traveling expenses, Yan would like to request a loan to purchase a motorcycle to reduce expenses. The loan will be improving her family's living conditions. Yan's daughter is pictured becuase Yan is unavailable.

loans.use: Purchasing a motorcycle

loans.name: Tina

texts.en: Tina lives in Ajamgbadi, Lagos state, Nigeria. She sells baby care products like baby cream,  clothes, oil, and powder. She also sells bags and shoes.  Tina has been in this business for the past two years. She is a LAPO client.  Tina is 44 years old and married with 4 children.  Tina needs a loan of $1200 to buy more baby care products, bags and shoes to sell. She thanks all Kiva lenders and LAPO MICROFINANCE.

loans.use: To buy more baby care products, bags and shoes to sell

loans.name: Juliette

texts.fr: Née vers 1967à Abomey, l'une des villes historiques situé au centre du BENIN, dame E. Juliette est mariée et mère de quatre enfants dont l'aîné Agossi est mariée et n'est plus à sa charge, Roger âgé de 17ans est en classe de Seconde au cours secondaire, Yvette âgée de 14 ans est en classe de Quatrième et Innocent âgé de 9ans est en classe de cinquième. Désireuse d'augmenter son stock en période de fête afin de faire  face à la demande de sa clientèle, elle vient solliciter son troisième crédit qui lui permettra de se donner de nouveaux élans.
texts.en:
Mrs. Juliette E. was born circa 1967 in Abomey, one of the historical towns in Central Benin. She's married and the mother of four children, out of which the eldest, Agossi, is married and is no longer in her care. Roger (age 17), Yvette (age 14), and Innocent (age 9) all attend school. Wishing to bolster her stock during the holiday period to meet customer demand, she's seeking a third loan that will give her a new boost.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy two sacks of rice, two sacks of corn and five cans of peanut oil

loans.name: Sud Métal Group

texts.fr: Ce groupe de soudeurs métallique est animé par Ansoumana S.. Situé sur le boulevard 54m à Tiléne, ils arrivent à réaliser beaucoup d'activités. Ils sollicitent ce prêt pour renforcer leur fond de roulement et acheter du fer.
texts.en:
This group of welders is organized by Ansoumana S.. Located on Boulevard 54m in Tiléne, they manage to get a lot of different work done. They are asking for this loan to bolster their working capital and buy iron.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: buying iron for welding

loans.name: Dilrabo

texts.en:
Dilrabo G. was born in 1972 in Khujand. She is a single mother of 2 pretty children and she is full of enthusiasm. Dilrabo is engaged in selling children's wear in the local bazaar where she has an outlet. She brings her assortment of goods from Istaravshan and the Kyrgyz Republic 2 times per month.

Mrs. Dilrabo G. is asking KIVA for financial support in the form of a business development loan of 450 TJS for 1 month to purchase new inventory and increase her assortment of goods.

loans.use: to increase her assortment of inventory

loans.name: Le Thi

texts.vi: Chị Lê Thị N., 25 tuổi. Gia đình chị  có 2 con nhỏ. Chị tham gia vào quỹ từ năm 2005, Tuy còn trẻ nhưng với sự chăm chỉ và sử dụng nguồn vốn vay  vào chăn nuôi và buôn chim  có hiệu quả đã giúp cho gia đình có được nguồn thu nhập ổn định 3.000.000đ/ tháng.. Vòng vốn tới chị muốn vay 9000.000 để buôn bán chim.
texts.en:
Ms. Le Thi N., 25 years old, has two small children. She has joined TYM Fund (Kiva Partner in Vietnam) since 2005. Although still at a young age, Ms. N. knows how to use her loans effectively in raising animals and selling birds. This business gives her family a very stable source of income of 3,000,000 VND per month (equivalent to 175 USD per month). This loan cycle she wants to borrow 9,000,000 VND (about 525 USD) for her bird trading business.

Translated from Vietnamese by Phuong Nguyen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Raising

loans.name: Sabougnouma Group

texts.fr:
Les femmes du groupe Sabougnouma sont mariées, âgées de  25 à 55 ans, mères de 4 enfants en moyenne et vivent dans des familles traditionnelles élargies dans le quartier Ganabougou de Yanfolila (troisième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Ces femmes sont partenaires de Soro Yiriwaso  depuis 2 ans .Elles sont à leur quatrième prêt après avoir correctement  remboursées les trois précédents.
Avec ce prêt les femmes achètent chaque semaine, 1 sac de gros mil (sorgho), de la levure, du bois de chauffe et d’autres ingrédients pour la préparation de la bière locale. Les femmes s’entraident pour faire ce travail qui  demande l’utilisation d’une quantité importante de bois de chauffage, d’eau et beaucoup d’attention pour que le résultat donne une boisson de qualité. Elles gagnent chacune 10.000 FCFA dans la vente de la boisson par semaine. La grande vente se fait les jours de foire pendant lesquels affluent les villageois environnants.    
Cette activité permet aux femmes du groupe Sabougnouma de réaliser en   moyenne une marge bénéficiaire mensuelle de 40.000FCFA. Ce qui leur permet de rembourser l’échéance du prêt et de faire face à certains besoins du foyer (santé, éducation, habillement…etc.
texts.en:
The women of the group Sabougnouma are married mothers 25 to 55 years old who have four children on average. They live in traditional extended families in the Ganabougou district of Yanfolila (third administrative region of the Republic of Mali).

These women have been partners of Soro Yiriwaso for two years and are on their fourth solidarity loan after having correctly repaid the three preceding ones. With this new loan, the women buy each week: one sack of big millet (sorghum), some leavening, firewood, and other supplies for making the local beer. The women help one another in this work, which demands a sizable quantity of firewood, water, and a lot of attention, so as to produce a quality beverage.

They each earn 10,000 francs CFA in selling the beverage each week. The biggest sales are made on market days, during which villagers from surrounding areas abound. This business enables the women of the group to realize an average monthly profit margin of 40,000 francs allowing them to make loan payments and to address certain household needs (health, education, clothing… etc.).

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy ingredients for making the local beer

loans.name: Candida Rosa

texts.es: Candida Rosa Z. D. tiene 43 años, esta acompañada. Tiene 6 hijos. Y Todos sus hijos trabajan. La actividad económica a la que se dedica es una pulpería en la que vende los productos de pan, golosinas, refrescos y gaseosa. Hace más de siete años que se dedica a este oficio. Los propósitos para su negocio incrementar su pulpería y solo podrá realizarlo con la ayuda de los financiamientos. El financiamiento será utilizado para la compra de más productos que son necesarios para el uso diario. Los sueños para su negocio son de poseer otra pulpería y obtener otra fuente de ingresos para su familia. La cantidad solicitada es de C$ 12.000 córdobas a un plazo de 12 meses.
texts.en:
Candida Rosa Z. D. is 43 years old, has six children and lives with her partner. All of her children work. Candida has a local convenience shop where she sells bread, sweets and soft drinks. She has been doing this for seven years. Candida's plans for her business are to grow her shop and she can do this only with financial support. This loan will be used for the purchase of additional products necessary for daily use. Candida's dreams for her business are to own a second shop and have another source of income for her family. The amount requested is 12,000 córdobas [about US $600], which will be paid back in 12 months.

Translated from Spanish by Todd M. Anderson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: working capital

loans.name: Adama Mama

texts.fr:
Monsieur Adama Mama D. est un âgé de 33 ans et vit avec sa femme et son enfant  chez son père dans le quartier Hérémakono Centre de la ville de Bougouni (troisième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Adama a tenté plusieurs activités génératrices sans réussite notamment l’achat et la vente d’habits,  de chaussures, a même fait le chauffeur d’un particulier. Il  finit par opter pour la vente des boissons de fabrication industrielle depuis maintenant deux ans. Il  a entrepris ce créneau commercial (vente de boissons) par l’entremise de son oncle. Les fêtes religieuses et les grandes cérémonies (baptême, mariages) sont les occasions pendant lesquelles les ventes de boissons sont  considérables, sans oublier ces temps ci, période d’intense chaleur.
Dans ses recherches de ressources financières complémentaires il décida de faire recours à Soro Yiriwaso avec qui il est à son premier prêt individuel.
Il s’approvisionne à Bamako (capitale de la république du Mali) auprès des dépositaires agrées pour venir revendre à Bougouni à une clientèle composée de  boutiquiers, de restaurateurs et des détenteurs de bar. 
Avec ce prêt, Monsieur Adama Mama D. compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 40 000 FCFA.
 Dans les années à venir il envisage être un dépositaire de boissons à Bougouni.
texts.en:
Mr. Adama Mama D., 33, lives with his wife and child in his father's household in the Hérémakono Centre district of the town of Bougouni (third administrative region of the Republic of Mali).

Adama tried out several money-earning activities without success, notably buying and selling clothing and shoes, and he even tried out being a chauffeur for a private citizen. He ended up deciding to sell industrially-produced drinks and has been at this business for the last two years. He got into this commercial niche selling drinks with the help of his uncle. Religious holidays and important ceremonies (baptism, marriage) are occasions where a lot of drinks are sold, as is this season of the year where the weather is so very hot.

In his search for complementary financial resources, he decided to turn to Soro Yiriwaso with whom he is on his first individual loan.

He buys his merchandise in Bamako (capital of the Republic of Mali) from official depots and then sells it in Bougouni to a clientele composed of shopkeepers and restaurant and bar owners. With this loan Mr. Adama Mama D. expects to make a monthly profit of 40,000 F CFA. In the coming years, he hopes to have his own drinks depot in Bougouni.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of alcoholic and non-alcoholic (fizzy) drinks for re-sale

loans.name: Ayichatou

texts.fr:
A. Ayichatou est née vers 1947 à Porto-Novo, Capitale Administrative et Politique du BENIN. Ayichatou est veuve depuis vingt et un (21) ans; mais, Ayichatou n'a plus d'enfant à sa charge. Ayichatou est dans le commerce de divers(produits cosmétiques, pâtes alimentaires, boîtes de conserves, papiers hygiéniques, etc.)depuis son adolescence. Ayichatou a pu élever le niveau de son activité grâce aux deux prêts antérieurs qu'elle a eu de ALIDé. Ayichatou est satisfaite des services de ALIDé. Ayichatou a pour projet de continuer de développer son activité; c'est pourquoi elle sollicite un troisième crédit auprès de ALIDé. 

 
La signification de ALIDé en langue locale du Bénin, le Fon, est « un chemin existe toujours pour les plus pauvres ». Le Bénin est un petit pays de l’Afrique de l’Ouest à coté du Nigeria où le PIB par habitant est à $1,500. ALIDé offre les prêts spéciaux de 0% d’intérêt aux personnes très vulnérables et elle est dans un groupe qui lance bientôt un programme de la micro-assurance santé pour les bénéficiaires de micro crédit.
texts.en:
Ayichatou A. was born around 1947 in Porto-Novo, the administrative and political capital of Benin. Ayichatou has been a widow for 21 years; however, she is no longer raising any children. Ayichatou has been selling general merchandise (cosmetics, pasta, tinned foods, toilet paper, etc.) since her adolescence.

Ayichatou has been able to raise the level of her business thanks to two prior loans that she has received through ALIDé. Ayichatou is satisfied with the services of ALIDé. Her plan is to continue to develop her business; that is why she has requested a third loan from ALIDé. The significance of ALIDé in the local language of Bénin, Fon, is "there is always a pathway for the poorest of the poor". Bénin is a small country in West Africa next door to Nigeria; its GDP per inhabitant is US$ 1,500. ALIDé offers special loans at 0% interest to very vulnerable persons and it is in a group that will soon begin to offer a micro-insurance program (health insurance) for the beneficiaries of micro-loans.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of cases of: soap, sweet biscuits, pasta, and sugar; packages of toilet paper; tinned sardines

loans.name: Esperanza Janeth

texts.es:
Su esposo y ella pasaron por un momento muy duro economicamente, ella tenia que salir a trabajar fuera de la cuidad, para apoyar a su esposo con los gastos del hogar.

pero descuidaba mucho a su hijos, asi que comenzo con el negocio en casa, ya tiene 6 años desde que empezo vendiendo sus tacos a personal de las fabricas , bodegas, talleres , oficinas y vecinos de su colonia.

ella pide el apoyo para ampliar su negocio, construir una techo, para la temporada de lluvias, una plancha mas grande, asi poder hacer mas tacos, todo para brindar un mejor servicio a sus fieles clientes.
texts.en:
Esperanza’s husband and she are on hard times financially. She had to work outside the city limits, to help her husband with the household expenses. This caused her to neglect her children much, so she started a business from home and it has been 6-years since she started selling tacos at factories, corner stores, to tellers, offices and to residents of her colony.

She needs the assistance to grow her business, to construct a roof in time for the rainy season. She also needs a large grill to make more tacos and also to provide the best service to her loyal customers.

Translated from Spanish by Jenson Abraham, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To extend the business

loans.name: Koffi

texts.fr: Koffi G. est un acheteur de produits café-cacao. Il opère dans ce secteur depuis 7 ans et connaît tous les rouages du métier. Son activité consiste à acheter des ces produits auprès des agriculteurs et les revend aux exportateurs internationaux. Pour redonner de l’espoir à son activité, Koffi souhaite avec ce nouveau acheter des marchandises pour la revente. Cette aubaine lui permettra de donner mieux entretenir sa famille. Il faut noter que la photo est prise dans son salon.
texts.en:
Koffi G. is a coffee and cocoa buyer. He has been working in this sector for 7 years and knows all the tricks of the trade. His business consists in buying these products from the farmers and selling them to international exporters. To put some hope back into his business, Koffi hopes to use this new loan to buy these products for resale. This chance will allow him to do better by his family. Please note that his photo was taken in his living-room.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of cocoa and coffee for resale
