loans.name: Tashbubi

texts.ru: Ташбуви женщина 48 лет. Замужем и имеет 3-х детей. Занимается откормом и продажей скота вместе с мужем. Ташбуви откармливает скот дома, и когда скот будет готов, муж Ташбуви продает их на скотном рынке. Ташбуви кредитуется в нашей организации 1 год. Она успешно закончила предыдущий займ, и теперь хочет взять очередной займ. Ташбуви планирует увеличить количество своего скота и тем увеличить прибыль своей семьи. Ташбуви очень нравится условия нашего кредитования, и она рада, что есть такие организации, поддерживающие общество.
texts.en:
Tashbubi is a 48-year-old woman. She is married with three children. She and her husband work fattening and selling cattle. Tashbubi fattens the cattle at home, and when the cattle is ready, her husband sells them in the cattle market. Tashbubi has financed her business through our organization for a year. She successfully paid off the previous loan, and now wishes to take out another loan. Tashbubi plans to increase the quantity of the cattle she sells and thereby increase the family's profit. Tashbubi really appreciates our credit terms, and she is glad that there are organizations like this supporting society.

Translated from Russian by Melissa Kniazeva, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Fattening and selling livestock

loans.name: Valdemar

texts.en:
Valdemar and his family live in Drogobych, Western Ukraine. Valdemar sells men’s and women’s clothing in his home town. He launched his business 15 years ago. Ever since his business has flourished and grown to be a sustainable and profitable venture.

Today Valdemar is seeking a 12,000 Grivnya loan to re-stock his merchandise. He is hoping to increase assorted clothing merchandise he offers for sale in his kiosk and boost his sales as a result. Valdemar has proved to be a responsible borrower who has repaid all his previous loans without delinquencies.

loans.use: to re-stock his merchandise.

loans.name: Ezra

texts.en: Ezra is 56 and is a single mother of three children. She lives with her childen in Runyenjes. She is a committed member of the Runyenjes CBD group and her community. She is known for her humility and hard work. She has received and paid back three previous KMET loans which have helped her improve her community pharmacy. She currently requires a loan to enable her to purchase more drug supplies.

loans.use: Buy drugs for pharmacy

loans.name: Mely

texts.en:
36-year-old Mely M. owns a 2-hectare farm in their village. She has five children and a loving husband, Abeniden M., who helps her manage their business. The farm is really a big help especially in providing for education and the other needs of her children.

She would like to ask for a loan worth Php 10,000. She will use the loan to buy fertilizer and chemical to ensure that she will have an abundant harvest on her farm.

Now, she actively involves herself in CEVI cluster meetings. She receives not just loans but training and insurance as well.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer and chemicals

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: For making and selling food

loans.name: Aulelia

texts.en:
Aulelia is a member of the Dodoma road borrower group in Khesa,Iringa,she is 24 years old woman,she is married and a mother of 2 children,Her children are aged 5 and 1 years.

Aulelia started her own business selling food 2 years ago,she works 10 hours a day and earn monthly profit approximately 120,000 Tanzania shillings.

This is Aulelia`s first loan from BRAC_Tanzania,she requested the amount of 150,000 Tsh in order to buy more commodities for her food business.

With the additional profit she gains from the use of this loan,Aulelia hopes to save money,pay school fees,get more food for family and expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more rice,cooking oil,,sugar,beans

loans.name: Vilma

texts.es:
Vilma tiene 38 años, es una madre de familia muy amorosa, vive en su propia casa junto a su esposo Damián de 38 y sus 2 hijas; Liliana de 14 y Mildred de 10 años, a quienes desea dar una buena vida. Su librería está ubicada en uno de los barrios principales de la ciudad de Juliaca, la cual es muy concurrida por sus vecinos, ya que en ella pueden encontrar todo lo que necesitan. La atención que brinda Vilma es muy cordial y siempre está muy atenta a satisfacer todos los pedidos de sus clientes. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo, es que puede distribuir su tiempo entre la librería y sus labores del hogar, ya que su negocio funciona en su casa. Lleva 2 años con esta librería y considera que lo más difícil es tener que permanecer muchas horas en ella, ya que abre desde muy temprano y cierra tarde. Para el futuro espera hacer crecer su negocio y tener mejores ingresos económicos.
Este es el segundo préstamo de Vilma con MFP y espera poder pagar todas sus cuotas a tiempo, ya que no quiere perjudicar a las socias de su banco comunal, donde es muy querida, por la alegría que les da a sus compañeras. Con los quinientos nuevos soles solicitados comprará más mercadería para implementar mejor su librería.
texts.en:
Vilma , age 38, is a mother in a very loving family. She lives in her own house with her husband Damián, 38, and her two daughters, Lilana, age 14, and Mildred, age 10. She wants to give her family a good life.

Her bookstore is located in one of the principal neighborhoods of the city of Juliaca and is very popular with her neighbors since she is able to meet all their needs. Vilma offers service that is very cordial and always aimed at satisfying all the requests of her customers. What she likes most about her work is that, since her business operates in her house, she is able to split her time between the bookstore and her household duties. She has had this bookstore for 2 years and believes that the most difficult thing is having to spend many hours in it since it is open from very early and closes late. For the future, she hopes to increase her business and have better income.

This is Vilma’s second loan with MFP, and she hopes to be able to pay all her payments on time, for she doesn’t want to harm the members of her community bank, where she is highly appreciated because of the happiness that she gives her colleagues. With the 500 new soles applied for she will buy more merchandise in order to better establish her bookshop.

Translated from Spanish by Richard Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase in inventory

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
En el mercado central del departamento de Chinandega, la señora Juana N. T. se dedica a atender su propio negocio de venta de ropa cuya propietaria es ella misma ofreciendo todo tipo de ropa a sus clientes tanto para damas, caballeros y niños.

La razón por la que ella ha acudido a Ceprodel es para solicitar un crédito debido a que una vez mas requiere invertir en la compra de la ropa para ofrecerla a sus clientes y así mejorar sus condiciones de venta y por ende mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia.

loans.use: Compra de la ropa

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en:
Daniel M. is a married 43-year-old businessman. He operates a transport business, transporting primary-school children to and from home. He has been in the business for a period of two years. He gets a profit of about 14,500 Kenyan shillings (KES) per month.

M. was introduced to KADET by a group member and has never borrowed elsewhere. He wants to use the loan to improve his car for better service and to build and stock a small retail shop (kiosk) for his wife. He hopes to buy a new van for school transport to increase carrying capacity to over 100 children, from the current 30 children. He also wishes to open a good business for his wife.

About KADET:

The Kenya Agency for the Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) is dedicated to economically empowering clients by providing financial services to improve living conditions for micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Kenya. KADET is the microfinance subsidiary of World Vision Kenya. Obtain more information on KADET from the website: www.kadet.co.ke

loans.use: To improve his car for transport and build and stock a small retail shop (kiosk) for his spouse

loans.name: Hellen

texts.en: Hellen M. is currently in the business of retailing in her shop by selling beans, rice, sugar, etc., and is requesting a loan to buy more goods such as: cups, plates, jerrycans, etc. Hellen is 25 years old and is married to a soldier. She has three children and her children go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to open a new shop. About BRAC BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights and legal services, which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To buy more goods for her store

loans.name: Pampilo

texts.en:
This is Pampilo I., who is 59 years old.  He is married to Lydia, 48. They have three children: one is in college, the eldest is working and the other stays home.

Pampilo owns and manages a home-based manufacturing business. He makes snack items like banana chips, sweetened puffed corn and fish crackers. He hires an assistant in the work yard.  He earns close to 30,000 Philippine pesos a month. He is happy that one of his children has already finished college and another one is working his way towards graduation. He was also able to purchase property in the province. All these are fruits of his labor.    

Pampilo became an active member of the Center for Community Transformation (CCT) Credit Cooperative in 2005 and has since been enjoying many benefits from the cooperative. He is currently in need of additional capital for the continuity of his business. He applied for a P30,000 loan with CCT to augment his business needs.

He wishes for his small manufacturing station to become a factory soon.  He’s working double time nowadays because he still has two children to get through college.

About CCT

The Center for Community Transformation (CCT) is an organized Christian response against poverty and social injustice. This is carried out through the fusion of social-development initiatives and evangelical mission in a uniquely Filipino context. It serves urban and rural poor communities throughout the Philippines in pursuit of its desire to see changed lives, strong families and transformed communities centered in the Lordship of Jesus Christ.  CCT is a member of the Five Talents family.

loans.use: To purchase raw materials for the production of chips and crackers

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase retail stock such as sugar, salt, maize flour, beans, ground nuts, drinks, etc

loans.name: Benita

texts.en:
Benita E. is from the village of Balanlinao, Plaridel Mis. Occ. She is 60 years old. Benita is widowed and has 3 adult-aged children. To make a living, Benita owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector operating a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap, vinegar, soy sauce, sugar & toothpaste in the local community. Benita has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Benita joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Benita is requesting a new loan of 3000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Benita from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional daily-use products to sell

loans.name: Norminia

texts.es:
La señora Norminia, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Siempre Unidas”, Distrito de Tarapoto, Provincia de San Martin, Departamento de San Martín. Es Conviviente, tiene 33 años y es madre de 02 hijos, que aun dependen de ella.

Norminia, lleva 08 años dedicándose a la confección de vestidos, ya que teniendo conocimiento en este tipo de actividad, no dudo en implementar su propio taller de costura, ubicada en su misma casa, en un ambiente muy bien acondicionado, donde diariamente atiende a sus clientes fijos, que ya la conocen y necesitan el servicio. Trabaja con pedidos que con anticipación sus clientes le solicitan y siempre regalando una sonrisa y con amabilidad sus clientes se sienten muy contentos y satisfechos. En la actualidad, esta muy contenta y orgullosa por lo logrado. 

Con el préstamo de S/. 3,000.00, comprará telas en metros, de diferentes especies y colores, instrumentos que utiliza como tijeras, hilos en carretes grande y de variados colores, agujas de coser y de maquina, alfileres, botones. 

Hoy en día se siente una mujer muy realizada, con más ganas de alcanzar y hacer realidad sus demás sueños. Agradece al Movimiento Manuela Ramos por ayudarla a iniciar su negocio y también a muchas mujeres que  quieren crecer empresarialmente.
texts.en:
Norminia is a member of the “Siempre Unidas” (“Always United”) Communal Bank in the Tarapoto district of the province of San Martin. She is 33 years old, has 2 dependent children, and lives with her partner.

For 8 years, Norminia has been a seamstress. She has her own sewing studio in a very well-appointed area of her home. Every day she attends to her regular customers, who know her well and need her services. She takes orders for garments in advance and her customers always smile happily upon their delivery, very satisfied with her work. She is currently very pleased with and proud of what she has achieved.

She will use this loan for 3,000 Peruvian nuevos soles to purchase lengths of fabric in a variety of styles and colors as well as sewing supplies, including scissors, spools of thread in a variety of colors, needles, pins, and buttons.

Today, Norminia feels very fulfilled, and really wants to get ahead and realize the rest of her dreams. She is grateful to the Manuela Ramos Movement for helping her begin her business and for helping other women who want to be entrepreneurs.

Translated from Spanish by Kris Vickery, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of sewing supplies

loans.name: Elvie

texts.en:
Elvie C. is from the village of Libertad Bajo, Sinacaban, Misamis Occidental. She is 40 years old, is married and has four adult children. To make a living, Elvie owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising livestock. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from raising pigs for sale. Elvie has been engaged in her business for over 26 years and earns approximately 3,200 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2005, Elvie joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 14,900 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase livestock feed and other supplies. Elvie is requesting a new loan of 14,900 PHP which will also be used to purchase livestock feed and other supplies. This loan will be the eleventh loan which Elvie has taken out from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to make improvements to her house. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in north-western Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase livestock feed and other supplies

loans.name: Andres

texts.es:
Andrés G. D. L. R. es un joven que acaba D. adquirir su vivienda D. interés social y desea ir haciéndole mejoras para vivir cómodamente. El con ahorros puso unos barrotes que es lo que sostendrá el techo que quiere poner, pero para terminarlo le falto capital para comprar las laminas y así el patio D. su casa estar techado, como cuando su esposa lava L. ropa con las lluvias se le moja L. ropa y así es mas difícil que L. ropa se seque y tienen que meter L. ropa adentro D. L. casa y ocupa mucho espacio.
Es por eso que Andrés ve lo que batalL. su esposa y es por ello que quiere terminar su proyecto para darle mejor calidad D. vida a su esposa.
texts.en:
Andrés G. D. L. R. is a young man that just got his house through social services. He wants to make improvements on it to live comfortably. He used savings to install some cross pieces, which will support the roof that he wants to install. He does not have the money to purchase the metal sheets to finish it in order have a roof on the patio of his house. When his wife washes the clothes, they get wet with the rains, and it is more difficult for the clothes to dry. They have to put the clothes insiD. the house, and it takes up a lot of space. Andrés sees what his wife struggles with, and that is why he wants to finish his project to give his wife a better quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Build a roof

loans.name: Herbette

texts.fr: A. Herbette est née le 2 septembre 1970 à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin.  Il y a cinq ans que Herbette habite à Agblangandan dans la commune de Sèmè-Podji.  Herbette vit là-bas avec son mari, MITOMBAOU Félix, un chauffeur, et ses deux enfants.  Herbette n’a jamais fréquenté l’école, mais tous les enfants de Herbette sont scolarisés.  Le couple assure ensemble les charges de la famille.  Herbette vend des produits divers (riz, savon, lait, sardines) à son domicile. Herbette vend également de la nourriture à la devanture de sa maison. Herbette exerce cette activité depuis cinq ans et s’approvisionne à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin.  Herbette est à son troisième crédit à ALIDé.  Herbette a bien remboursé les deux premiers crédits et sollicite un troisième crédit pour renforcer surtout son activité de divers.
texts.en:
Herbette A. was born September 2, 1970, in Cotonou, the economic capital of Bénin. Herbette has lived in Agblangandan, in the township of Sèmè-Podji, for five years. Herbette lives there with her husband, Félix Mitombaou, a driver, and her two children. Herbette did not attend school, but both of her children attend school now. The couple shares the family responsibilities. Herbette sells various products (rice, soap, milk, sardines) from her home. She also sells food from a walk-up window at her home. Herbette has been doing this type of work for five years and gets her supplies in Dantokpa, the international market of Bénin. She is on her third loan with ALIDé. She fully repaid the first two loans and is requesting a third loan to further build up her business.

Translated from French by Shannon Arnold, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to purchase various products

loans.name: Benkadi Group

texts.fr:
Les sept membres du groupe Benkadi sont majoritairement des femmes mariées ayant une moyenne d’âge de 35 ans et 3 enfants. Elles vivent la plupart dans des familles polygames à Noumousso  un des quartiers de la ville de Kadiolo,  Sikasso (3ème région administrative  de la république du Mali). 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle et sont à leur quatrième  prêt solidaire. Tous les trois  prêts précédents se sont bien dénoués. 
Elles font l’achat et la vente du beurre de karité, des habits  pour enfants, des condiments alimentaires etc.
 Avec leur nouveau prêt, elles comptent acheter,  70 kg de beurre de karité, 3 douzaines d’habits  pour enfants et 5 paquets de condiments alimentaires. 
Elles s’approvisionnent au grand marché de Kadiolo ville et dans les villages avoisinants.  Elles revendent à Kadiolo ville, au marché, de façon fixe les jours de foires et de façon ambulante, au comptant souvent à crédit à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes.
 Elles envisagent réaliser chacune un bénéfice mensuel de 17.500 FCFA dont une partie sera utilisée pour l’épargne et les besoins de la famille, l’autre partie sera investie dans les activités.
Elles ambitionnent demander des prêts plus importants pour mieux satisfaire leurs clientèles et  pouvoir devenir grossiste.
texts.en:
The seven members of the Benkadi group are for the most part married, and average 35 years of age with three children. Most live in polygamous families in Noumousso, one of the neighborhoods of Kadiolo, in Sikasso (third administrative region of the Republic of Mali). They joined the Soro Yiriwaso MFI to satisfy their customers' needs, and are now requesting a fourth group loan. All three preceding loans were well handled. They buy and sell shea butter, children’s clothing, food condiments, etc. With their new loan, they will buy: 70 kilos of shea butter, three dozen sets of children’s clothes and five packages of food condiments. They get their supplies from the main market in Kadiolo and from villages in the surrounding area. They resell in fixed locations on market fair days at the Kadiolo market, and also as itinerant vendors, for cash but often for credit, to a customer base of both men and women. They expect to reach average monthly earnings of 17,500 FCFA each, of which part will go into savings and meeting family needs, and the remainder will be reinvested in the business activities. Their ambition is to request more significant loans to improve customer satisfaction and eventually become wholesalers.

Translated from French by René McConnell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy various items

loans.name: Kang

texts.en:
Mrs. T., 57, is a person on a low income who lives in a rural area of Phnom Penh, the capital of Cambodia, where she sells food to earn a living. She buys ingredients at the market and produces the food in her home. She starts selling food in the early evening and her buyers are people in her village. She was married, but her husband died. She has two daughters: one is a garment factory worker and the other assists her in selling food.

Mrs. T. has been trying to save up money in order to build a new house but her savings are still not enough to start the construction process. Therefore, she decided to request a loan to add to her savings in order to build a new house.

loans.use: To build a new house

loans.name: G.s. Quinta Rosa Group

texts.es: El grupo Solidario Quinta Rosa está conformado por Elizabeth Del Carmen y Maria De Los Ángeles ambas se dedican a diferentes actividades económicas. En el caso de Elizabeth ella se dedica a una pulpería, hace mas de 3 años, por lo que anteriormente no tenía un medio de ingreso para mantener a sus 2 hijos, fue por la necesidad de proporcionarles a sus hijos alimentación, vestimenta y estudios. Maria De Los Ángeles se dedica a la venta de comida hace mas de 2 años que se dedica a esta actividad, ella inicio por su abuela quien le asigno este negocio. es por eso que deciden unirse para solicitar este financiamiento para realizar las compras de sus productos que cada uno de sus negocios necesitan.
texts.en:
The Quinta Rosa communal bank is composed of Elizabeth Del Carmen and Maria De Los Ángeles; each is involved in a different commercial activity. Elizabeth has had a grocery store for the last 3 years; prior to this she did not have a reliable source of income to support her children and she needed to feed, clothe and educate them. Maria De Los Ángeles has sold prepared meals for over 2 years; she’s in this business because her grandmother started her out in it. They decided to join together to seek funding to buy the merchandise each needs for her respective business.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy merchandise.

loans.name: Gladys

texts.es: La sra. Gladys A. R. de  22 años de edad, es conviviente tiene 1 hijo menor. Vive en casa de de sus cuñados ubicada en el Caserio Casablanca. Trabaja como obrera de campo en empresas agroindustriales. Es una persona emprendedora, que gracias a su empeño logró adquirir sus bienes. Requiere el crédito para terminar de construir su vivienda. Su sueño es lograr construir toda su vivienda con el fin de alcanzar una mejor calidad de vida. Esta muy agradecida por el apoyo que le podamos brindar a través de este financiamiento.
texts.en:
Gladys A. R., age 22, is in a common law marriage and has one minor child. She lives in her brother-in-law’s house in the rural community of Casablanca. She is a field worker for agro-industrial businesses. She is a hard-working person, and thanks to her determination she was able to get her assets. She needs the loan to finish building her house. Her dream is to finish building her whole house in order to achieve a better quality of life. She is very grateful for the support we are able to offer through this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Improve her house

loans.name: Agusta Renee

texts.es:
Nuestra socia pertenece al banco comunal “MILAGROSA VIRGEN DEL CARMEN II”; Nuestra socia vive en el distrito de Huanchac en la provincia de Cusco, departamento de Cusco.

Nuestra socia es la  Sra. Renne,  ella tiene 55 años de edad es divorciada y tiene 1 hijo, Nuestra socia alterna sus actividades del hogar con el comercio minorista, ella tiene un bar snack en su casa en el primer piso, Nuestra socia trabaja aún para ayudar en los estudios superiores de su hijo, Nuestra socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en el bar e implementarlo y decorarlo.

Nuestra socia agradece y valora el apoyo brindado mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de su deuda en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Our member belongs to the “Milagrosa Virgen del Carmen II” communal bank. Our member lives in the district of Huanchac in the province of Cusco, department of Cusco. Our member is Renee. She is 55 years old, divorced, and has one child, a son. Our member alternates her household activities with her retail business. She has a snack bar on the ground floor of her house. Our member works so that she can help her son with his higher education. Our member is requesting the loan so that she can invest in her snack bar by restocking it and decorating it. Our member is very grateful for the support she is being given through this loan, and she agrees to complete her payments according to the terms of the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Christopher Knutson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Investing in her snack bar by restocking it and decorating it.
